  • DAD OF TWO DIES AFTER GPS DIRECTS HIM TO WASHED-AWAY BRIDGE, NORTH CAROLINA FAMILY SAYS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/tech/tech-news/2022/10/05/dad-of-two-dies-after-gps-directs-him-to-washed-away-bridge-north-carolina-family-says

    10/05/2022, 18:02

    60.71% Shortened!

    It was a rainy night, and Paxson‚Äôs GPS routed him to a bridge that didn‚Äôt exist

    That‚Äôs when his Jeep went over a concrete road, plunging into water

    ‚Äî Unsplash A father of two is dead after his GPS directed him to a bridge that washed away in 2013 in North Carolina, his family says

    Phil Paxson, 47, was driving home from his daughter‚Äôs ninth birthday celebration the night of Friday, Sept 30, his mother-in-law wrote in a Facebook post

    It was a rainy night, and Paxson‚Äôs GPS routed him to a bridge that didn‚Äôt exist

    That‚Äôs when his Jeep went over a concrete road, plunging into water

    Investigators say they determined that the roadway is not owned or managed by the North Carolina Department of Transportation

    It is meeting with attorneys to determine who is responsible for the road

    ‚ÄúThis was a known hazard,‚Äù Paxson‚Äôs wife wrote in a Facebook post

    Report it to us

  • NAJIB FILES LAWSUIT AGAINST HOME MINISTER, PRISON COMMISSIONER-GENERAL IN BID TO ATTEND PARLIAMENT AS MP

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/05/najib-files-lawsuit-against-home-minister-prison-commissioner-general-in-bid-to-attend-parliament-as-mp/31846

    10/05/2022, 17:36

    42.11% Shortened!

    Najib‚Äôs lawyer Muhammad Farhan Muhammad Shafee confirmed to Malay Mail that his client‚Äôs application for judicial review was filed at the High Court in Kuala Lumpur this afternoon at around 1pm

    Muhammad Farhan confirmed that the scheduled Dewan Rakyat dates which Najib was seeking to attend are the dates from October 3 to November 29

    Shahid is scheduled to hear Najib‚Äôs application for leave for judicial review on October 12

    In this lawsuit, Najib is seeking six main reliefs or court orders, including a certiorari order to quash or set aside the commissioner-general‚Äôs decision to not allow Najib access to his officers or aides for parliamentary, legislative and constituent work

    The remaining three court orders sought by Najib are for a certiorari order to quash or set aside the commissioner-general‚Äôs decision to not allow him to attend Parliament on the scheduled dates of Parliament sittings; and a declaration that he is ‚Äúentitled‚Äù to attend Parliament on such dates; and a mandamus order to compel the respondents to take the necessary steps to allow his attendance of Parliament on such dates

    The full Dewan Rakyat schedule for the remaining meeting this year would be October 3 to 7, October 11 to 13, October 17 to 20, October 26 and 27, October 31 to November 3, November 7 to 10, November 14 to 17, November 21 to 24, and November 28 and 29

    Najib‚Äôs 1MDB trial before High Court judge Datuk Collin Lawrence Sequerah is currently scheduled to be heard on October 3 to 6, October 11 to 13, November 7 to 10, November 14 to 17, November 21 to 24, December 5 to 8, December 12 to 15, before continuing in January and February next year

    Najib‚Äôs lead defence lawyer Tan Sri Muhammad Shafee Abdullah had on Monday denied that the bid to have his client be allowed to attend Parliament is an attempt to delay the 1MDB trial

    Najib had on September 19 wrote to the Kajang Prison director-general to ask for access to his officers three times a week for parliament and constituent matters and to be allowed to attend Parliament under prison supervision to carry out his duties as MP

    In conveying the government‚Äôs and commissioner-general‚Äôs decision, the Kajang prison had in a September 28 letter informed Najib that his application had been rejected on security or safety reasons

    While Najib had filed an appeal to the home minister on September 30, the minister has yet to reply at the time the lawsuit was filed this afternoon.

    ['najib', 'file', 'court', 'attend', 'parliament']

  • MALAYSIA RATIFIES CPTPP

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/10/05/malaysia-ratifies-cptpp

    10/05/2022, 17:02

    52.17% Shortened!

    "In sum, the CPTPP places Malaysia in a strategic position, elevating our competitiveness in the global arena

    "As a bloc that advances regional economic integration, the CPTPP is also a testament to the significance of the multilateral trading system," it added

    According to Miti, the CPTPP will broaden Malaysia's access to new markets such as Canada, Mexico and Peru, which are not covered by any existing Free Trade Agreement (FTA)

    The CPTTP will also elevate Malaysia's prominence as a global trading economy and boos total trade to US$655.9bil in 2030

    "In addition, the findings of the CBA also indicate that Malaysia‚Äôs exports are projected to reach USD354.7bil in 2030, with trade balance remaining in strong surplus at 8.5% of GDP for the same year," said Miti

    Under the CPTPP, by January 1, 2033, almost 100% of Malaysian exports to all CPTTP countries will enjoy duty-free treatment

    According to Miti, as soon as the CPTPP enters into force for Malaysia, all of the country's exports to Australia and Singapore will enter these markets without being subjected to any duties

    Exports to New Zealand and Canada will be duty-free in 2024 and 2029 respectively

    In addition, Miti said the CPTPP contains trade-facilitative Rules of Origin (ROO) that are designed to support modern business practices and further promote deeper integration of Malaysian businesses into regional supply chains

    "The Agreement allows Malaysian manufacturers to source raw materials from all CPTPP countries for purposes of fulfilling the ROO requirements and consequently, qualifying for reduction and elimination of import duties," said Miti

    It added that Malaysian companies will also have immediate access to the government procurement markets of other CPTPP countries at much lower thresholds, as compared to the high thresholds committed by Malaysia

    ['malaysia', 'cptpp', 'trade', 'miti', 'country']

    "In sum, the CPTPP places Malaysia in a strategic position, elevating our competitiveness in the global arena

    "As a bloc that advances regional economic integration, the CPTPP is also a testament to the significance of the multilateral trading system," it added

    According to Miti, the CPTPP will broaden Malaysia's access to new markets such as Canada, Mexico and Peru, which are not covered by any existing Free Trade Agreement (FTA)

    The CPTTP will also elevate Malaysia's prominence as a global trading economy and boos total trade to US$655.9bil in 2030

    "In addition, the findings of the CBA also indicate that Malaysia‚Äôs exports are projected to reach USD354.7bil in 2030, with trade balance remaining in strong surplus at 8.5% of GDP for the same year," said Miti

    Under the CPTPP, by January 1, 2033, almost 100% of Malaysian exports to all CPTTP countries will enjoy duty-free treatment

    According to Miti, as soon as the CPTPP enters into force for Malaysia, all of the country's exports to Australia and Singapore will enter these markets without being subjected to any duties

    Exports to New Zealand and Canada will be duty-free in 2024 and 2029 respectively

    In addition, Miti said the CPTPP contains trade-facilitative Rules of Origin (ROO) that are designed to support modern business practices and further promote deeper integration of Malaysian businesses into regional supply chains

    "The Agreement allows Malaysian manufacturers to source raw materials from all CPTPP countries for purposes of fulfilling the ROO requirements and consequently, qualifying for reduction and elimination of import duties," said Miti

    It added that Malaysian companies will also have immediate access to the government procurement markets of other CPTPP countries at much lower thresholds, as compared to the high thresholds committed by Malaysia

    ['malaysia', 'cptpp', 'trade', 'miti', 'country']

    10/05/2022, 16:35

    50.0% Shortened!

    By Scott Kanowsky Investing.com -- European stock markets fell in early dealmaking on Wednesday, as a positive handover from Wall Street and Asia lost some steam

    The declines come after weak U.S

    Weighing on sentiment in Europe was the latest trade balance data out of Germany, which showed a narrowing in the country's surplus

    Exports to other European Union countries from Germany also contracted, in a possible sign of a slowdown in external demand for goods made by Germany's key manufacturing sector

    The move would mark the largest cut since the COVID-19 pandemic, and comes as OPEC+ looks to give renewed support to oil prices after a drastic fall since the middle of the year

  • NEWLY CROWNED MISS TOURISM 2022 HAS A KNACK FOR NUMBERS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/newly-crowned-miss-tourism-2022-has-a-knack-for-numbers

    10/05/2022, 16:35

    47.62% Shortened!

    As Ong grew into adulthood, she wanted to do something ‚Äògirly‚Äô for a change, something that showed her feminine side

    This year, she finally built up her courage and signed up for the Miss Sabah Tourism pageant and won, thus bringing her to the national level pageant held in Ipoh, Perak in September

    Ong said in Sabah for example, she wishes to highlight its nature and friendly people, as well as the uniqueness of Sabahans who live peacefully regardless of race and religion

    ‚ÄúI want to tell the world and fellow Malaysians how beautiful Sabah is, how wonderful the people are and the importance of tolerance, mutual respect and love for harmony,‚Äù she said

    However, she wants to also educate locals on the need to maintain their homestays or any tourist sites so that people will want to return for another visit

    ‚ÄúIt is also vital that we keep our home and country clean

    Nobody wants to visit a dirty place,‚Äù Ong said

    She also urged women to find courage to try something new, something they are afraid of and just widen their experience and knowledge in various fields

    She said they would be surprised at what they can accomplish, not to mention the wonderful experience gained, as well as the new friendships made throughout their journey by trying out something new.

    As Ong grew into adulthood, she wanted to do something ‚Äògirly‚Äô for a change, something that showed her feminine side

    This year, she finally built up her courage and signed up for the Miss Sabah Tourism pageant and won, thus bringing her to the national level pageant held in Ipoh, Perak in September

    Ong said in Sabah for example, she wishes to highlight its nature and friendly people, as well as the uniqueness of Sabahans who live peacefully regardless of race and religion

    ‚ÄúI want to tell the world and fellow Malaysians how beautiful Sabah is, how wonderful the people are and the importance of tolerance, mutual respect and love for harmony,‚Äù she said

    However, she wants to also educate locals on the need to maintain their homestays or any tourist sites so that people will want to return for another visit

    ‚ÄúIt is also vital that we keep our home and country clean

    Nobody wants to visit a dirty place,‚Äù Ong said

    She also urged women to find courage to try something new, something they are afraid of and just widen their experience and knowledge in various fields

    She said they would be surprised at what they can accomplish, not to mention the wonderful experience gained, as well as the new friendships made throughout their journey by trying out something new.

  • WALL STREET SEES S&P 500 FALLING FURTHER AFTER BEAR-MARKET BOUNCE

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/wall-street-sees-p-500-182412403.html

    42.11% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- Some of Wall Street‚Äôs biggest banks aren‚Äôt buying this stock-market rally

    On Tuesday, the bank joined other skeptics, including Goldman Sachs Group Inc

    and Bank of America Corp., in revising its year-end target for the S&P 500 to 3,500 from 4,450 in 2022, which implies a drop of nearly 5% from Monday‚Äôs close

    Valuation risks for the benchmark index ‚Äúwill persist well into 2023, and most downside in the coming months will come from slowing profitability,‚Äù which threatens to push the S&P 500 as low as 3,200 in the fourth quarter, according to Max Kettner, HSBC‚Äôs chief multi-asset strategist

    That puts the firm‚Äôs year-end target below the average of 4,346 in the last Bloomberg survey conducted in mid-September

    On Monday, Credit Suisse strategists lowered their year-end goal for the S&P 500 by 10% to 3,850, citing the prospect of weakening corporate earnings growth next year

    Last month, Goldman slashed its 2022 target for the index to 3,600 from 4,300 on a higher-rate scenario

    Despite this year‚Äôs selloff, Bank of America strategists led by Savita Subramanian said on Monday that there is ‚Äúno full capitulation on Wall Street yet.‚Äù Last month, Subramanian reaffirmed the bank‚Äôs year-end target of 3,600

    He sees an eventual low for the S&P 500 coming later this year, or early next, at around 3,000 to 3,400

    But the bank also believes stocks could rally back in the second half of next year

    ‚ÄúAs the Fed signals a pause or even an end to its rate hike cycle, this should bring some well-needed relief, lifting the S&P 500 to 4,000 by year-end 2023,‚Äù HSBC‚Äôs Kettner said

    ['bank', 'hsbc', 'year', 'end', 'target']

    (Bloomberg) -- Some of Wall Street‚Äôs biggest banks aren‚Äôt buying this stock-market rally

    On Tuesday, the bank joined other skeptics, including Goldman Sachs Group Inc

    and Bank of America Corp., in revising its year-end target for the S&P 500 to 3,500 from 4,450 in 2022, which implies a drop of nearly 5% from Monday‚Äôs close

    Valuation risks for the benchmark index ‚Äúwill persist well into 2023, and most downside in the coming months will come from slowing profitability,‚Äù which threatens to push the S&P 500 as low as 3,200 in the fourth quarter, according to Max Kettner, HSBC‚Äôs chief multi-asset strategist

    That puts the firm‚Äôs year-end target below the average of 4,346 in the last Bloomberg survey conducted in mid-September

    On Monday, Credit Suisse strategists lowered their year-end goal for the S&P 500 by 10% to 3,850, citing the prospect of weakening corporate earnings growth next year

    Last month, Goldman slashed its 2022 target for the index to 3,600 from 4,300 on a higher-rate scenario

    Despite this year‚Äôs selloff, Bank of America strategists led by Savita Subramanian said on Monday that there is ‚Äúno full capitulation on Wall Street yet.‚Äù Last month, Subramanian reaffirmed the bank‚Äôs year-end target of 3,600

    He sees an eventual low for the S&P 500 coming later this year, or early next, at around 3,000 to 3,400

    But the bank also believes stocks could rally back in the second half of next year

    ‚ÄúAs the Fed signals a pause or even an end to its rate hike cycle, this should bring some well-needed relief, lifting the S&P 500 to 4,000 by year-end 2023,‚Äù HSBC‚Äôs Kettner said

  • NAJIB'S 1MDB TRIAL: LAWYER SHAFEE APOLOGISES OVER RECENT MEDIA STATEMENT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/najib039s-1mdb-trial-lawyer-shafee-apologises-over-recent-media-statement

    10/05/2022, 15:35

    59.26% Shortened!

    Wednesday, 05 Oct 2022

    "My Lord, I profusely apologise to the court if there was misconstrue of the media statement

    The statement was accurate and with no exaggeration

    Muhammad Shafee said the statement was made in response to queries by media members about the money that was deposited into Najib's accounts

    At this juncture, senior Deputy Public Prosecutor Datuk Seri Gopal Sri Ram responded, saying that his only complaint was that Muhammad Shafee could have raised the matter in court

    Does he (Muhammad Shafee) expect us to go to the media and say Tan Sri Shafee is wrong? "I‚Äôm perfectly happy if he makes the complaint before your Lordship

    On Tuesday (Oct 4), Sri Ram warned Muhammad Shafee from conducting a trial in the media of the case

    It was in response to a media statement by Muhammad Shafee on Monday (Oct 3) which highlighted the inflow of funds into Najib's account in February and June 2011 amounting to about RM60.6mil (about US$20mil) from Saudi royalty, Prince Faisal Turki Al Saud

    Muhammad Shafee also said the prosecution had only highlighted the two transfer transactions, but did not highlight five other transfers into Najib's account between Aug 2011 and Aug 2012 which were allegedly from Prince Turki and the Ministry of Finance Riyadh amounting to about US$180mil

    Muhammad Shafee had also included letters from the former governor that were addressed to Najib, stating different sums of donations made to the former premier

    The trial then proceeded with 39th prosecution witness, former AmBank non-executive director Cheah Tek Kuang, taking the witness stand to be cross-examined by Muhammad Shafee

    ['najib', 'muhammad', 'shafee', 'medium', 'statement']

    This 10-seat version of the Staria is the true replacement for the Grand Starex, which can finally retire

    Three variants of the Staria 10-seater are available

    Both the Premium and this 10-seater share the same body

    It‚Äôs black Nappa leather for the Max variant, which is the the only one here to get a powered driver seat (eight-way adjustment with four-way lumbar)

    Hyundai Smartsense is reserved for the Max

    Aren‚Äôt there 11 seats? Indeed, the Staria is marketed in some markets as an 11-seater, and that extra seat is in the front row, an extension of the front passenger seat

    Great specs for the Max variant

    Now it‚Äôs a dilemma between the max variant, and the kia carnival 8 seater HS

    Max is value for money, but kia carnival 8 seater HS is more on the luxurious side

  • MAJOR CHANGES RECOMMENDED TO GEG BILL AHEAD OF OCT 6 TABLING

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/major-changes-recommended-to-geg-bill-ahead-of-oct-6-tabling

    10/05/2022, 15:05

    56.0% Shortened!

    Wednesday, 05 Oct 2022

    The PSSP was set up on Aug 2 to further scrutinise the proposed Tobacco and Smoking Control Bill (GEG) which was tabled by Health Minister Khairy Jamaluddin in Dewan Rakyat on July 27

    However, no vote was taken on the Bill during the second reading on Aug 2 with a motion passed instead to refer the matter to a bi-partisan PSSC

    The committee also recommended that a clause is also included to make community service a punishment for offenders

    The PSSC also agreed with the Attorney General's Chambers that those penalised under the GEG will not be subject to a criminal record or a non-registrability of smoking offence

    On Tuesday (Oct 4), Khairy said that the GEG Bill will be tabled in Parliament on Thursday

    He said the Bill could be passed by Dewan Rakyat on Thursday (Oct 6) or after the Budget 2023 debate

    However, he said it was uncertain if the Bill would be tabled in Dewan Negara if the Parliament is dissolved

    He noted that like other Bills that do not make it to Dewan Negara if Parliament is dissolved, it has to be tabled again in Dewan Rakyat by the new government

    Dewan Rakyat's meeting is scheduled to end on Nov 29 while Dewan Negara will meet from Nov 21 to Dec 7.

    Generational End Game Bill

    ['pssc', 'geg', 'bill', 'dewan', 'propose']

    Wednesday, 05 Oct 2022

    The PSSP was set up on Aug 2 to further scrutinise the proposed Tobacco and Smoking Control Bill (GEG) which was tabled by Health Minister Khairy Jamaluddin in Dewan Rakyat on July 27

    However, no vote was taken on the Bill during the second reading on Aug 2 with a motion passed instead to refer the matter to a bi-partisan PSSC

    The committee also recommended that a clause is also included to make community service a punishment for offenders

    The PSSC also agreed with the Attorney General's Chambers that those penalised under the GEG will not be subject to a criminal record or a non-registrability of smoking offence

    On Tuesday (Oct 4), Khairy said that the GEG Bill will be tabled in Parliament on Thursday

    He said the Bill could be passed by Dewan Rakyat on Thursday (Oct 6) or after the Budget 2023 debate

    However, he said it was uncertain if the Bill would be tabled in Dewan Negara if the Parliament is dissolved

    He noted that like other Bills that do not make it to Dewan Negara if Parliament is dissolved, it has to be tabled again in Dewan Rakyat by the new government

    Dewan Rakyat's meeting is scheduled to end on Nov 29 while Dewan Negara will meet from Nov 21 to Dec 7.

  • AFTER SRI RAM'S WARNING, SHAFEE AGREES TO STOP PUBLIC COMMENTS ON 1MDB PROSECUTION

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/05/after-sri-rams-warning-shafee-agrees-to-stop-public-comments-on-1mdb-prosecution/31790

    10/05/2022

    60.71% Shortened!

    ‚ÄúI must first of all profusely apologise to my learned friend if there was a misconstruction of the purpose of the media statement,‚Äù Shafee said in court, proffering an apology to lead prosecutor Datuk Seri Gopal Sri Ram who warned the defence yesterday against conducting the 1MDB trial through the media

    But Sri Ram maintained that Shafee‚Äôs actions took the trial outside the courtroom when it should rightly be conducted inside before the judge

    ‚ÄúMy only point is he could have raised this before Your Lordship, because he has to fight in court, we cannot fight in the media

    We are prepared to take any brickbats from my learned friend but before Your Lordship

    ‚ÄúI'm in an invidious position because I cannot respond to this, and I can only respond before Your Lordship, that is my difficulty

    I will be very grateful to my learned friend to refrain from doing this, if he has any complaint with how we conduct the case, he can place it before Your Lordship, I have no problem with it,‚Äù he said

    But Shafee alleged ‚Äúselective reporting‚Äù by certain media outlets covering the trial, purporting that the reporters focused on the prosecution's case and not the defence‚Äôs questions to witnesses during cross-examination

    But Shafee conceded that it was only ‚Äúfair‚Äù not to publicly comment on how the prosecution runs its case and limit his remarks to the media on how the defence does it when the judge pointed out that Sri Ram was saying that any comment on the way the prosecution is conducting the 1MDB case should be raised in the courtroom and not outside

    The judge said this was because the prosecution said it could not respond to Shafee's complaints if he made it outside of court

    ‚ÄúThat's fair enough,‚Äù Shafee reiterated

    Yesterday, Sri Ram told High Court that he objected strongly to Shafee‚Äôs press statement and said he will seek a court order against the defence lawyers if they continued to conduct the 1MDB trial through the media

    ['shafee', 'prosecution', 'medium', 'statement', '1mdb']

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/05/in-1mdb-trial-ex-ambank-md-says-didnt-dare-press-najib-about-us100m-saudi-donation/31802

    10/05/2022, 14:05

    70.0% Shortened!

    Cheah had yesterday related in court how he had gone to Najib‚Äôs house to open a new personal account with AmIslamic Bank during which the latter directly told him that US$100 million would be deposited into the new account

    According to Cheah, Najib said the money was from Saudi Arabia and purported it was a donation for his ‚ÄúIslamic activity‚Äù

    Today, Cheah reiterated that Najib volunteered the information about the US$100 million ‚Äúdonation‚Äù from the Saudi Arabian government

    In his testimony yesterday, Cheah related that he had met privately with Bank Negara Malaysia (BNM) governor Tan Sri Zeti Akhtar Aziz to tell her about Najib‚Äôs new bank account and the latter‚Äôs expectation of US$100 million from Saudi Arabia

    Cheah agreed with Shafee today that it was a private bank account and that it was just a matter of courtesy for him to inform the BNM governor about it

    Datuk Seri Najib must follow all the rules,‚Äù Cheah added

    Meeting Najib at his house for opening of account Cheah said AmBank's then relationship manager Joanna Yu informed him in 2011 that ‚ÄúVVIP‚Äù client Najib wanted to open an account with the bank, and she felt it was not good protocol-wise for her to meet the then prime minister

    Cheah said it was the first time he was dealing with Najib, adding that Azman asked him to attend to the matter of helping Najib open the bank account

    Cheah said Azlin sent a driver to pick him up from his house to go to Najib‚Äôs, confirming that they were the only two occupants in the car

    But Chea affirmed that he saw Low Taek Jho ‚Äì better known as Jho Low ‚Äî at Najib‚Äôs house during that visit when asked by Shafee

    He confirmed that he met Najib alone to set up the latter‚Äôs bank account

    Najib's wife Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor, who was in the courtroom also giggled at parts of Cheah's testimony

  • FINDING THEIR BODIES: INDONESIAN FAN'S DESPERATE SEARCH FOR FAMILY AFTER SOCCER STAMPEDE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/10/05/fan-loses-wife-two-teenage-daughters-in-indonesia-soccer-stampede

    10/05/2022, 14:02

    57.69% Shortened!

    Wednesday, 05 Oct 2022

    A picture of Andi Hariyanto and his late wife Gebi Asta Putri Purwoko, who died in a recent riot and stampede following a soccer match between Arema FC and Persebaya Surabaya at Kanjuruhan stadium, hangs on a wall at his house in Malang, East Java province, Indonesia, October 4, 2022

    Watching local team Arema FC play on Saturday was a special outing for soccer fan Andi's family, including his two-year-old son

    The overcrowded stadium in Malang in Indonesia's East Java province descended into chaos after police fired tear gas to disperse agitated fans who had poured on to the pitch at the end of the match

    It was one of the world's worst stadium disasters

    Though they stayed in the stands, Andi, holding his son in his arms, got separated from his wife and daughters

    Sputtering and stumbling through the tear gas, they managed to get to medics for help

    Soccer's world governing body FIFA bans the use of "crowd control gas" at matches and an Indonesian police watchdog has said some officers wrongly used tear gas inside the stadium when there were no orders to do so

    I was struggling to find their mother," he said, adding that his 34-year-old wife was injured and succumbed later in hospital

    "I will never watch (soccer matches) anymore

    Now what is important is how to get food tomorrow," Andi said

    ['andi', 'wife', 'match', 'stadium', 'say']

    Wednesday, 05 Oct 2022

    A picture of Andi Hariyanto and his late wife Gebi Asta Putri Purwoko, who died in a recent riot and stampede following a soccer match between Arema FC and Persebaya Surabaya at Kanjuruhan stadium, hangs on a wall at his house in Malang, East Java province, Indonesia, October 4, 2022

    Watching local team Arema FC play on Saturday was a special outing for soccer fan Andi's family, including his two-year-old son

    The overcrowded stadium in Malang in Indonesia's East Java province descended into chaos after police fired tear gas to disperse agitated fans who had poured on to the pitch at the end of the match

    It was one of the world's worst stadium disasters

    Though they stayed in the stands, Andi, holding his son in his arms, got separated from his wife and daughters

    Sputtering and stumbling through the tear gas, they managed to get to medics for help

    Soccer's world governing body FIFA bans the use of "crowd control gas" at matches and an Indonesian police watchdog has said some officers wrongly used tear gas inside the stadium when there were no orders to do so

    I was struggling to find their mother," he said, adding that his 34-year-old wife was injured and succumbed later in hospital

    "I will never watch (soccer matches) anymore

    Now what is important is how to get food tomorrow," Andi said

    ['andi', 'wife', 'match', 'stadium', 'say']



  • 18 DETAINED IN CONNECTION WITH KIDNAPPING PALESTINIAN MAN

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/18-detained-in-connection-with-kidnapping-palestinian-man

    10/05/2022, 13:35

    50.0% Shortened!

    Wednesday, 05 Oct 2022

    Kuala Lumpur police chief Comm Datuk Azmi Abu Kassim said the 31-year-old victim was kidnapped at about 11pm on Sept 28

    A man emerged and dragged the victim into the vehicle before they drove away," he told reporters at the KL police headquarters on Wednesday (Oct 5)

    His friend then lodged a police report at Dang Wangi police headquarters at 1am on Sept 29, he said

    "We formed a task force of teams from the KL and Dang Wangi police headquarters to track down the victim," he added

    The task forces led by KL deputy CID chief Asst Comm Nasri Mansor managed to rescue the victim in Kuala Langat and arrested 12 Malaysian men and an Indonesian man late afternoon on Sept 29, Comm Azmi said

    "We are still tracking down the mastermind of the kidnapping, who is still at large," he said

    "Nonetheless, we are still investigating the motive behind the kidnapping

    "The victim is a tourist who arrived on Sept 21 to visit his 38-year-old friend, who is studying in Nilai, Negri Sembilan

    His friend arrived in Malaysia on Sept 4," he said

    Comm Datuk Azmi Abu Kassim

    ['kidnapping', 'man', 'police', 'comm', 'say']

    Not only that, KDI Invest also offers no lock-in periods, meaning you can buy, sell and switch your investments immediately after redeeming them if you so wish to

    There are also no additional costs when you switch, sell or buy assets

    Additionally, for optimised convenience, KDI is also increasing its FPX limit from RM30k to RM300k

    This means that you no longer have to write offline cheques to bank in amounts above RM30k, and can seamlessly transfer larger amounts of money online instead! KDI Invest is offering a unique 100029 code that entitles users to a RM20* bonus on their first investment in KDI Invest with a min

    You can also follow them on Facebook, Youtube and TikTok or visit their website to learn more

  • BANKS FINANCING MUSK'S TWITTER DEAL FACE HEFTY LOSSES

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/banks-financing-musks-twitter-deal-030554409.html

    42.86% Shortened!

    By Anirban Sen (Reuters) - Elon Musk's U-turn on buying Twitter Inc could not have come at a worse time for the banks funding a large portion of the $44 billion deal and they could be facing significant losses

    As in any large acquisition, banks would look to sell the debt to get it off their books

    While Musk will provide much of $44 billion by selling down his stake in electric vehicle maker Tesla Inc and by leaning on equity financing from large investors, major banks have committed to provide $12.5 billion

    They include Morgan Stanley, Bank of America Corp and Barclays Plc

    Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc, BNP Paribas SA, Mizuho Financial Group Inc and Societe Generale SA are also part of the syndicate

    The Twitter debt package is comprised of $6.5 billion in leveraged loans, $3 billion in secured bonds, and another $3 billion in unsecured bonds

    "The banks have their backs to the wall - they have no choice but to finance the deal." Leveraged financing sources have also previously told Reuters that potential losses for Wall Street banks involved in the Twitter debt in such a market could run to hundreds of millions of dollars

    Societe Generale did not respond to a request for comment while the other banks declined to comment

    Twitter also declined to comment

    Musk did not immediately respond to a request for comment

    Just last week, a group of lenders had to cancel efforts to sell $3.9 billion of debt that financed Apollo Global Management Inc's deal to buy telecom and broadband assets from Lumen Technologies Inc

    That came on the heels of a group of banks having to take a $700 million loss on the sale of about $4.55 billion in debt backing the leveraged buyout of business software company Citrix Systems Inc

    ['inc', 'bank', 'billion', 'deal', 'debt']

  • SINGAPORE SEES DRAMATIC RISE OF 6888 NEW COVID-19 CASES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/10/05/singapore-sees-dramatic-rise-of-6888-new-covid-19-cases

    10/05/2022, 11:05

    60.71% Shortened!

    There is usually a spike in case numbers on Tuesdays, due to people socialising over the weekend

    There is usually a spike in case numbers on Tuesdays, due to people socialising over the weekend

    The increase comes days after the return of the F1 Grand Prix race that attracted more than 300,000 people at the weekend

    The race was not held in the last two years during the Covid-19 pandemic

    Another likely reason for the spike is the large number of people now moving in and out of the country, not just for F1, added Professor Tambyah

    The week-on-week infection ratio was at 1.56, and over the last 28 days, 68,891 people have tested positive

    Dr Leong said this trend is normal and each new variant will bring a spike in numbers before the situation settles again

    He said, so far, most people are reporting only a mild cough and sore throat and perhaps, a fever that will last for a few days

    ‚ÄúAs long as the hospitalised or intensive care case numbers do not spike up significantly, it is acceptable,‚Äù he added

    The MOH website on Tuesday said 286 people were in hospital, up from 257 the day before

    There were 11 people in the intensive care unit (ICU) and 28 on oxygen supplementation

    ['spike', 'case', 'number', 'people', 'day']

    https://paultan.org/2022/10/05/2022-mazda-cx-3-officially-launched-in-malaysia/

    10/05/2022

    69.44% Shortened!

    It should be noted that the crossover is now fully imported (CBU) from Thailand, where it is assembled by AutoAlliance Thailand (AAT) at Mazda‚Äôs plant in Rayong ‚Äì it was previously a CBU Japan model

    Going up to the mid-spec 2.0L Core at RM118,159, you get a 2.0 litre version of the Skyactiv-G that is also used in the 2.0L High

    The powertrains also come with Mazda‚Äôs G-Vectoring Control (GVC) that uses engine timing to control chassis dynamics for smoother, more accurate steering inputs

    Both Core variants get the same level of equipment, with their engines being the only thing justifying the RM10,289 price gap between them

    inside, the Core variants also miss out on the High‚Äôs head-up display, paddle shifters, Qi wireless charger and powered driver‚Äôs seat

    2022 Mazda CX-3 price list; click to enlarge Elsewhere, the Mazda Connect infotainment system is the same as the one the High got during the March update

    On safety and driver assists, the Core variants only get two airbags (the High gets six) and the usual array of passive systems (ABS, EBD, Dynamic Stability Control, traction control, Hill Launch Assist, brake auto hold, ISOFIX child seat anchors)

    Now low spec get 2 airbags, No 6 airbags.

    Now low spec use Mazda2 1.5L

    mazda malaysia honestly sucks

    The older Mazda with the Skyactiv Direct Injection is suffering from Carbon Build Up, more misfiring problem and heavier fuel consumption

    Sign up to the free Arsenal newsletter so you don't miss the latest Gunners news, straight to your inbox We have more newsletters Arsenal were linked with a move for former Nottingham Forest loanee and Middlesbrough right-back Djed Spence before he instead moved to Tottenham in the summer

    Arsenal however have been delighted with the performances of Ben White in what was an unorthodox position at right-back, although he could hardly be described in that sense now

    Whilst the performances of White have vindicated the decision not to sign a right-back such as Spence this summer, Conte himself has provided a further explanation, although indirectly, of why Arsenal were right not to sign the 22-year-old

    ‚ÄúI try to do the best for the team

    If they trust me, then they trust me, but the choices are mine

    ‚ÄúAlso, Doherty last season played every game

    I try to put the best team, to pick the best team

    If they trust me, it's ok, if they don't trust me then I'm the coach and I need to take the best decision for Tottenham.‚Äù Frosty

    And from an Arsenal perspective, it is personally great to see what a North London Derby defeat is doing to our North London rivals

    However, if after these comments about Doherty, were Spence not to start, it would be quite the statement and further validation to Arsenal‚Äôs decision not to pursue the player

  • CAVE TEMPLE TO REMAIN IN LIMESTONE HILLS, HIGH COURT RULES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/cave-temple-to-remain-in-limestone-hills-high-court-rules

    10/05/2022, 08:35

    45.0% Shortened!

    A cement company‚Äôs bid to evict the monks of the temple has been dismissed by the High Court here

    When met outside the courtroom yesterday, monastery abbot Chiong Sai Tin said they were happy with the outcome

    ‚ÄúWe are relieved that we can stay on at the monastery peacefully

    ‚ÄúWe will hold a special prayer to mark this day, and we hope the company will not come for us again.‚Äù Also present were about 20 other monks and devotees

    The century- old monastery claims that in Gunung Kanthan in Chemor, Perak

    The company had filed the Order 89 application at the High Court in January last year to evict the monks by claiming that they were unlawful and unknown squatters

    The monastery‚Äôs spokesman, Leong Cheok Keng, who is also Malim Nawar assemblyman, said the house of worship has been there for a century and should be preserved

    ‚ÄúSpecial flora and fauna species can only be found on the hill.‚Äù Geologists say there are many endangered species found in the five million-year-old limestone hills

    ‚ÄúWe are happy with the verdict,‚Äù said Leong

    ‚ÄúThe monastery has also declined to request costs from the plaintiff as this is of public interest

    The plaintiff can still make an appeal or make a civil case, but we hope that they will leave the monastery alone.‚Äù The monastery‚Äôs legal team was led by Chan Kok Leong while the company was represented by Nimisha Jaya Gobi and Vong Sze Xin.

    ['monk', 'devotee', 'cave', 'monastery', 'high']

    The monastery‚Äôs spokesman, Leong Cheok Keng, who is also Malim Nawar assemblyman, said the house of worship has been there for a century and should be preserved

  • BUDGET 2023: CAN PM ISMAIL SABRI PLEASE EVERYONE WITH AN ELECTION BUDGET?

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/05/budget-2023-can-pm-ismail-sabri-please-everyone-with-an-election-budget/30915

    10/05/2022, 08:05

    59.26% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 5 ‚Äî Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob's government will be tabling only his second federal Budget on October 7 but it could be the most significant one for his political career

    With the 14th Parliamentary term set to expire by next July, Budget 2023 will be an ‚Äúelection Budget‚Äù ‚Äî to be tabled by Finance Minister Datuk Seri Tengku Zafrul Abdul Aziz ‚Äî regardless of when the 15th general election is held

    Still, the country‚Äôs ninth prime minister is expected to unveil a spending plan that will push his approval ratings up, which means it‚Äôs more than likely to be an expansionary Budget

    ‚ÄúGiven that this is an election Budget, we will likely see some form of bigger spending in terms of government expenditure,‚Äù said Shazwan Mustafa Kamal, associate director at Vriens & Partners, a political risk consultancy

    No political party can confidently predict how this demographic will cast their votes, or if they will even turn up, posing a challenge for Ismail Sabri and his party as they formulate next year‚Äôs spending plan

    It stands at 2.5 per cent at the moment, still lower than pre-Covid levels

    ‚ÄúGiven that this Budget will be tabled before the next general election, we expect it to be election friendly with expansionary measures (i.e

    Prices of food items rose sharply by over seven per cent in August compared to the same month last year, driving overall inflation up to 4.7 per cent, Department of Statistic Malaysia‚Äôs inflation data showed

    Analysts predict the Ismail Sabri-led government will not only continue with cash handouts and subsidies for targeted groups, but may also announce a higher tax relief for the middle class as well as small- and medium-sized enterprises

    ‚ÄúWe do not expect any new taxes to be introduced for 2023 but the government will further enhance tax compliance and collection..

    in other words, a reintroduction of goods and service tax (GST) at a lower rate than the previous 6 per cent is not expected to be announced,‚Äù UOB analysts said.

    ['ismail', 'sabri', 'government', 'budget', 'expect']

    With the 14th Parliamentary term set to expire by next July, Budget 2023 will be an ‚Äúelection Budget‚Äù ‚Äî to be tabled by Finance Minister Datuk Seri Tengku Zafrul Abdul Aziz ‚Äî regardless of when the 15th general election is held

  • 'ZETI KNEW OF NAJIB'S US$100MIL'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/zeti-knew-of-najibs-us100mil

    10/05/2022, 08:05

    57.69% Shortened!

    The process was all done by the book, said AmBank‚Äôs non-independent and non-executive director Cheah Tek Kuang, who helped Najib open the current account

    According to Cheah, Azman declined and instructed him to meet with Najib

    The process to open Najib‚Äôs account, Cheah said, was quite special due to his stature as the prime minister at the time

    He could not recall when he met Najib at his Bukit Tunku home, but said that during the meeting, Najib mentioned the money that was coming into the new account

    After the meeting with Najib, Cheah set up a meeting with Zeti to inform her about the opening of the 694 account and the incoming US$100mil from Saudi Arabia

    Cheah said only he and Zeti were at the ‚Äúsecret meeting‚Äù as it involved the interest of the then prime minister

    ‚ÄúZeti took note of the matter and asked that it be done in accordance with the regulations of the bank and the central bank,‚Äù he added

    ‚ÄúI agreed to the code name ‚ÄòAmPrivate Banking ‚Äì MR‚Äô for Najib‚Äôs account to avoid misuse of private information,‚Äù Cheah said

    A letter was also sent to Zeti to inform her of the code name, which would make it easier for the central bank to monitor the account

    ‚ÄúI am not sure if Najib knew about the code name, but this is a matter that falls under the bank‚Äôs operation, hence it was the operations‚Äô duty to choose the codename,‚Äù he said.Cheah, whose contract as managing director ended in 2012, said that after the opening of the account, he was no longer involved

    He was later appointed as the bank‚Äôs non-independent and non- executive director

    ['bank', 'najib', 'account', 'zeti', 'say']

  • 'NON-HALAL' LIFT AN ORDER BY JAKIM, SAYS HOTEL

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/non-halal-lift-an-order-by-jakim-says-hotel

    10/05/2022, 07:35

    50.0% Shortened!

    The hotel came under fire after lawyer and social activist Siti Kassim posted a picture of the ‚Äúnon-halal lift‚Äù on social media and questioned the rationale behind it

    A hotel spokesman explained that they had to have ‚Äúhalal‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-halal‚Äù lifts for the movement of goods and perishable items

    ‚ÄúIt is part of the halal certification requirements

    There can be cross-contamination with cash, in public transport, and even through donated blood

    ‚ÄúBusiness premises have to abide by a lot of rules to get halal certification, but they should also be brave and ask questions

    Why are we keeping quiet?‚Äù As of press time, Jakim has not responded to The Star over the issue

    Many Star Online readers were also irked by the situation, with one reader even highlighting that raw material in lifts do not touch the floor or the walls of the lift

    This is not the first time that ‚Äúnon-halal lift‚Äù issues have arisen

    In 2013, a similar incident took place at a hotel in Petaling Jaya

    For non-halal goods, please use the staircase.‚Äù The hotel, not wanting to evict its long-time Chinese restaurant tenant, was also obeying Jakim‚Äôs rules on the transport of non-halal food as part of its licensing requirements.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    The hotel came under fire after lawyer and social activist Siti Kassim posted a picture of the ‚Äúnon-halal lift‚Äù on social media and questioned the rationale behind it

    A hotel spokesman explained that they had to have ‚Äúhalal‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-halal‚Äù lifts for the movement of goods and perishable items

    ‚ÄúIt is part of the halal certification requirements

    There can be cross-contamination with cash, in public transport, and even through donated blood

    ‚ÄúBusiness premises have to abide by a lot of rules to get halal certification, but they should also be brave and ask questions

    Why are we keeping quiet?‚Äù As of press time, Jakim has not responded to The Star over the issue

    Many Star Online readers were also irked by the situation, with one reader even highlighting that raw material in lifts do not touch the floor or the walls of the lift

  • LONGER HOURS AND MORE PLACES TO VOTE IN GE15

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/longer-hours-and-more-places-to-vote-in-ge15

    10/05/2022, 07:35

    47.62% Shortened!

    These are among several improvements made by the Election Commission (EC) to allow the public more time to vote, said Minister in the Prime Minister‚Äôs Department (Parliament and Law) Datuk Seri Dr Wan Junaidi Tuanku Jaafar

    Mukhriz had asked about the EC‚Äôs measures to ensure a high voter turnout rate and to guarantee the transparency of the voting process

    During GE14 in 2018, the voter turnout was 82.32% and there were long queues at some polling centres

    Wan Junaidi said the number of voting centres and channels would be increased this time, taking into account Undi18 ‚Äì which lowered the voting age to 18 ‚Äì and automatic voter registration

    ‚ÄúThis is to avoid any congestion at the voting centres and channels,‚Äù he said

    The EC had said that there would be 9,560 polling centres for GE15, compared to 9,010 centres previously, while polling streams will increase from 29,054 to 38,990

    Wan Junaidi added that a special lane for voters aged 60 and above and the disabled group (OKU) will also be set up and limited to 450 voters

    The EC will also abolish the previous conditions for postal voting that were implemented in GE14, he added

    Those who were living in southern Thailand (Narathiwat, Pattani, Yala, Songkhla and Satun), Singapore, Brunei or Kalimantan, did not qualify for postal voting and had to come back to vote

    Report it to us

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    These are among several improvements made by the Election Commission (EC) to allow the public more time to vote, said Minister in the Prime Minister‚Äôs Department (Parliament and Law) Datuk Seri Dr Wan Junaidi Tuanku Jaafar

    Mukhriz had asked about the EC‚Äôs measures to ensure a high voter turnout rate and to guarantee the transparency of the voting process

    Wan Junaidi said the number of voting centres and channels would be increased this time, taking into account Undi18 ‚Äì which lowered the voting age to 18 ‚Äì and automatic voter registration

    ‚ÄúThis is to avoid any congestion at the voting centres and channels,‚Äù he said

  • NO MORE PARTY-HOPPING FROM TODAY

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/no-more-party-hopping-from-today

    10/05/2022, 07:35

    42.11% Shortened!

    The Minister in the Prime Minister‚Äôs Department (Parliament and Law) said the Royal Assent for the Bill was received yesterday

    ‚ÄúThe law will be enforced against any MP who switches parties from this date onwards,‚Äù he added

    The law received assent from the King on Aug 31 and was gazetted on Sept 6, but without the date of enforcement

    Following the enforcement of the anti-hopping law, Wan Junaidi said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob would now write to the state governments to adopt the law as part of their own state constitutions

    Although Sabah, Sarawak, Kelantan and Penang already have their own anti-hopping laws, Wan Junaidi said the Federal Government wanted the nation to have uniform laws against party hopping

    On another matter, Wan Junaidi said the Prime Minister had the sole discretion to determine Parliament‚Äôs dissolution, and as such was not bound to discuss it with anyone

    ‚ÄúSince Independence, the prime minister has not needed to discuss with the Cabinet the date for the dissolution of Parliament

    ‚ÄúIt is at the Prime Minister‚Äôs discretion,‚Äù he told a press conference in Parliament‚Äôs media centre yesterday

    Although Ismail Sabri did raise the matter with the Cabinet two weeks ago, Wan Junaidi said that discussion centred on seeking an audience with the King to propose a date to dissolve Parliament

    ‚ÄúIt is up to the discretion of the Prime Minister, and at least the idea (of dissolution) was discussed with the Cabinet,‚Äù Wan Junaidi added

    He said Ismail Sabri could also discuss the matter with selected leaders of his choosing, but reiterated that the King had the constitutional power to withhold consent to dissolve Parliament.

    ['hop', 'law', 'say', 'wan', 'junaidi']

    The Minister in the Prime Minister‚Äôs Department (Parliament and Law) said the Royal Assent for the Bill was received yesterday

    ‚ÄúThe law will be enforced against any MP who switches parties from this date onwards,‚Äù he added

    The law received assent from the King on Aug 31 and was gazetted on Sept 6, but without the date of enforcement

    Following the enforcement of the anti-hopping law, Wan Junaidi said Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob would now write to the state governments to adopt the law as part of their own state constitutions

    Although Sabah, Sarawak, Kelantan and Penang already have their own anti-hopping laws, Wan Junaidi said the Federal Government wanted the nation to have uniform laws against party hopping

    On another matter, Wan Junaidi said the Prime Minister had the sole discretion to determine Parliament‚Äôs dissolution, and as such was not bound to discuss it with anyone

    ‚ÄúSince Independence, the prime minister has not needed to discuss with the Cabinet the date for the dissolution of Parliament

    ‚ÄúIt is at the Prime Minister‚Äôs discretion,‚Äù he told a press conference in Parliament‚Äôs media centre yesterday

    Although Ismail Sabri did raise the matter with the Cabinet two weeks ago, Wan Junaidi said that discussion centred on seeking an audience with the King to propose a date to dissolve Parliament

    ‚ÄúIt is up to the discretion of the Prime Minister, and at least the idea (of dissolution) was discussed with the Cabinet,‚Äù Wan Junaidi added

    He said Ismail Sabri could also discuss the matter with selected leaders of his choosing, but reiterated that the King had the constitutional power to withhold consent to dissolve Parliament.

    ['hop', 'law', 'say', 'wan', 'junaidi']



  • READY FOR THE WORST OF MONSOON

    https://www.thestar.com.my/metro/metro-news/2022/10/05/ready-for-the-worst-of-monsoon

    10/05/2022, 07:35

    71.05% Shortened!

    On the Penang mainland, the Seberang Prai City Council (MBSP) will continuously carry out general cleaning to ensure that monsoon drains and other irrigation networks will not be clogged during the upcoming wet season

    ‚ÄúHowever, the frequency will also depend on the current condition of the monsoon drains which will be monitored weekly

    Meanwhile, a Penang Island City Council (MBPP) spokesman said the council had allocated RM2.07mil for flood mitigation and drainage maintenance in 2022 and the amount would be raised to RM2.86mil in its 2023 budget

    ‚Äì Filepic ‚ÄúWe will also give special attention to flood-prone hotspots,‚Äù said the spokesman

    He said MBPP had started conducting extra cleaning ahead of the wet season

    MBPP workers cleaning a drain near Pulau Tikus market and clearing floating rubbish (below) in a monsoon drain in flood-prone Jalan P

    ‚Äì Filepic It was reported that the Penang government had also appointed focal persons in every district to coordinate steps to be taken in emergencies

    The Fire and Rescue Services Department is also geared up to face the northeast monsoon, working closely with MBPP and the district disaster council

    Penang flood mitigation committee chairman Zairil Khir Johari said the Drainage and Irrigation Department had formed a flood squad which consisted of 131 staff members across five districts to patrol flood-prone areas during the monsoon season

    A new pump house near Sungai Juru in Seberang Prai is part of the state‚Äôs flood mitigation efforts

    He said this following the Meteorological Department‚Äôs (MetMalaysia) forecast that the northeast monsoon would last from November to March 2023

    ['penang', 'monsoon', 'drain', 'also', 'say']

    ‚ÄúHowever, the frequency will also depend on the current condition of the monsoon drains which will be monitored weekly

  • WE'RE NOT HEADED TOWARDS A CURRENCY CRISIS, SAYS FINANCE MINISTER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/05/were-not-headed-towards-a-currency-crisis-says-finance-minister

    10/05/2022, 07:35

    42.11% Shortened!

    ‚ÄúAlthough Bank Negara is not targeting any exchange rate, it is striving so that there will be no drastic or extreme change to the value of the ringgit

    Wong had wanted to know the measures being taken by the government through Bank Negara to mitigate the risks involving foreign currency exchange rates

    He said that one US dollar was worth RM2.122 during the 1998 Asian Financial Crisis, but the ringgit is now trading at 4.651 to the dollar currently

    Tengku Zafrul said the nation‚Äôs economic fundamentals remained positive despite the challenges to the global economy brought about by the Covid-19 pandemic

    He cited the introduction of dynamic hedging as an example of reducing risks for those in the currency market and business

    He added that this included attracting investors to the local bond market while improving the foreign currency exchange

    ‚ÄúOur currency dropped almost 54% in 1997, with the lowest exchange rate hitting RM4.88 to the dollar

    ‚ÄúThe nation‚Äôs share market was also badly affected, where the then Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange fell by some 800 points in just two months from 1,077 in June 1997 to 262.7 in September,‚Äù he said, describing it as the worst economic crisis ever faced by the nation, resulting in 102,000 Malaysians losing their jobs

    He noted that Bank Negara had also raised the interest rate to 11% to overcome the ringgit‚Äôs devaluation and to control inflation

    He said the situation is different now as the nation‚Äôs economy is more diversified and resilient

    ‚ÄúAs such, although we are facing some challenges due to external factors beyond the control of the government, our nation isn‚Äôt facing or headed towards an economic or currency crisis,‚Äù he said, adding that several other nations are also facing economic challenges due to current global events.

    ['bank', 'negara', 'ringgit', 'say', 'tengku']

    ‚ÄúAlthough Bank Negara is not targeting any exchange rate, it is striving so that there will be no drastic or extreme change to the value of the ringgit

    Wong had wanted to know the measures being taken by the government through Bank Negara to mitigate the risks involving foreign currency exchange rates

    He said that one US dollar was worth RM2.122 during the 1998 Asian Financial Crisis, but the ringgit is now trading at 4.651 to the dollar currently

    Tengku Zafrul said the nation‚Äôs economic fundamentals remained positive despite the challenges to the global economy brought about by the Covid-19 pandemic

    He cited the introduction of dynamic hedging as an example of reducing risks for those in the currency market and business

    He added that this included attracting investors to the local bond market while improving the foreign currency exchange

    ‚ÄúOur currency dropped almost 54% in 1997, with the lowest exchange rate hitting RM4.88 to the dollar

    ‚ÄúThe nation‚Äôs share market was also badly affected, where the then Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange fell by some 800 points in just two months from 1,077 in June 1997 to 262.7 in September,‚Äù he said, describing it as the worst economic crisis ever faced by the nation, resulting in 102,000 Malaysians losing their jobs

    He noted that Bank Negara had also raised the interest rate to 11% to overcome the ringgit‚Äôs devaluation and to control inflation

    He said the situation is different now as the nation‚Äôs economy is more diversified and resilient

    ‚ÄúAs such, although we are facing some challenges due to external factors beyond the control of the government, our nation isn‚Äôt facing or headed towards an economic or currency crisis,‚Äù he said, adding that several other nations are also facing economic challenges due to current global events.

    ['bank', 'negara', 'ringgit', 'say', 'tengku']

    By Yasin Ebrahim Investing.com -- The Dow soared for a second straight day Tuesday, riding high on hopes that the Fed could pivot from its hawkish path of monetary policy tightening as data showed signs of slowing labor demand.¬†¬† The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 2.8%, or 826 points, the Nasdaq was up 3.3%, and¬†the S&P 500 rose 3%

    If the slowdown in labor demand continues and core inflation, which excludes food and energy prices, ‚Äúfalls as much as we expect the Fed will not be hiking by 125bp by the year end,‚Äù Pantheon Macroeconomics said Tuesday

    The u-turn from Musk is ‚Äúa clear sign that Musk recognized heading into Delaware Court that the chances of winning [against] Twitter board was highly unlikely,‚Äù Wedbush said in a note

    (APO) is backing out of Twitter, Inc

    (TWTR) buyout financing for Elon Musk

  • NAPOLI THUMP AJAX AS DREAM CAMPAIGN CONTINUES WHILE BARCELONA PLACE IN CHAMPIONS LEAGUE UNDER THREAT AFTER...

    https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/20008009/ajax-1-napoli-6-champions-league/

    10/05/2022, 07:02

    67.65% Shortened!

    SERIE A table-toppers Napoli confirmed themselves as the dark horses in the Champions League with a barnstorming 6-1 win away at Ajax

    Napoli kick-started their Champions League group stage off with a 4-1 win over last season's finalists Liverpool

    And they smashed SIX past their final group opponents, Ajax, in their own back yard

    However, it sparked life into Napoli, who proceeded to score three before half-time

    The win keeps Napoli top of their group with Liverpool trailing just behind on six points, following a 2-0 home win over Rangers

    Hakan Calhanoglu netted the only goal of the game and with three games left in the group, Barca still need to play Bayern Munich again, who made light work of them last month

    Bayern are running away with Group C

    Group D saw the biggest shocks of the night

    Liverpool picked up a vital 2-0 win over Rangers in the Champions League on Tuesday, with Jurgen Klopp in positive spirits after the game

    Liverpool looked a more cohesive unit in the process, and speaking after the game, Klopp admitted he liked what he saw

    ‚ÄúGood game, the game we wanted to play,‚Äù Klopp said

    ‚ÄúIt was a really good defensive performance in a new team structure and offensively we created an awful lot

    I liked the game a lot.‚Äù The fact that Liverpool stayed in a 4-2-3-1 even when substitutes were made could suggest that they will again line up that way at Arsenal on Sunday

    Trent Alexander-Arnold roared back to form on Tuesday night, curling home a wonderful free-kick and setting Liverpool on their way to victory

    The right-back‚Äôs all-round game shone, both going forward and at the back, amid widespread criticism in recent weeks

    ‚ÄúHe played a good game, especially defensively, and scored a wonderful goal,‚Äù he added

    ‚ÄúTrent doesn‚Äôt have a defensive problem, we‚Äôve had a defensive problem, because our timing wasn‚Äôt right and we take risks defending

    ‚ÄúIt will happen ‚Äì it‚Äôs all good.‚Äù ¬† Liverpool‚Äôs form has been woeful by their extremely high standard and nobody will be more aware of that than the boss

    We are not over the moon about our situation, but tonight I saw a team fully committed and that‚Äôs what we have to do.‚Äù The real litmus test for Liverpool will now come in the form of Premier League leaders Arsenal on Sunday, before a trip to Ibrox next week and then the visit of Man City

    Earlier, the Reserve Bank of Australia surprised markets with a smaller-than-expected interest rate hike of 25 basis points

    Its cash rate rose to a nine-year peak after six rate hikes in as many months in a tightening cycle other central banks are engaged in as well

    "There's hope that the Federal Reserve at some point in the fourth quarter will say the same thing

    central bank and it "may take some time" to address

    San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said the central bank needs to deliver more rate hikes

    The S&P 500 posted two new 52-week highs and one new low; the Nasdaq Composite recorded 53 new highs and 73 new lows.

  • LIVERPOOL SECURE MUCH-NEEDED WIN AGAINST RANGERS, NUNEZ STRUGGLES

    https://www.espn.com/soccer/liverpool-engliverpool/story/4761267/liverpool-secure-much-needed-win-against-rangersnunez-struggles

    10/05/2022, 06:35

    66.67% Shortened!

    LIVERPOOL -- Jurgen Klopp's side improved their chances of making the Champions League knockout stage after their 2-0 win against Rangers at Anfield

    Liverpool make easy work of Rangers to boost Champions League hopes Liverpool secured a much-needed win against Rangers as a Trent Alexander-Arnold free-kick and Mohamed Salah penalty completed a comfortable victory at Anfield and consolidated second spot in Champions League Group A

    And although the game was short on incident and goals from open play, the victory was much-needed for Liverpool following a disappointing start to the league season that sees Jurgen Klopp's team currently lying in ninth position in the Premier League

    The Scottish club struggled to compete against the English team and Liverpool were never threatened by Giovanni van Bronckhorst's side

    With Arsenal away on Sunday, Liverpool need him to start scoring soon

    Rangers out of their depth in Champions League Rangers shocked Europe last season by making it all the way to the Europa League final, but the Scottish club have had a painful reality check in their first Champions League campaign since 2010

    Giovanni van Bronckhorst's team were outclassed by Liverpool at Anfield and the gulf between the two sides was huge, despite Jurgen Klopp's side still being some way off their best form in the Premier League

    Trent Alexander-Arnold's excellent free kick gave Liverpool the lead in the 7th minute

    9, who are currently top of the Premier League, before a visit Rangers on Oct

    Liverpool are struggling in the Premier League in 9th place, and will look to turn things around in domestic competition after winning their last two Champions League matches

    8 before playing Liverpool in the Champions League and then Dundee FC in the Scottish League Cup quarter-final.

    ['liverpool', 'champion', 'league', 'ranger', 'game']

    "I don't understand anything

    "As for the other one [Dumfries' possible handball]..

    I just do not understand

  • T. ROWE PRICE SAYS WORKERS OVER 50 SHOULD DO THIS IN A DOWN MARKET

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/t-rowe-price-says-workers-141249755.html

    60.71% Shortened!

    T.Rowe Price recently released data that illustrates how increasing your retirement savings now could help you contend with market losses

    The financial institution typically suggests that workers save 15% of their annual income for retirement, but for those in the 50 to 65 age range, T

    Rowe Price recommends increasing that savings rate and potentially putting off retirement

    "For those close to retirement but unable to meet their retirement savings benchmarks, they might consider delaying retirement for a year or two, taking part-time work in retirement, or making spending adjustments," said Judith Ward, the thought leadership director at T.Rowe Price, in a statement

    Suggested Retirement Savings Strategies T.Rowe Price bases this advice on a typical saving pattern for pre-retirees

    Making catch-up contributions to 401(k) and individual retirement accounts (IRAs) can help pre-retirees bolster their nest egg

    But with less of a time horizon to recoup losses, retirement savers who increase their retirement contributions during a down market stand to enter retirement in a better position

    Workers 50 and older should¬†calculate their income and spending needs before they're ready for retirement

    For pre-retirees, it is important to estimate your income and spending habits before you enter retirement

    Planning for Retirement Tips Finding a qualified financial advisor doesn't have to be hard

    Rowe Price Says Workers Over 50 Should Do This in a Down Market appeared first on SmartAsset Blog.

    ['market', 'retirement', 'help', 'saving', 'rowe']

    T.Rowe Price recently released data that illustrates how increasing your retirement savings now could help you contend with market losses

    The financial institution typically suggests that workers save 15% of their annual income for retirement, but for those in the 50 to 65 age range, T

    Rowe Price recommends increasing that savings rate and potentially putting off retirement

    "For those close to retirement but unable to meet their retirement savings benchmarks, they might consider delaying retirement for a year or two, taking part-time work in retirement, or making spending adjustments," said Judith Ward, the thought leadership director at T.Rowe Price, in a statement

    Suggested Retirement Savings Strategies T.Rowe Price bases this advice on a typical saving pattern for pre-retirees

    Making catch-up contributions to 401(k) and individual retirement accounts (IRAs) can help pre-retirees bolster their nest egg

    But with less of a time horizon to recoup losses, retirement savers who increase their retirement contributions during a down market stand to enter retirement in a better position

    Workers 50 and older should¬†calculate their income and spending needs before they're ready for retirement

    For pre-retirees, it is important to estimate your income and spending habits before you enter retirement

    Planning for Retirement Tips Finding a qualified financial advisor doesn't have to be hard

    Rowe Price Says Workers Over 50 Should Do This in a Down Market appeared first on SmartAsset Blog.

    ['market', 'retirement', 'help', 'saving', 'rowe']



  • WORKS MINISTRY DENIES REPORT THAT MALAYSIA HAS THE 12TH WORST ROADS IN THE WORLD

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/04/works-ministry-denies-report-that-malaysia-has-the-12th-worst-roads-in-the-world

    10/05/2022, 00:03

    42.11% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 04 Oct 2022

    In a statement on Tuesday (Oct 4), the ministry said the article was inaccurate, misleading and gave a negative perception of the overall quality of roads in Malaysia

    It also said the article used a report published by Zutobi, an online driver's education company as a reference, which calculated the scores based on only four factors ‚Äì road quality; improvements in road quality; road deaths and the relative size of the road network, and it only took into account data for 59 countries

    The ministry also explained that another report published by Utusan Malaysia on Aug 10 titled "Kualiti Jalan di Malaysia 21 Terbaik di Dunia, Mengatasi Australia, Britain, New Zealand" (Road quality in Malaysia among 21 best in the world, surpassing Australia, Britain, New Zealand), based on the road quality rankings issued by The Global Economy using the data obtained from the Global Competitiveness Index

    Based on the news report, Malaysia scored 5.3 points out of the total seven points to be in the 21st position, surpassing Sweden (23), Canada (31), Australia (33) and Britain (37)

    Malaysia is also ranked second in Southeast Asia, after Singapore

    "There are various ongoing commitments carried out by the ministry, specifically in maintaining the quality of roads in the country

    "The ministry also received over RM900,000 in allocations for road maintenance costs throughout the country

    The ministry said it also focused on continuous efforts to maintain road quality through the Zeropotholes campaign since 2016 and the Kita Jaga Jalan Kita Campaign launched in November 2021

    Report it to us

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    ['ministry', 'report', 'malaysia', 'quality', 'road']

    Tuesday, 04 Oct 2022

    In a statement on Tuesday (Oct 4), the ministry said the article was inaccurate, misleading and gave a negative perception of the overall quality of roads in Malaysia

    It also said the article used a report published by Zutobi, an online driver's education company as a reference, which calculated the scores based on only four factors ‚Äì road quality; improvements in road quality; road deaths and the relative size of the road network, and it only took into account data for 59 countries

    The ministry also explained that another report published by Utusan Malaysia on Aug 10 titled "Kualiti Jalan di Malaysia 21 Terbaik di Dunia, Mengatasi Australia, Britain, New Zealand" (Road quality in Malaysia among 21 best in the world, surpassing Australia, Britain, New Zealand), based on the road quality rankings issued by The Global Economy using the data obtained from the Global Competitiveness Index

    Based on the news report, Malaysia scored 5.3 points out of the total seven points to be in the 21st position, surpassing Sweden (23), Canada (31), Australia (33) and Britain (37)

    Malaysia is also ranked second in Southeast Asia, after Singapore

    "There are various ongoing commitments carried out by the ministry, specifically in maintaining the quality of roads in the country

    "The ministry also received over RM900,000 in allocations for road maintenance costs throughout the country

    The ministry said it also focused on continuous efforts to maintain road quality through the Zeropotholes campaign since 2016 and the Kita Jaga Jalan Kita Campaign launched in November 2021

    Report it to us

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    ['ministry', 'report', 'malaysia', 'quality', 'road']



  • GROWTH STOCKS LIFT NASDAQ 3% AS TREASURY YIELDS EASE BY REUTERS

    https://www.investing.com/news/economy/wall-st-futures-jump-as-treasury-yields-retreat-2904625

    10/04/2022, 23:03

    59.26% Shortened!

    By Ankika Biswas and Bansari Mayur Kamdar (Reuters) - The Nasdaq led Wall Street higher on Tuesday as megacap growth and technology stocks gaining and U.S

    "The market loves to see that (weakness in yields and dollar) and it sets up well going into earnings season with expectations so low at 3.2% earnings growth." The yields on the 10-year U.S

    Treasury fell to near two-week lows, lifting rate-sensitive tech and tech-adjacent stocks

    ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was up 714.23 points, or 2.42%, at 30,205.12, the S&P 500 was up 100.15 points, or 2.72%, at 3,778.58, and the Nasdaq Composite was up 347.73 points, or 3.22%, at 11,163.17

    Investors will keep a close watch on comments from Fed speakers including New York President John Williams, Cleveland President Loretta Mester and Governor Philip Jefferson

    Advancing issues outnumbered decliners by a 13.59-to-1 ratio on the NYSE and a 6.70-to-1 ratio on the Nasdaq

    The S&P index recorded one new 52-week highs and no new lows, while the Nasdaq recorded 33 new highs and 31 new lows

  • WALL STREET CAPITULATION CALLS GET EVER HARDER AS STOCKS BOUNCE

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/wall-street-capitulation-calls-ever-205024017.html

    59.26% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- After a furious spate of retail selling unseen since December 2018 and beaten-down risk appetite, all the ingredients were in place heading into the big stock rebound Monday

    ‚ÄúWhile we could still see further de-risking, it‚Äôs possible we don‚Äôt get a clear sign of broad capitulation (i.e

    where most investors sell strongly at the same time) because positioning is already quite low,‚Äù the JPMorgan team including John Schlegel wrote in a note

    He pointed to Bank of England‚Äôs dramatic market intervention last week to stem a collapse in the British pound and UK government bonds as a possible template for other policy makers to follow

    Gauging the state of capitulation has become Wall Street‚Äôs pastime of late after a nine-month slump wiped out $15 trillion in equity values

    Among hedge funds tracked by Morgan Stanley, net leverage -- a gauge of risk appetite that takes into account the group‚Äôs long versus short position -- last week touched a 13-year low

    Meanwhile, trend followers like Commodity Trading Advisors saw their equity positioning approaching the trough seen at the hight of the global financial crisis, JPMorgan data show

    When shares tumbled to fresh bear market lows last month, the rush for exit was mostly absent

    The reaction in the Cboe Volatility Index, or VIX, that‚Äôs known as Wall Street‚Äôs fear gauge, was also subdued

    Despite an advance, the VIX has failed to take out its June high

    ‚ÄúThe job of a trader, of course, is to weigh this ongoing corrosion of the fundamental outlook and the cocktail of risk against the vivid markings of a stock market that is both technically oversold and tactically under-owned,‚Äù Pasquariello wrote in a note last week

    ['sell', 'since', 'stock', 'market', 'position']

    (Bloomberg) -- After a furious spate of retail selling unseen since December 2018 and beaten-down risk appetite, all the ingredients were in place heading into the big stock rebound Monday

    ‚ÄúWhile we could still see further de-risking, it‚Äôs possible we don‚Äôt get a clear sign of broad capitulation (i.e

    where most investors sell strongly at the same time) because positioning is already quite low,‚Äù the JPMorgan team including John Schlegel wrote in a note

    Among hedge funds tracked by Morgan Stanley, net leverage -- a gauge of risk appetite that takes into account the group‚Äôs long versus short position -- last week touched a 13-year low

    Meanwhile, trend followers like Commodity Trading Advisors saw their equity positioning approaching the trough seen at the hight of the global financial crisis, JPMorgan data show

    When shares tumbled to fresh bear market lows last month, the rush for exit was mostly absent

  • INDONESIA POLICE CHIEF, OTHERS REMOVED OVER SOCCER DISASTER; GOVT TO PROBE OTHER ELITE POLICE OFFICERS OVER DISASTER

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/10/04/indonesia-police-chief-others-removed-over-soccer-disaster-govt-to-probe-other-elite-police-officers-over-disaster

    10/04/2022, 20:03

    80.7% Shortened!

    - Elite Indonesian police officers were under investigation on October 4 over a stadium stampede that killed at least 131 people including dozens of children in one of the deadliest disasters in football history

    The organizer had banned supporters of the visiting team, Persebaya Surabaya, because of Indonesia‚Äôs history of violent soccer rivalries

    Arema players and officials laid wreaths Monday in front of the stadium

    On Monday night, about a thousand soccer fans dressed in black shirts held a candlelight vigil at a soccer stadium in Jakarta‚Äôs satellite city of Bekasi to pray for the victims of the disaster

    At least five police vehicles were toppled and set ablaze outside the stadium

    Police said 323 people were injured in the crush, with some still in critical condition

    People gather at the Lion Statue of Kanjuruhan Stadium as they pay their condolences for the victims of a riot and stampede following a soccer match between Arema vs Persebaya Surabaya in Malang, East Java province, Indonesia, October 4, 2022, in this photo taken by Antara Foto

    She died while fleeing to exit 12 at Kanjuruhan Stadium

    Indonesia‚Äôs soccer association also banned Arema from hosting soccer matches for the rest of the season

    Data from Indonesia‚Äôs soccer watchdog, Save Our Soccer, showed 78 people have died in game-related incidents over the past 28 years

    In April 2001, more than 40 people were crushed to death during a soccer match at Ellis Park in Johannesburg, South Africa

    ['stadium', 'police', 'people', 'indonesia', 'soccer']

  • FORMER AMBANK MD: I TOLD ZETI THAT NAJIB WAS OPENING A PRIVATE ACCOUNT TO RECEIVE US$100M FROM SAUDI ARABIA

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/former-ambank-md-i-told-zeti-najib-was-opening-private-account-receive-us100m-saudi-arabia

    10/04/2022, 18:35

    57.69% Shortened!

    He said¬†he had met¬†Zeti to¬†inform her about it shortly after¬†facilitating¬†the opening of Najib‚Äôs account

    Cheah¬†was explaining how he facilitated the opening of Najib‚Äôs current account 211-202-200969-4 on Jan 13, 2011 (known as the ‚Äú9694‚Äù account)

    ‚ÄúThe purpose of the meeting was to inform her that Najib had opened an account and there were incoming funds of US$100 million from Saudi Arabia,‚Äù he said

    The former MD added that the ‚ÄúAmPrivate Banking-MR‚Äù code name was used for Najib‚Äôs current account and it was managed by AmBank customer relationship manager Joanna Yu

    The name was assigned to the account ‚Äúto avoid private information from being misused‚Äù

    Cheah said he wasn‚Äôt sure if Najib was informed of the code name, but that it fell within the purview of the bank‚Äôs operation¬†to choose the code name

    Earlier, Cheah said he had first gone to Najib‚Äôs house in Jalan Langgak Duta, Kuala Lumpur in 2011 to facilitate the opening of the bank account, after being given the green light by AmBank chairman Tan Sri Azman Hashim

    ‚ÄúI then met Najib at his home and introduced myself

    After signing the documents, Najib had told him that US$100 million from Saudi Arabia will be deposited¬†into the account

    Cheah said he didn‚Äôt ask Najib what the purpose of the funds were coming in for, but that Najib voluntarily said it was a donation to him from Saudi Arabia, in line with some ‚ÄúIslamic activity‚Äù

    The Edge is covering the trial live¬†here
