  • PM: I DIDN'T GIVE ANY CONDITIONS FOR A SNAP ELECTION

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/02/pm-i-didnt-give-any-conditions-for-a-snap-election

    10/02/2022, 08:49

    47.62% Shortened!

    Ismail Sabri, who is also an Umno vice-president, said he had reached a consensus as one of the top five of the leadership on Friday as there was a need to return the mandate to the people as soon as possible

    ‚ÄúWe (Umno top five) have always stated that there is a need to hasten the general election as we want to return the mandate to the people

    We will have the Umno top five meeting, the political bureau meeting and the supreme council meeting before we decide

    ‚ÄúIf there is a good reason to hold the snap polls, we will agree to it ‚Äì that has always been our stand

    ‚ÄúAs for the date (of dissolution of Parliament), please wait

    You have waited since last year, you can wait a little while more this year,‚Äù said Ismail Sabri

    On Sept 30, the Umno supreme council stated that the Prime Minister would be meeting the Yang di-Pertuan Agong soon to advise on the date for dissolving Parliament this year to pave the way for the next general election

    This came after months of insistence by Umno leaders led by party president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi to hold snap polls, despite reasoning by those supporting Ismail Sabri that it would be unwise to hold the elections during the monsoon season due to floods

    Umno secretary-general Datuk Seri Ahmad Maslan released a statement on Friday that the dissolution of Parliament must be made as soon as possible to allow the 15th General Election to be held by this year

    The decision made by the Umno supreme council, he said, was consistent with the party‚Äôs stand from the beginning to return the mandate to Malaysians after the fall of the Pakatan Harapan government in February 2020

    The Umno supreme council had also instructed the entire party machinery to finalise all electoral preparations

    ['ismail', 'sabri', 'say', 'umno', 'party']

    Ismail Sabri, who is also an Umno vice-president, said he had reached a consensus as one of the top five of the leadership on Friday as there was a need to return the mandate to the people as soon as possible

    ‚ÄúWe (Umno top five) have always stated that there is a need to hasten the general election as we want to return the mandate to the people

    We will have the Umno top five meeting, the political bureau meeting and the supreme council meeting before we decide

    ‚ÄúIf there is a good reason to hold the snap polls, we will agree to it ‚Äì that has always been our stand

  • SUSPENSIONS WITHIN UMNO

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/02/suspensions-within-umno

    10/02/2022, 08:35

    66.67% Shortened!

    The party‚Äôs supreme council also agreed to sack blogger and former Bandar Tun Razak Umno division secretary Datuk Zaharin Mohd Yasin

    However, checks with supreme council members confirmed that the meeting had decided to suspend Tajuddin and Mohd Yusof for six years

    Supreme council members who attended the meeting, but who declined to be named, said that Tajuddin and Yusof were suspected of going against the top Umno leadership

    ‚ÄúYes, I have been informed by members of the Umno supreme council that they decided to suspend me and Tajuddin

    I consider myself as Umno then, now and forever,‚Äù he added

    Tajuddin, who is also the Pasir Salak Umno division chief, when contacted confirmed the news with just a terse ‚Äúyes‚Äù

    In June he was removed from the Umno supreme council for calling on party president Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi to step down because he was ‚Äúa liability to the party‚Äù

    ‚ÄúI will not appeal my dismissal and I thank the Umno supreme council for removing me as a party member

    The supreme council top five, including Ismail Sabri who is an Umno vice-president, met on Friday night and decided that the general election will indeed be held this year

    ‚ÄúWhat is wrong with us speaking up? All of us love Umno dearly and people like Tajuddin had stood by Umno during the worst of times

    That says something of the following he has in Umno

    ['umno', 'tajuddin', 'division', 'chief', 'supreme']

  • LIVERPOOL ANALYSIS - JURGEN KLOPP FACES SERIOUS QUESTIONS AS FABINHO CONCERN EMERGES

    https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-analysis-jurgen-klopp-faces-25156252

    56.0% Shortened!

    And there were certainly questions to be asked of Klopp‚Äôs decisions both before and during the game, particularly given how Liverpool were tactically flummoxed throughout an opening half-hour in which Brighton sauntered between the Reds' lines with alarming frequency

    With Andy Robertson injured, there was little option but to replace Kostas Tsimikas - has the Greek ever had a worse game for Liverpool? - with James Milner

    With the skipper gone, Brighton eventually regained the initiative and ultimately a point, Klopp mindful his side‚Äôs game management was found wanting in the latter stages

    Klopp and his coaching staff need to find a way to get Liverpool winning games again

    Firmino and Alisson frustration It was so nearly a very happy birthday for two Liverpool players today

    And how Liverpool were grateful

    That Liverpool were still in contention was down to Alisson, whose first-half saves from Leandro Trossard and Danny Welbeck ensured a fourth disappointing draw in the opening seven Premier League games wasn‚Äôt an even more damaging result

    Fabinho causes concern This should have been the day Fabinho celebrated his 150th start for Liverpool with a commanding midfield display

    Fabinho was hugely off the pace, his passing radar awry and his normally excellent positioning found wanting by Brighton‚Äôs bright start, even if there was an improvement second half

    This coming period will shape the second half of the season

    And Liverpool need Fabinho back to his best as soon as possible

    ['liverpool', 'brighton', 'klopp', 'first', 'game']

  • YOURSAY | YES, TIME TO TAKE DBKL TO COURT OVER FLOODS

    https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/637822

    10/02/2022, 07:49

    75.56% Shortened!

    DBKL does not know the real root causes of the flood

    The eight KL residents should not give up on this flood mitigation matter

    They need to go all out even to the extent of citing DBKL and the mayor for contempt of court if they do not follow the court order at a later stage

    It seems Kuala Lumpur city planners stand out as the most competent and intelligent in how to prevent floods and destroy green areas at the same time

    Malaysia should get a Nobel prize for city planning where the environment and destruction can go hand in hand

    DBKL just needs to raise taxes by a swipe of the pen for all flood mitigation and preventive efforts

    You see, the only suckers are the city residents

    But the government knows best - call elections when Malaysia is flooded so that they can remain in power despite the misery of the people

    What a democratic country, where the will of the people determines their government

    Some people call it corruption and abuse of power, but no, we are battle-hardened to turn corruption into a virtue for the sake of development and people's welfare

    Now you see it, now you don't

    ['dbkl', 'flood', 'know', 'city', 'court']

    DBKL does not know the real root causes of the flood

    The eight KL residents should not give up on this flood mitigation matter

    They need to go all out even to the extent of citing DBKL and the mayor for contempt of court if they do not follow the court order at a later stage

    It seems Kuala Lumpur city planners stand out as the most competent and intelligent in how to prevent floods and destroy green areas at the same time

    Malaysia should get a Nobel prize for city planning where the environment and destruction can go hand in hand

    DBKL just needs to raise taxes by a swipe of the pen for all flood mitigation and preventive efforts

    You see, the only suckers are the city residents

    But the government knows best - call elections when Malaysia is flooded so that they can remain in power despite the misery of the people

    What a democratic country, where the will of the people determines their government

    Some people call it corruption and abuse of power, but no, we are battle-hardened to turn corruption into a virtue for the sake of development and people's welfare

    Now you see it, now you don't

    ['dbkl', 'flood', 'know', 'city', 'court']



  • CAAM REINSTATED TO CAT 1

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/02/caam-reinstated-to-cat-1

    10/02/2022, 07:49

    50.0% Shortened!

    FAA‚Äôs assessment covers CAAM‚Äôs role as an aviation regulator, and is not an assessment of Malaysian airlines or airports

    ‚ÄúWe are very pleased to share that today (yesterday), FAA has officially announced that Malaysia has regained Category 1 of the International Aviation Safety Assessment (IASA) rating, and for this extremely proud achievement, I applaud everyone at CAAM for their tireless effort and commitment to this success,‚Äù said Dr Wee, who kickstarted the transformation process in CAAM after he assumed the role of Transport Minister in March 2020

    As part of the change, Dr Wee brought in Tan Sri Mohd Khairul Adib Abd Rahman, the former director-general of public service, to be CAAM chairman, and career pilot Datuk Capt Chester Voo, to be CEO

    In November 2019, FAA announced that Malaysia was assigned a Category 2 rating under the IASA programme due to non-compliance with the International Civil Aviation Organisation‚Äôs (ICAO) safety standards after a reassessment of CAAM earlier that year

    ‚ÄúThe FAA assessment in 2019 found that CAAM needs to address 58 findings, whereby CAAM was able to resolve 25 of them in a relatively short time, while 33 other findings took much longer to resolve,‚Äù said Dr Wee, who gave a press conference yesterday in Montreal, the headquarters of ICAO, where he is attending the ICAO general assembly

    Capt Voo, who was among the delegation, expressed his gratitude to the ministry and the FAA for their support in CAAM‚Äôs reinstatement as a Category 1 regulator

    ‚ÄúThere were 301 questions from the FAA audit that required 403 critical element responses, and I would like to express my gratitude to the FAA for its very instructive and very detailed efforts to achieve the best in safety for the civil aviation industry

    ‚ÄúThis has shown Malaysia is compliant and has now demonstrated that we have an effective safety oversight capability

    On behalf of all of our team, I would like to commit to all that we will be facilitating an inclusive aviation industry with no compromise on safety,‚Äù said Capt Voo

    Among others, the Malaysian delegation included Khairul Adib, Transport Ministry‚Äôs secretary-general Datuk Isham Ishak, Malaysian Aviation Commission executive chairman Datuk Seri Saripuddin Kasim, Malaysia Aviation Group CEO Capt Izham Ismail, AirAsia Malaysia CEO Riad Asmat, Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd managing director Datuk Iskandar Mizal Mahmood and Batik Air CEO Capt Mushafiz Mustafa Bakri

    Malaysia‚Äôs participation as an ICAO council member enables the country to contribute to the international civil aviation industry and provides an avenue to voice matters affecting national interest, while also raising the country‚Äôs standing at the global level

    ['civil', 'aviation', 'malaysia', 'caam', 'category']

    FAA‚Äôs assessment covers CAAM‚Äôs role as an aviation regulator, and is not an assessment of Malaysian airlines or airports

    ‚ÄúThe FAA assessment in 2019 found that CAAM needs to address 58 findings, whereby CAAM was able to resolve 25 of them in a relatively short time, while 33 other findings took much longer to resolve,‚Äù said Dr Wee, who gave a press conference yesterday in Montreal, the headquarters of ICAO, where he is attending the ICAO general assembly

  • BUDGET 2023 VOID IF PARLIAMENT DISBANDS BEFORE ITS PASSAGE, CONSTITUTIONAL EXPERTS SAY

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/02/budget-2023-void-if-parliament-disbands-before-its-passage-constitutional-experts-say/30828

    10/02/2022, 07:35

    42.11% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise GEORGE TOWN, Oct 2 ‚Äî Budget 2023 would have no legality if Parliament were to be dissolved before it could be approved as rumoured, constitutional lawyers explained

    Surendra explained that the same Bill could be tabled again in order for it to proceed to the second reading when debate could take place, or a new one submitted entirely

    Either scenario could lead to significant delays in passing Budget 2023 as both would have to wait until the 15th Parliament is sworn in, which could be weeks or months after the general election

    The tabling of Budget 2023 has been expedited by three weeks to October 7 this year, fuelling suspicion that this was to allow for a general election to be held almost immediately after

    These circumstances then fuelled rumours that the prime minister would advise the Yang di Pertuan Agong to dissolve Parliament immediately or shortly after the tabling of Budget 2023, reminiscent to events before the 1999 general election

    In 1999, Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, who was the prime minister at the time, sought the dissolution of Parliament shortly after the tabling of Budget 2000 in November, and his finance minister was forced to table another one at the end of February 2000 or around three months later, after Barisan Nasional prevailed

    Former finance minister Lim Guan Eng said this would also be the case if Parliament were dissolved before Budget 2023 could be approved, which effectively meant the document would little more than a draft

    ‚ÄúThere is a necessity for an economic reform for the country and for the budget to prioritise the people‚Äôs needs,‚Äù he said

    ‚ÄúThe Budget should be taking care of the people‚Äôs needs,‚Äù he said

    Finance Minister Datuk Seri Tengku Zafrul Abdul Aziz is set to table Budget 2023 on October 7, three weeks earlier than initially scheduled

    Dewan Rakyat Speaker Tan Sri Azhar Azizan Harun reportedly said the first reading of the Budget 2023 will be on October 5 and then it will be brought for the second reading on October 7

    ['budget', 'would', 'parliament', 'could', 'say']

    About Us Advertise GEORGE TOWN, Oct 2 ‚Äî Budget 2023 would have no legality if Parliament were to be dissolved before it could be approved as rumoured, constitutional lawyers explained

  • BETTER DEALS FOR TEACHERS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/02/better-deals-for-teachers

    10/02/2022, 07:35

    47.83% Shortened!

    He said the move would benefit 2,047 education service officers nationwide

    Under this move, headmasters on Grade DG48 (personal to holder) would no longer have to be ‚Äúdowngraded‚Äù to senior assistants or ordinary teachers in primary schools once they have been promoted to Grades DG52 and DG54 on a time-based excellence basis

    ‚ÄúThis will upgrade the substantive grades for the posts of headmaster and senior assistant teacher, as well as enable those who have been promoted to a higher grade to remain in that position until Grade DG54,‚Äù he told a gathering of around 1,500 teachers organised by the National Union of the Teaching Profession (NUTP) here yesterday

    Ismail Sabri said teachers of a higher grade would also now be able to hold a higher position and certain positions in primary schools without being confined to the lower grades in the civil service pay scale

    ‚ÄúHeadmasters at grade DG48 will not be ‚Äòdemoted‚Äô to senior assistant teachers or regular teachers at primary schools when they are promoted to DG52 or DG54 on the time-based promotion scheme

    ‚ÄúTeachers at DG48 will be given the opportunity to be appointed assistant senior teachers in primary schools

    Senior assistant teachers in primary schools will now not be confined to those in grade DG44 only

    ‚ÄúSenior assistant teachers who have had their pay scale raised to DG54 can now remain in that position,‚Äù he said, adding that 90.68% of primary school teachers were now on a graduate level in the civil service

    ‚ÄúThe Education Ministry is currently studying the structure of staffing for headmasters and senior assistant teachers in primary schools through the proposal of ‚ÄòModel Schools‚Äô to keep those teachers up to DG54 to ensure that the administrative positions in schools are always maintained to preserve the harmony of the school community,‚Äù he said

    ‚ÄúWe sometimes have to beg outsiders for money to buy gadgets so that our students do not get left behind as everything is digital nowadays,‚Äù said a teacher from Subang.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    We would love to keep you posted on the latest promotion

    ['grade', 'primary', 'school', 'senior', 'assistant']

    10/02/2022, 07:35

    For the Malaysia Aviation Group (MAG), it said it was glad to be involved in the task force that was formed which led to the reinstatement of the top-tiered ranking

    ‚ÄúMAG is confident that CAAM, under the leadership of CAAM CEO Datuk Capt Chester Voo and the rest of the management team, will be able to make significant contributions to the development of civil aviation‚Äôs safety and security in Malaysia,‚Äù said the group in a statement

    The airline group is the parent company of Malaysia Airlines and regional airlines Firefly and MASwings

    ‚ÄúAirAsia X is currently the only airline in the group that operates to the US directly, to Honolulu, Hawaii, through Osaka, Japan

    ‚ÄúThe Category 1 safety rating will not only allow us to expand our future network plans, but also stabilise the country‚Äôs aviation industry as a whole

    ‚ÄúA massive congratulations to CAAM for meeting the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO) safety standards again and to the Transport Ministry for their continued effort to improve the FAA‚Äôs rating on Malaysia‚Äôs aviation status,‚Äù he said

    Batik Air CEO Capt Mushafiz Mustafa Bakri described the reinstatement to Category 1 as good news for Malaysia and Malaysian carriers

    ‚ÄúThe return to Category 1 also means that the FAA will remove any safety concerns it may have had, which will allow Malaysia to boost its tourism efforts as countries are now lifting travel restrictions,‚Äù he said in a statement

    Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd said Malaysia‚Äôs position as an aviation hub would be strengthened while its network connectivity would increase

    ‚ÄúThe reinstatement of Malaysia‚Äôs International Aviation Safety Assessment (IASA) rating will strengthen Malaysia‚Äôs position as an aviation hub and increase its network connectivity,‚Äù said MAHB‚Äôs managing director, Datuk Iskandar Mizal Mahmood

    ‚ÄúThe Transport Ministry and CAAM have put in massive efforts to ensure that Malaysia‚Äôs IASA Category 1 rating is reinstated

  • DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT RETIRING UNTIL YOU HAVE THESE 3 THINGS COMPLETELY PAID OFF ‚Äî YOUR MORTGAGE ISN'T ONE OF THEM

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/dont-even-think-retiring-until-153000554.html

    66.67% Shortened!

    The interest rate on those loans could surge to 7.54% in the new year

    So all those payments take away from your retirement income

    While these credit card balances should be paid down quickly, you shouldn‚Äôt let them delay saving for your retirement

    Instead, consider lowering your mortgage payments to use those funds to pay down other high interest loans

    Finally, auto loans are another area to pay off before retirement

    As of August 2022, the average car loan for a buyer with good credit was 7.88%, according to MyAutoloan

    But if you have bad credit, that soars up to 19.87%

    That‚Äôs about as much as the interest rate on a credit card

    What‚Äôs more, you‚Äôll have to take into consideration these payments for your retirement

    If $400 goes into a car payment, and $300 to a credit card and more for student loans, suddenly you have far less cash on hand for your retirement

    So why not pay down your mortgage too? It‚Äôs not just lower interest rates, although with the average national mortgage rate for a 30-year fixed rate at about 6.5%, that is an advantage

    ['retirement', 'pay', 'loan', 'mortgage', 'interest']

  • ‚ÄòHE‚ÄôS MAKING MISTAKES‚Äô: AGBONLAHOR SAYS KLOPP MADE A BIG ERROR BY NOT STARTING TWO LIVERPOOL PLAYERS TODAY

    Nevertheless, this was a big game for Liverpool

    As good as Carvalho is, or has the potential be, he isn‚Äôt currently in Liverpool‚Äôs strongest side

    Liverpool‚Äôs No.9 dragged his team back into the game with a well-taken double and is now firmly ahead of Nunez in the pecking order

    With Liverpool searching for a winner, the decision to bring on Nunez felt like too little too late

    As for Diaz, he has to start, simple as that

    He‚Äôs played well for Liverpool so far and is deserving of a decent sized role in the team

    Nevertheless, this was a big game for Liverpool

    As good as Carvalho is, or has the potential be, he isn‚Äôt currently in Liverpool‚Äôs strongest side

    The decision to start Roberto Firmino over Nunez wasn‚Äôt a bad one, though

    Liverpool‚Äôs No.9 dragged his team back into the game with a well-taken double and is now firmly ahead of Nunez in the pecking order

    With Liverpool searching for a winner, the decision to bring on Nunez felt like too little too late

    As for Diaz, he has to start, simple as that

    ['klopp', 'start', 'diaz', 'nunez', 'today']

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/10/02/former-f1-champion-hamilton-allowed-to-wear-his-nose-stud-but-mercedes-cop-rm113000-fine

    10/02/2022

    63.33% Shortened!

    Sunday, 02 Oct 2022

    "In recent events Hamilton had removed the piercing prior to the competition

    The team assumed, without enquiring of Hamilton, that he had followed or would follow the same procedure for this event," said the FIA stewards in their ruling

    Given these circumstances, we fine the team 25,000 euros." Seven-time world champion Hamilton told reporters that he was wearing the stud again on the advice of doctors after suffering from an infection when he removed it

    "I've had my jewellery and my nose stud for years and obviously we had that whole commotion at the beginning of the year," Hamilton said

    They gave me for many races an exemption so I could find a solution," Hamilton explained

    "Broadcast footage showed Hamilton wearing an item of jewellery in the form of a body piercing (nose stud) during the session," said a statement from the stewards

    Hamilton "explained that he had been advised by his doctors not to remove it for the time being..

    the team produced reports from a medical practitioner that confirmed Hamilton's explanation

    "But our zip is metal, our buckle around our helmet is metal, we've got the wires with aluminium metal in them," Hamilton continued

    It's all a bit silly

    ['hamilton', 'wear', 'nose', 'stud', 'steward']

  • GET READY FOR ANOTHER BEAR-MARKET RALLY, STRATEGIST SAYS

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/get-ready-another-bearmarket-rally-strategist-says

    10/02/2022

    57.69% Shortened!

    Yet with investor sentiment in the gutter and the Bank of England vowing to open the chequebook to prop up its bond market, could another equities bear-market rally be in the cards? Julian Emanuel says so

    And it really goes back to this idea that after 25 years of quiescent inflation, we had a breakout in the readings

    That's now been over a year and obviously really feeding into the Fed's (US Federal Reserve) imperative to get inflation under control by going on this unprecedented degree of hiking

    This is the kind of rapid acceleration and tightening that reverberates across the globe

    The conduit has really been the strength in the dollar feeding into the UK

    You've had a leadership change, the queen's passing, a new prime minister, a new government ‚Äî just total huge challenges in a market that had already been showing strains, frankly, since the Brexit vote in 2016

    So really, testing the outer bands of volatility across every asset that‚Äôs in the UK

    Because it was clear the policy mismatch between the new Truss government and Kwasi Kwarteng, the chancellor of the Exchequer, and where the Bank of England felt it needs to go ‚Äî needed to go, needs to go, and that's an open concept, which is why I keep changing tenses ‚Äî is that it's really caused this instability that got some feeling as if there was this idea that the UK was about to become an emerging market

    That type of volatility

    Basically from our point of view, these kinds of bear markets ‚Äî and if you go back to the highs in January ‚Äî they don't move in straight lines

    The VIX has started spiking, you've seen investor sentiment that's really only as bad as it's ever been near the trough in 2009, and near the bottom of the first Gulf War bear market in 1990

    ['search', 'new', 'year', 'bank', 'bond']

    Yesteryear, annihilation by City win was a seismic result

    A six-goal performance is almost an obligation for Pep Guardiola's supreme City

    For the second time this season alone, United skulked off 4-0 down at the interval

    What will smart for Erik ten Hag is City denuded United more effortlessly than in March when mutiny was simmering under the interim charge of Ralf Rangnick

    The irrepressible Erling Haaland did everything, plundering a third hat-trick of his City career and chiding the United supporters who reminded him of his father's encounter with Roy Keane

    United's naivety was encapsulated by the second goal

    Malacia was alarmingly distant from Foden off the ball at kick-off and off the pace for his second and City's fourth goal

    "With the red card, [went] the game

    It was a really difficult game after that

    Arsenal's 12-game unbeaten streak vs Spurs at home in the Premier League is the longest such streak since a run of 17 between 1993 and 2010

    Tottenham have just won twice at Arsenal in the Premier League era, stretching back to 1992

    Emerson Royal's red card was the fifth Tottenham have received at Emirates Stadium in the Premier League, the team's most red cards at a single venue in the competition

    And another away game follows that as Tottenham make the short trip to the south coast to take on Brighton on Saturday.

  • PM ISMAIL SABRI: GRADE FOR PRIMARY SCHOOL HEADMASTERS, SENIOR ASSISTANTS UPGRADED TO MAXIMUM DG54

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/01/pm-ismail-sabri-grade-for-primary-school-headmasters-senior-assistants-upgraded-to-maximum-dg54/31079

    10/01/2022, 15:04

    42.86% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 1 ‚Äï The grade for primary school headmasters and senior assistants will be upgraded to the maximum DG54, announced Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob

    The move, he said, would benefit 2,047 education service officers nationwide

    He said headmasters on Grade DG48 (personal to holder) also would no longer have to drop to senior assistants or ordinary teachers in primary schools once they have been promoted to Grades DG52 and DG54 on a time-based excellence basis

    ‚ÄúThis will upgrade the substantive grades for the posts of headmaster and senior assistant teacher, as well as enable those who have been promoted to a higher grade to remain in that position until Grade DG54,‚Äù he said

    The Prime Minister said the issue of the grade for headmasters in primary schools only limited to Grade DG48 and senior assistants to Grade 44 was among issues raised by NUTP to him

    Ismail Sabri said the Education Ministry was also studying the staffing structure of headmasters and senior assistants in primary schools through the proposed School Model with the setting of flexi grades up to DG54 to safeguard the position of school administrators, while maintaining harmony among the school staff

    Apart from that, Grade DG48 officers in the education service (PPP) will also be given the opportunity to be appointed as senior assistants in primary schools, he said, adding that this meant that senior assistants in primary schools would not be limited to Grade DG44 only

    He said senior assistants who had been promoted to a higher grade could also remain in that post until Grade DG54

    The Prime Minister also announced that the career path of Outstanding Teachers in primary schools will also be extended up to Grades DG52 and DG54 as 90.68 percent of primary school teachers were now graduate teachers

    The government, he said, was also making efforts to address various issues plaguing the country's education, such as school maintenance and security, allowance of senior assistants that need to be reviewed and the shortage of teachers

    He said the government was also concerned about the issue of dilapidated schools in Sabah and Sarawak and it would be given serious attention in the 2023 Budget which will be tabled this Friday

    The prime minister also called on parents to always cooperate with teachers and the school, who strived to ensure their children excel academically and also in co-curricular activities

    ['grade', 'primary', 'school', 'senior', 'assistant']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 1 ‚Äï The grade for primary school headmasters and senior assistants will be upgraded to the maximum DG54, announced Prime Minister Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob

    The move, he said, would benefit 2,047 education service officers nationwide

    He said headmasters on Grade DG48 (personal to holder) also would no longer have to drop to senior assistants or ordinary teachers in primary schools once they have been promoted to Grades DG52 and DG54 on a time-based excellence basis

    ‚ÄúThis will upgrade the substantive grades for the posts of headmaster and senior assistant teacher, as well as enable those who have been promoted to a higher grade to remain in that position until Grade DG54,‚Äù he said

    The Prime Minister said the issue of the grade for headmasters in primary schools only limited to Grade DG48 and senior assistants to Grade 44 was among issues raised by NUTP to him

    Ismail Sabri said the Education Ministry was also studying the staffing structure of headmasters and senior assistants in primary schools through the proposed School Model with the setting of flexi grades up to DG54 to safeguard the position of school administrators, while maintaining harmony among the school staff

    Apart from that, Grade DG48 officers in the education service (PPP) will also be given the opportunity to be appointed as senior assistants in primary schools, he said, adding that this meant that senior assistants in primary schools would not be limited to Grade DG44 only

    He said senior assistants who had been promoted to a higher grade could also remain in that post until Grade DG54

    The Prime Minister also announced that the career path of Outstanding Teachers in primary schools will also be extended up to Grades DG52 and DG54 as 90.68 percent of primary school teachers were now graduate teachers

    The government, he said, was also making efforts to address various issues plaguing the country's education, such as school maintenance and security, allowance of senior assistants that need to be reviewed and the shortage of teachers

    He said the government was also concerned about the issue of dilapidated schools in Sabah and Sarawak and it would be given serious attention in the 2023 Budget which will be tabled this Friday

    The prime minister also called on parents to always cooperate with teachers and the school, who strived to ensure their children excel academically and also in co-curricular activities

    ['grade', 'primary', 'school', 'senior', 'assistant']



  • STOCK MARKET TODAY: DOW IN WORST QUARTERLY STREAK SINCE 2015 AS BEARS IN CONTROL BY INVESTING.COM

    https://www.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/stock-market-today-dow-in-worst-quarterly-streak-since-2015-as-bears-in-control-2903226

    10/01/2022

    47.62% Shortened!

    By Yasin Ebrahim¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Investing.com -- The Dow fell Friday, rounding off its worst quarterly losing streak since 2015 that has pushed stocks into bear-market territory as¬†investors prepared for further Federal Reserve rate hikes to cool inflation that continues to run hot

    The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 1.7%, or 490 points, the Nasdaq was down 1.5%, and the¬†S&P 500 fell 1.4%

    All three major averages fell for the third straight quarter.¬† The personal consumption expenditure price index, the fed‚Äôs preferred inflation measure, showed that inflation rose more than expected in August

    This ‚Äúcompounds the pressure for the [Fed] to stay on course in its fight against inflation,‚Äù Stifel said in a note

    Fed vice chair Lael Brainard on Friday cautioned against the central bank reversing course on monetary policy too early, saying monetary policy would need to be ‚Äúrestrictive for some time to have confidence that inflation is moving back to target‚Äù After hiking rates by 3% in just six months, the fed continues to echo the need for further hikes, stoking worries among investors that the central bank could overshoot on tightening and push the economy into a deep recession

    The push higher in inflation, however, hasn‚Äôt yet had a material impact on the consumer, according to personal spending data Friday, to force a material change in consumer spending, suggesting a deep recession isn't on the horizon

    ‚ÄúWe haven't seen that change [in consumer spending habits],‚Äù Brian Mulberry, client portfolio manager at Zacks Investment Management told Investing.com in an interview on Friday

  • HEAPS OF PRAISE FOR RIDERS WHO SPRANG INTO ACTION TO HELP ABDUCTION VICTIM

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/01/heaps-of-praise-for-riders-who-sprang-into-action-to-help-abduction-victim

    10/01/2022, 13:04

    56.0% Shortened!

    "This is the real semangat (spirit) of Keluarga Malaysia where Malaysians help one another without seeing the skin colour," the social media user said

    "Many looked on and went on their merry way but these humble riders did their best to help the poor guy," the user said

    Another social media user said riders were always the first to step in and offer assistance

    It was reported that a 38-year-old businessman was abducted in front of a restaurant in Pandan Indah by a group of men in a white Toyota Vellfire at 5.03pm on Thursday

    Ampang Jaya OCPD Asst Comm Mohamad Farouk Eshak had said the victim had gone to a restaurant alone when he was approached by a group of men

    "He was approached by a group of men who forced him into the Vellfire

    The victim shouted for help to no avail," he said

    However, the victim was later released and went straight to the Ampang Jaya police headquarters at about 10.45pm on Thursday, he said

    He was treated at Hospital Ampang

    ACP Mohamad Farouk thanked the public who tried to assist the victim during the incident

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    The Kop will be sad to see him depart, though in reality at 31 years old, Liverpool will definitely be saying farewell to Firmino at the right time

    Therefore, should Firmino, who made another 16 goal contributions last season and already six in eight games this season, depart next summer, Liverpool will have to find another player to maintain J√ºrgen Klopp's depth in attack

    And in order to find him, the Reds may have been given an ideal glimpse at a player who could be the perfect potential replacement for Firmino

    Flamengo's 25-year-old forward, Pedro, is regarded by many as one of the heirs to Firmino's throne in the national team, and it's easy to see why

    The forward has a similar work rate and is blessed with a technical ability that is on par with Firmino

    Sign up to the Liverpool.com newsletter here ‚Äî it only takes a few seconds! This season, Pedro has already scored 24 goals for Flamengo in 53 games, but just like Firmino, his game doesn't solely rely on goals

    In the most recent international break, Pedro showed a glimpse of his talent for the Brazilian national team, too

    That goal highlighted Pedro's ability to step up and play at a higher level

    He may not just be an ideal heir to Firmino's throne at international level, but perhaps at Anfield, too.

    Let‚Äôs see how much substance there is to this demand from the Umno supreme council

    Not to a corrupt and bigoted party

    Because your party thinks it can win an election now, you want to put the nation‚Äôs lives at risk

    Voter apathy will work against Harapan

    Umno and PAS will play the racial card

    A nation deserves the government it elects

    If the majority want a crooked and corrupt government, so be it

    It is on these grounds that every voter must be ensured one‚Äôs right to vote is unobstructed

    June Wei and Jin Wei, who recently signed up with new sponsor Fusionex, marched into the semi-finals of the men and women‚Äôs singles events respectively in the Vietnam Open at the Nguyen Du Stadium in Ho Chi Minh yesterday

    It was a memorable day for June Wei as he battled past Taiwan‚Äôs Lee Chia-hao 22-20, 25-27, 22-20 in a thrilling 81-minute battle in the quarter-finals to reach only his first semis in four years

    He will take on China‚Äôs Sun Feixiang today for a place in the final

    June Wei is determined to keep his focus and reach what will be his first World Tour final since finishing runners-up in the Dutch Open in 2018

    I just want to stay focused and not think too much after this,‚Äù said June Wei

    Jin Wei booked her own spot after coming from behind to seal a 9-21, 21-10, 21-7 win over homester Thi Anh Vu

    The 2017 Kuala Lumpur SEA Games champion Jin Wei will take on Thi Phuong Tran of Vietnam next, who defeated S

    June Wei has shown good improvement since then and Jin Wei is also playing well now

  • WHAT REALLY HAPPENED IN MALAYSIA‚ÄôS RECENT ABDUCTION HOAXES? (VIDEO)

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/10/01/what-really-happened-in-malaysias-recent-abduction-hoaxes-video/31005

    10/01/2022, 07:35

    66.67% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Oct 1 ‚Äî What was initially thought to be a brazen kidnapping attempt outside a school in Ipoh, Perak, later turned out to be a hoax, and has spawned several other claims that have also been debunked by the police

    Malay Mail examines what was claimed in the series of incidents, and the information that were later discovered

    The claim was made in a video showing a white panel van, which went viral shortly after it was posted online

    Some of those resharing the video also claimed children were being abducted purportedly for organ harvesting

    Police also traced the white panel van shown in the video and found it to be a vehicle for worker transport

    Skandaguru also said that the organ harvesting claims date back to 2017 and were being reshared in light of the incident

    The woman who made the claim then apologised

    Johor police chief Datuk Kamarul Zaman Mamat said it was not of any kidnapping attempt, before noting the spike in claims resembling the Ipoh incident

    ‚ÄúFor example, it‚Äôs okay to say there may be kidnappers out there, keep an eye out for more news and information rather than saying things like ‚Äòthere are kidnappers here, be careful, protect your kids‚Äô, things like that

    ‚ÄúGoogle is the best way

    ‚ÄúAlso, always be a sceptic

    ['claim', 'police', 'claimed', 'incident', 'say']

  • WALL ST POSTS THIRD STRAIGHT QUARTERLY LOSS AS INFLATION WEIGHS, RECESSION LOOMS BY REUTERS

    https://www.investing.com/news/economy/futures-edge-higher-ahead-of-key-inflation-data-2902855

    10/01/2022, 07:04

    57.69% Shortened!

    By Stephen Culp NEW YORK (Reuters) - The S&P 500 closed the books on its steepest September decline in two decades on Friday, skidding across the finish line of a tumultuous quarter fraught with historically hot inflation, rising interest rates and recession fears

    "It's another ugly day to end an ugly quarter in what‚Äôs looking like a very ugly year," said Ryan Detrick, chief market strategist at Carson Group in Omaha, Nebraska

    "Investors will look back and realize this was the year the Fed pulled a total 180 on their views on inflation and quickly turned incredibly hawkish." The Federal Reserve has rattled markets by engaging in its most relentless series of interest rate hikes in decades in order to rein in stubbornly high inflation, which has many market participants eyeing key economic data for signs of a looming recession

    "The realization that the Fed is doing anything they can to combat 40-year-high inflation has investors worried they will push the economy over the edge and into recession," Detrick added

    The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 500.1 points, or 1.71%, to 28,725.51; the S&P 500 lost 54.85 points, or 1.51%, to 3,585.62; and the Nasdaq Composite dropped 161.89 points, or 1.51%, to 10,575.62

    Declining issues outnumbered advancing ones on the NYSE by a 1.45-to-1 ratio; on Nasdaq, a 1.38-to-1 ratio favored decliners

    The S&P 500 posted no new 52-week highs and 93 new lows; the Nasdaq Composite recorded 27 new highs and 380 new lows

    Avoid profanity, slander or personal attacks¬†directed at an author or another user

    ['position', 'add', 'successfully', 'new', 'quarter']

    By Stephen Culp NEW YORK (Reuters) - The S&P 500 closed the books on its steepest September decline in two decades on Friday, skidding across the finish line of a tumultuous quarter fraught with historically hot inflation, rising interest rates and recession fears

    "It's another ugly day to end an ugly quarter in what‚Äôs looking like a very ugly year," said Ryan Detrick, chief market strategist at Carson Group in Omaha, Nebraska

    "Investors will look back and realize this was the year the Fed pulled a total 180 on their views on inflation and quickly turned incredibly hawkish." The Federal Reserve has rattled markets by engaging in its most relentless series of interest rate hikes in decades in order to rein in stubbornly high inflation, which has many market participants eyeing key economic data for signs of a looming recession

    "The realization that the Fed is doing anything they can to combat 40-year-high inflation has investors worried they will push the economy over the edge and into recession," Detrick added

    The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 500.1 points, or 1.71%, to 28,725.51; the S&P 500 lost 54.85 points, or 1.51%, to 3,585.62; and the Nasdaq Composite dropped 161.89 points, or 1.51%, to 10,575.62

    Declining issues outnumbered advancing ones on the NYSE by a 1.45-to-1 ratio; on Nasdaq, a 1.38-to-1 ratio favored decliners

    The S&P 500 posted no new 52-week highs and 93 new lows; the Nasdaq Composite recorded 27 new highs and 380 new lows

  • IS THIS THE END FOR BANGKOK'S INFAMOUS NO.8 BUS?

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/10/01/is-this-the-end-for-bangkoks-infamous-no8-bus

    10/01/2022, 07:04

    54.17% Shortened!

    No.8 bus in Bangkok, which is known for overtaking

    Welcome aboard the No.8 bus

    Infamous in the Thai capital, the No.8 route has spawned parody songs, viral TikToks, horrified YouTube videos and even a feature-length Fast & Furious-style film

    ‚ÄúIt is a competition,‚Äù said driver Aphisak Sodmui, who has helmed his ‚Äúhot‚Äù bus ‚Äì as the non-airconditioned open-windowed models are known ‚Äì for the past decade

    The problem, according to Thai transport expert Sumet Ongkittikul, lies with the private firms that lease the route concession from the central Bangkok Mass Transit Authority

    Driver Aphisak supplements his daily wage of between 150 and 200 baht (RM18.50 and RM24.50) with 10% of the daily ticket sales

    ‚ÄúWe have to complete the route at least four times a day for us to have enough money to live,‚Äù he said

    Passenger Sai Pin, 47, said she had seen a change since the transition to the new buses with a slightly higher fare of 15 baht (RM1.85)

    ‚ÄúWith the old buses, you might encounter lots of fast driving

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    Kindly fill the form below We hope you enjoy this feature!

    ['fast', 'passenger', 'bus', 'route', 'driver']

    No.8 bus in Bangkok, which is known for overtaking

    Welcome aboard the No.8 bus

    Infamous in the Thai capital, the No.8 route has spawned parody songs, viral TikToks, horrified YouTube videos and even a feature-length Fast & Furious-style film

    ‚ÄúIt is a competition,‚Äù said driver Aphisak Sodmui, who has helmed his ‚Äúhot‚Äù bus ‚Äì as the non-airconditioned open-windowed models are known ‚Äì for the past decade

    The problem, according to Thai transport expert Sumet Ongkittikul, lies with the private firms that lease the route concession from the central Bangkok Mass Transit Authority

    Driver Aphisak supplements his daily wage of between 150 and 200 baht (RM18.50 and RM24.50) with 10% of the daily ticket sales

    ‚ÄúWe have to complete the route at least four times a day for us to have enough money to live,‚Äù he said

    Passenger Sai Pin, 47, said she had seen a change since the transition to the new buses with a slightly higher fare of 15 baht (RM1.85)

    Premier League ‚Ä¢ England A pundit reckons David Moyes could take the surprise decision to drop Jarrod Bowen amid his struggles in the Premier¬†League recently

    This helped West Ham finish seventh in the league and reach the last four of the Europa Conference League, where they lost to eventual winners Eintracht Frankfurt

    Bowen‚Äôs impressive campaign has also seen him become part of the England squad

    Bowen hasn‚Äôt hit the ground running this term and is yet to score in the Prem

    While the West Ham ace has seen his form drop off, Rashford and Sancho are looking much better and could therefore get in the England World Cup squad ahead of him

    ‚ÄúWest Ham have been very successful and he [Bowen] has been a massive part of that success in winning football matches

    ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a slow start for West Ham this year and most of their players

    Rashford has been in the squad many, many times and Sancho has been in the squad many, many times

    He‚Äôs a very talented player but he hasn‚Äôt got his Premier League game going yet.‚Äù Bowen will certainly be looking to get among the goals when West Ham return to action

    Antonio has proven he is able to lead the line effectively for West Ham, all while being the only striker at the club

    But just like Bowen, Scamacca is yet to score in the Prem

  • FLEECING WITH MAID FEES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/01/fleecing-with-maid-fees

    10/01/2022, 06:35

    59.26% Shortened!

    National Human Resources Association Malaysia (Pusma) president Zarina Ismail said that although the price cap imposed by the government is reasonable, some agencies may be charging extra for additional services they have to bear

    ‚ÄúAgencies are responsible for the maids they bring in and this responsibility lasts for the entire contract period or until the maid is sent back

    She also noted the extra charges may also be due to the risks which some agencies are taking following the recent memorandum of understanding (MOU) between Malaysia and Indonesia for the sourcing of domestic helpers

    ‚ÄúSome agencies are taking a wait-and-see attitude and are not keen in sourcing Indonesian domestic helpers at the moment,‚Äù she said

    She said Indonesian maids who are already in the country and who want to renew their contracts must now get an endorsement from an employment agency

    ‚ÄúThere is a risk for the agency endorsing such maids as some may lack proper details under the previous contracts,‚Äù she added

    This comes after the price for hiring Indonesian domestic helpers was capped at RM15,000 following the recent MOU between Malaysia and Indonesia

    Julian Tan, a consulting director of an employment agency, acknowledged that some agencies may be charging above the cap price for Indonesian maids

    ‚ÄúSome feel that the profit margin is too low and charge extra for the risks and effort involved in obtaining an Indonesian maid,‚Äù he said

    He said that RM17,500 would be a more reasonable sum for agencies to charge employers seeking to hire Indonesian maids

    Tan said he has stopped dealing with Indonesian domestic helpers and has shifted focus to those from the Philippines

    ['indonesian', 'domestic', 'may', 'say', 'agency']

    National Human Resources Association Malaysia (Pusma) president Zarina Ismail said that although the price cap imposed by the government is reasonable, some agencies may be charging extra for additional services they have to bear

    ‚ÄúAgencies are responsible for the maids they bring in and this responsibility lasts for the entire contract period or until the maid is sent back

    She also noted the extra charges may also be due to the risks which some agencies are taking following the recent memorandum of understanding (MOU) between Malaysia and Indonesia for the sourcing of domestic helpers

    ‚ÄúSome agencies are taking a wait-and-see attitude and are not keen in sourcing Indonesian domestic helpers at the moment,‚Äù she said

    She said Indonesian maids who are already in the country and who want to renew their contracts must now get an endorsement from an employment agency

    ‚ÄúThere is a risk for the agency endorsing such maids as some may lack proper details under the previous contracts,‚Äù she added

    This comes after the price for hiring Indonesian domestic helpers was capped at RM15,000 following the recent MOU between Malaysia and Indonesia

    Julian Tan, a consulting director of an employment agency, acknowledged that some agencies may be charging above the cap price for Indonesian maids

    ‚ÄúSome feel that the profit margin is too low and charge extra for the risks and effort involved in obtaining an Indonesian maid,‚Äù he said

    He said that RM17,500 would be a more reasonable sum for agencies to charge employers seeking to hire Indonesian maids

    Tan said he has stopped dealing with Indonesian domestic helpers and has shifted focus to those from the Philippines

    ['indonesian', 'domestic', 'may', 'say', 'agency']



  • BIDEN ADMINISTRATION SCALES BACK ELIGIBILITY FOR STUDENT LOAN FORGIVENESS. HERE'S WHO'S AFFECTED

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/biden-administration-scales-back-eligibility-232753805.html

    50.0% Shortened!

    Borrowers with incomes of less than $125,000 (or $250,000 for a couple) can qualify for up to $10,000 in debt forgiveness on their federal direct student loans

    This includes at least some of the loans issued through the Federal Family Education Loan, Federal Perkins Loan and Health Education Assistance Loan programs

    Initially, the administration said that qualified borrowers with these privately held loans could consolidate them into a federal direct loan and obtain debt relief

    On Thursday, however, the department's website said that to receive relief, borrowers had to have applied for a consolidation loan by Sept

    Some FFEL and Perkins loans are held by the Education Department, so they remain eligible for the blanket forgiveness if the borrowers meet the income limits

    To find out whether your FFEL or Perkins loans could qualify for forgiveness, go to your account at the Federal Student Aid site (studentaid.gov) and call up the ‚ÄúMy Loan Servicers‚Äù list

    If the servicer‚Äôs name is preceded by ‚ÄúDEPT OF ED,‚Äù that loan is held by the federal government

    More than 5 million of those loans are held by the Education Department

    Of the remaining, privately held but federally guaranteed loans, only a portion of the borrowers would meet the income limits for blanket loan forgiveness

    The change was reported on the same day that six Republican-controlled states sued to block the blanket debt forgiveness, arguing that the administration didn't have the authority to wipe out student loan balances

    By cutting off the ability to qualify for forgiveness by consolidating privately held FFELs, Perkins loans and HEALs into a direct loan, the administration is reducing lenders' and servicing companies' loss of future earnings

    ['federal', 'student', 'loan', 'relief', 'borrower']

    Borrowers with incomes of less than $125,000 (or $250,000 for a couple) can qualify for up to $10,000 in debt forgiveness on their federal direct student loans

    This includes at least some of the loans issued through the Federal Family Education Loan, Federal Perkins Loan and Health Education Assistance Loan programs

    Initially, the administration said that qualified borrowers with these privately held loans could consolidate them into a federal direct loan and obtain debt relief

    On Thursday, however, the department's website said that to receive relief, borrowers had to have applied for a consolidation loan by Sept

    Some FFEL and Perkins loans are held by the Education Department, so they remain eligible for the blanket forgiveness if the borrowers meet the income limits

    To find out whether your FFEL or Perkins loans could qualify for forgiveness, go to your account at the Federal Student Aid site (studentaid.gov) and call up the ‚ÄúMy Loan Servicers‚Äù list

    If the servicer‚Äôs name is preceded by ‚ÄúDEPT OF ED,‚Äù that loan is held by the federal government

    More than 5 million of those loans are held by the Education Department

    Of the remaining, privately held but federally guaranteed loans, only a portion of the borrowers would meet the income limits for blanket loan forgiveness

    The change was reported on the same day that six Republican-controlled states sued to block the blanket debt forgiveness, arguing that the administration didn't have the authority to wipe out student loan balances

    By cutting off the ability to qualify for forgiveness by consolidating privately held FFELs, Perkins loans and HEALs into a direct loan, the administration is reducing lenders' and servicing companies' loss of future earnings

    ['federal', 'student', 'loan', 'relief', 'borrower']

    https://www.thisisanfield.com/2022/09/i-just-dont-get-it-klopp-exasperated-over-criticism-of-trents-defending/

    Jurgen Klopp has not hidden his frustration over the continued calls that Trent Alexander-Arnold cannot defend throughout the years, and it remains the same after his England omission

    But that‚Äôs not how Southgate has seen it and Klopp was respectful in response when asked about Alexander-Arnold‚Äôs time with England, but did say from ‚Äúmy point of view, it‚Äôs an easy pick.‚Äù The stick that the No

    ‚ÄúTrent didn‚Äôt do well in these moments as well, but in other moments he defended exceptionally well ‚Äì but for him and his situation, nobody mentions it

    ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs an outstanding footballer in a situation where three other right-backs in this country are doing really well, we should not forget that

    ‚ÄúWe have the way we play, in our high press very often Trent is the highest of all the three in the back

    ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the way we play football, now they say ‚Äòdefend better‚Äô, you cannot have everything

    ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a risk we take, it‚Äôs not a crazy risk but in the one moment where we don‚Äôt win [the ball], people ask where is Trent? ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a question I don‚Äôt understand, everyone who watches football that often and that long why would you then say ‚Äòthat is his main job?‚Äô ‚Äì I told him he has to be there [in high press]

    ‚ÄúEvery player in the league has these challenges but all the experts [say] ‚Äòthis situation you see it is a weakness‚Äô

    ‚ÄúHonestly, I just don‚Äôt get it

    ‚ÄúIf he would not be a good defender he would not play

    ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs involved in everything, that‚Äôs absolutely fine and he is doing well

  • BAYERN MUNICH VS. BAYER LEVERKUSEN - FOOTBALL MATCH REPORT - SEPTEMBER 30, 2022

    https://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=638507

    10/01/2022, 04:35

    54.17% Shortened!

    Jamal Musiala scored once and set up two more goals as champions Bayern Munich cruised past Bayer Leverkusen 4-0 on Friday to snap a four-game winless run in the Bundesliga

    The Germany international delivered a superb performance for a confidence-boosting win ahead of Tuesday's Champions League group game against Viktoria Plzen and the big Bundesliga match against Borussia Dortmund next weekend

    "Everyone in the team wanted to win today

    Pressure is always there at Bayern." In a frenzied start, Musiala set up Leroy Sane for their first goal in the third minute to settle nerves in the Allianz Arena as the Bavarians were desperate to bounce back following their recent dip in form and their longest run without a win in 20 years

    He then helped Sadio Mane end his five-game goal drought, picking out the Senegalese in the box who sent another deflected effort past goalkeeper Lukas Hradecky for his first goal in front of a home crowd

    Musiala has now scored five times in the league and set up three goals

    The win lifted Bayern into second place in the Bundesliga on 15 points, two behind leaders Union Berlin, who travel to Eintracht Frankfurt on Saturday

    Fellow Champions League club, Bayer Leverkusen, who travel to Porto on Tuesday, slumped deeper into trouble, dropping to 16th in the league

    More Details Jamal Musiala starred as champions Bayern Munich cruised past Bayer Leverkusen 4-0 on Friday to snap a four-game winless run in the Bundesliga

    Jamal Musiala finishes the pass from Thomas Muller to give Bayern Munich a 2-0 lead

    Julian Nagelsmann speaks about his future ahead of Bayern Munich's clash with Bayer Leverkusen

    ['musiala', 'goal', 'bayern', 'leverkusen', 'game']

  • MAN UTD WANT JUDE BELLINGHAM AND FRENKIE DE JONG IN SENSATIONAL DOUBLE TRANSFER SWOOP TO TRANSFORM TEAM...

    https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/19974213/man-utd-jude-bellingham-frenkie-de-jong-transfer/

    10/01/2022

    50.0% Shortened!

    MANCHESTER UNITED want to sign Jude Bellingham AND Frenkie de Jong in the summer, according to reports

    The Red Devils are not planning a major overhaul of their squad in January, with Erik ten Hag set to wait until the end of the season

    But he will then look to bring in exciting talent - and ESPN claim De Jong and Bellingham are at the top of his wishlist

    Man Utd were linked with De Jong all summer, with Ten Hag keen to reunite with the Dutch international he brought through at Ajax

    Meanwhile, Bellingham committed to Borussia Dortmund for one more season but is set to leave in the summer

    However, Man Utd are hopeful they can beat off all the competition and bring him to Old Trafford

    Bellingham has been superb since joining Dortmund and showed that world-class talent on the international stage for England in their 3-3 draw with Germany on Monday

    HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL United boss Ten Hag will believe De Jong and Bellingham can help bring the team closer to his desired style of play

    But the Dutchman will still be keen to move towards a possession-based style in the future, with Bellingham and De Jong the type of midfielders which can thrive in that type of system

    "The Sun", "Sun", "Sun Online" are registered trademarks or trade names of News Group Newspapers Limited

    To see all content on The Sun, please use the Site Map

    ['united', 'bellingham', 'jong', 'summer', 'ten']

    MANCHESTER UNITED want to sign Jude Bellingham AND Frenkie de Jong in the summer, according to reports

    The Red Devils are not planning a major overhaul of their squad in January, with Erik ten Hag set to wait until the end of the season

    But he will then look to bring in exciting talent - and ESPN claim De Jong and Bellingham are at the top of his wishlist

    Man Utd were linked with De Jong all summer, with Ten Hag keen to reunite with the Dutch international he brought through at Ajax

    Meanwhile, Bellingham committed to Borussia Dortmund for one more season but is set to leave in the summer

    However, Man Utd are hopeful they can beat off all the competition and bring him to Old Trafford

    Bellingham has been superb since joining Dortmund and showed that world-class talent on the international stage for England in their 3-3 draw with Germany on Monday

    HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL United boss Ten Hag will believe De Jong and Bellingham can help bring the team closer to his desired style of play

    But the Dutchman will still be keen to move towards a possession-based style in the future, with Bellingham and De Jong the type of midfielders which can thrive in that type of system

  • 'HE'S THE MOST IMPORTANT PART!': TOTTENHAM CAN'T AFFORD TO LOSE ANTONIO CONTE, SAYS PETER CROUCH

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11269621/Hes-important-Tottenham-afford-lose-Antonio-Conte-says-Peter-Crouch.html

    10/01/2022

    45.0% Shortened!

    The Italian coach has been a revelation in North London since taking charge last November, having managed to turn around their dismal form sustained under Nuno Espirito Santo

    The immediate impact has been telling.'¬† Fellow pundit, and former player under Conte, Cesc Fabregas was quick to highlight the Italian's desire to 'control everything' within his team

    He got rid of [Branislav] Ivanovic club legend, [Diego] Costa our best striker - he doesn‚Äôt get attached to anybody.¬† 'He does what he believes is the best decision for him and the club

    The team is always the most important for everyone in Italy.'¬† Conte has already shown his willingness to make changes at a club quickly, such as Tanguy Ndombele, Giovani Lo Celso and Harry Winks found out this summer.¬† Conte recently dismissed rumours linking him with a potential return to Serie A side Juventus Meanwhile, Rio Ferdinand assessed the Italian against Arsenal's Mikel Arteta

    ‚ÄòWe have just started the season and we have a long time to live together and to understand, to continue to work together,‚Äô said Conte, who signed a deal until June 2023 when he arrived last November.

    By posting your comment you agree to our house rules

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual We will automatically post your comment and a link to the news story to your Facebook timeline at the same time it is posted on MailOnline

    To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account

    We‚Äôll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook

    ['mailonline', 'comment', 'conte', 'club', 'say']



  • IT'S BYE-BYE, SHAH ALAM STADIUM

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/01/its-bye-bye-shah-alam-stadium

    10/01/2022

    50.0% Shortened!

    However, no date has been announced for the demolition of both the Shah Alam Stadium and the Malawati Indoor Stadium and redevelopment of the more than 80ha complex

    Malaysian Resources Corporation Bhd (MRCB) group managing director Imran Salim said existing structures would have to be torn down to resolve the issue of flash floods in the stadium, and a new moveable pitch be built instead

    The new pitch will sit within the stadium bowl with a fixed roof on a raised platform with its own irrigation system, which will negate the use of surface drainage and also enable spectators to be closer to the action on the pitch

    ‚Äî Bernama However, the proposal does not include a track for athletics events, although open spaces around the complex could accommodate such a track in future

    The stadium can be converted for indoor or outdoor use with a movable pitch, and will be able to accommodate between 35,000 and 45,000 spectators

    Imran said that the multi-use stadium would be football-centric, and aimed to obtain Fifa certification to be an international tournament stadium

    The final specification of the complex will depend on discussions with the Selangor government

    Menteri Besar Incorporated chief executive officer Norita Mohd Sidek said the complex would play a significant role in the economic development of the state

    ‚ÄúThe new complex has been identified as having a high economic impact in one of the zones under the First Selangor Plan,‚Äù he said

    In July, Selangor Mentri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari said the project‚Äôs cost would be capped at RM787mil through a public-private partnership that would involve the developer being given land in exchange for building the entire complex

    We would love to keep you posted on the latest promotion

    ['shah', 'alam', 'complex', 'stadium', 'say']

    However, no date has been announced for the demolition of both the Shah Alam Stadium and the Malawati Indoor Stadium and redevelopment of the more than 80ha complex

    Malaysian Resources Corporation Bhd (MRCB) group managing director Imran Salim said existing structures would have to be torn down to resolve the issue of flash floods in the stadium, and a new moveable pitch be built instead

    The new pitch will sit within the stadium bowl with a fixed roof on a raised platform with its own irrigation system, which will negate the use of surface drainage and also enable spectators to be closer to the action on the pitch

    ‚Äî Bernama However, the proposal does not include a track for athletics events, although open spaces around the complex could accommodate such a track in future

  • AH LONG STRIKES THE WRONG TARGET

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/10/01/ah-long-strikes-the-wrong-target

    10/01/2022

    42.11% Shortened!

    Salesman Muhammad Abdul Halim Zaini, who believes that it was the work of loan sharks targeting the former occupants of the vacant house, said all his family members, who live in different parts of the country, had gathered at his mother‚Äôs place in Taman Cempaka since Wednesday

    ‚ÄúThere was not enough space to park our cars since there were so many of us,‚Äù he said, adding that he resorted to parking his sister‚Äôs car in front of the house across the road on Thursday night

    He said the house had been unoccupied following the recent death of a woman who lived there

    So I was shocked when I went to the car at around 7am.‚Äù Lam Ah Lek, who is the brother of the deceased woman, said his sibling died last month

    But her son, who is in his 40s, did not come back for the funeral, said Lam, who lives nearby too

    We are unable to contact him.‚Äù Lam, 67, said loan sharks had splashed paint onto the porch six months ago

    ‚ÄúAt that time, a tenant who parked his car in the porch, had red paint all over his car

    ‚ÄúWith my sister gone now, the house cannot be put up for rent or sold off as we are worried that the loan sharks would harass those staying in that house,‚Äù he said

    Low hoped that police would investigate the matter

    ‚ÄúLam is afraid that the loan sharks may come back to destroy the house or do something worse,‚Äù he said.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    Feel like I really like Laksa," said Nam, before Golding suggested the Penang version to be specific to which Nam responded with a 'Yes!'

    Meanwhile for Golding, it would be Bak Kut Teh, the Klang version

    "Bak Kut Teh is my go to

    But, the Klang version

    "But Klang's is like this broth that's been brewing for generations

    "If it stops boiling, it will grow like this thickness of just fur and bacteria but it‚Äôs delicious

    Local netizens have expressed surprise and praised both their responses, Golding for not forgetting his Malaysian roots and Nam for selecting a Malaysian dish

    Some fans even praised Golding for pronouncing Klang properly.

    https://www.thesundaily.my/home/shot-fired-at-car-parked-outside-home-YH9900634

    10/01/2022

    42.86% Shortened!

    Perak police chief Datuk Mohd Yusri Hassan Basri (pix) said a man called the police at 1.07 pm yesterday to inform about the incident

    ‚ÄúThe police rushed to the scene and according to the house owner, who is staying with his wife and two children, his wife had heard an explosion outside the house earlier in the morning, but ignored it

    Mohd Yusri said a team from the Forensic Division (D10) of the Criminal Investigation Department of the Perak Police Contingent Headquarters was at the scene and found a hole in the rear window of the victim‚Äôs car, believed to be from gun shots, as well as a bullet casing

    He said the police were investigating the case under Section 8 of the Firearms (Increased Penalty) Act 1971

    ['police', 'investigate', 'incident', 'house', 'mohd']

  • THIS IS HOW MUCH A $200,000 ANNUITY WILL SCORE YOU MONTHLY

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-does-200-000-annuity-120000015.html

    72.5% Shortened!

    An annuity can be an appealing option to build your retirement nest egg

    But the exact amount that you‚Äôll get from an annuity each month will vary

    What Is an Annuity? An annuity is a financial contract between an investor and an insurance company that generally locks in a regular monthly payout in exchange for an investment

    You can buy an annuity if you want a guaranteed source of income for any situation

    An immediate annuity kicks in right away

    But you‚Äôll typically see a higher monthly payment with a deferred annuity

    If you sign up for a fixed annuity, you‚Äôll lock in guaranteed monthly payments

    If you sign up for a variable annuity, you won‚Äôt find guaranteed monthly payments

    Should You Get an Annuity? Depending on your financial circumstances, an annuity could be a reliable stream of income for your retirement

    An annuity sends a monthly payment to you every month

    If you can‚Äôt decide whether or not an annuity is right for you then it‚Äôs time to talk to a financial advisor

    ['annuity', 'retirement', 'income', 'financial', 'monthly']

    You can buy an annuity if you want a guaranteed source of income for any situation

    An immediate annuity kicks in right away

    But you‚Äôll typically see a higher monthly payment with a deferred annuity

    If you sign up for a fixed annuity, you‚Äôll lock in guaranteed monthly payments

    If you sign up for a variable annuity, you won‚Äôt find guaranteed monthly payments

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/top-apple-executive-leaving-making-185638195.html

    54.17% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- One of Apple Inc.‚Äôs most senior executives is leaving after he turned up in a viral video on TikTok making an off-color joke that he fondles ‚Äúbig-breasted women‚Äù for a living

    5, Apple‚Äôs Tony Blevins was approached by TikTok and Instagram creator Daniel Mac as part of a series where he asks owners of expensive cars their occupations

    He also touted that he has a ‚Äúhell of a dental plan.‚Äù In reality, Blevins is Apple‚Äôs vice president of procurement and is in charge of striking deals with suppliers and partners

    Blevins, a 22-year veteran of Apple, confirmed the incident to Bloomberg, saying the encounter took place on Aug

    An Apple spokesman said Thursday that Blevins is departing the Cupertino, California-based company

    Blevins has been part of a roughly 100-person group of vice presidents at Apple and one of only about 30 executives that report to either Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook or Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams

    Williams has been Blevins‚Äôs boss for much of his career, though he briefly reported to Sabih Khan, Apple‚Äôs senior vice president of operations, according to the people

    It was Williams‚Äôs decision for the company and Blevins to part ways, one of the people said

    The operating chief will oversee Blevins‚Äôs old team, at least for now, according to the person

    The TikTok video was taken at a car show that Blevins attended last month in Pebble Beach, California

    Blevins‚Äôs departure opens up a void at Apple

    ['apple', 'executive', 'video', 'blevins', 'say']

  • HOUSE DEMOCRATS HAVE OFFICIALLY DRAFTED A BILL THAT BANS POLITICIANS, JUDGES, THEIR SPOUSES AND CHILDREN FROM TRADING STOCKS ‚Äî BUT HERE'S WHAT THEY'RE STILL ALLOWED TO OWN AND DO

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/house-democrats-officially-drafted-bill-154500661.html

    56.0% Shortened!

    Democrats have introduced legislation that would ban senior government officials from owning and trading stocks

    The bill, called the Combating Financial Conflicts of Interest in Government Act, is an attempt to limit conflict of interest for public office holders and their families when it comes to their investments

    The proposed bill is wide reaching

    And while it doesn‚Äôt make them clairvoyant, it‚Äôs certainly an advantage when it comes to the market

    Senior officials and others affected by the bill will be required to either sell their holdings when they take their position or put them into a blind trust, where they would have no control over trades

    Critics have been calling for such a bill for years, but the House and Senate have long resisted

    It happened soon before the Senate was expected to vote on a bipartisan bill that would see domestic chipmakers get a $52 billion subsidy

    The bill was passed in July and, amid the scrutiny, Paul Pelosi sold his holdings in the semiconductor manufacturer at a six-figure loss

    But months before that summer scandal, as calls for legislation to combat the issue mounted, Nancy Pelosi directed the House Administration Committee to draft a bill back in February

    The feeling that the well-connected in Congress have a leg up on the market has been growing over the years

    But it may be a while yet before Congress makes a decision on the bill

    ['would', 'senior', 'bill', 'call', 'come']

    Democrats have introduced legislation that would ban senior government officials from owning and trading stocks

    The bill, called the Combating Financial Conflicts of Interest in Government Act, is an attempt to limit conflict of interest for public office holders and their families when it comes to their investments

    The proposed bill is wide reaching

    And while it doesn‚Äôt make them clairvoyant, it‚Äôs certainly an advantage when it comes to the market

    Senior officials and others affected by the bill will be required to either sell their holdings when they take their position or put them into a blind trust, where they would have no control over trades

    Critics have been calling for such a bill for years, but the House and Senate have long resisted

    It happened soon before the Senate was expected to vote on a bipartisan bill that would see domestic chipmakers get a $52 billion subsidy

    The bill was passed in July and, amid the scrutiny, Paul Pelosi sold his holdings in the semiconductor manufacturer at a six-figure loss

    But months before that summer scandal, as calls for legislation to combat the issue mounted, Nancy Pelosi directed the House Administration Committee to draft a bill back in February

    The feeling that the well-connected in Congress have a leg up on the market has been growing over the years

    But it may be a while yet before Congress makes a decision on the bill

    ['would', 'senior', 'bill', 'call', 'come']



  • HOW MUCH MONEY DO I NEED TO LIVE ENTIRELY OFF DIVIDENDS? HERE IS THE LOWEST AMOUNT YOU CAN PROBABLY GET AWAY WITH

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-money-live-entirely-off-182000078.html

    67.65% Shortened!

    But how much money do you realistically need to be able to drop out of the workforce and get by on dividend payouts alone? While you will have to start by honestly assessing what you can live with ‚Äî and without

    But there‚Äôs a simple formula and some less simple risks you‚Äôll need to consider when making the big dividend-dependency decision

    For straight-up equity investors, those cash payouts fuel dividend income ‚Äî where passively generated payouts cover your living expenses

    How much you‚Äôll need exactly depends on your income, spending habits and living expenses

    But once you know how much you‚Äôll need to live, here‚Äôs a simple formula to apply that to sort out how much you need in total

    Next, consider what you can reasonably expect from dividend yields

    It‚Äôs fair to plan on yield rates between 1% and 6%

    Dividend payments from a taxable brokerage account, or traditional 401(k) and IRA accounts, are considered taxable income

    If you think you can manage expenses at a median dividend income, then planning is everything

    Handled carefully, the pursuit of steady, sustainable dividend income can be a winning play

    For older Americans, living off dividend income could make sense, especially if it delays taking a Social Security benefit

    ['portfolio', 'income', 'need', 'dividend', 'company']

    For older Americans, living off dividend income could make sense, especially if it delays taking a Social Security benefit
