  • JIM CRAMER SAYS BUY THESE 2 HIGH-YIELD DIVIDEND STOCKS ‚Äî INCLUDING ONE WITH 10% YIELD

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/jim-cramer-says-buy-2-002323365.html

    80.0% Shortened!

    This, in turn, brings Cramer to a specific investment choice -- high-yield dividend stocks

    Drilling down, Devon reported net income of $1.9 billion, or $2.59 per diluted share

    Even better, for investors, was the $2.1 billion in free cash flow reported for 2Q22, a company record for Devon

    This was up 22% from the previous quarter, and the highest single dividend that Devon has ever paid

    Based on the current dividend yield and the expected price appreciation, the stock has ~102% potential total return profile

    This gives the stock a Moderate Buy analyst consensus rating

    (See DVN stock forecast on TipRanks) KeyCorp (KEY) We‚Äôll shift our focus now, as Cramer‚Äôs second high-yielding div stock is a Bancorp, KeyCorp, the holding company with ownership of KeyBank

    In the recent second quarter of 2022, the company had total revenue of $1.8 billion, well in the $1.7 billion to $2 billion range it has hit for the past 8 quarters

    This was down from the 72 cents reported in the year-ago quarter, but still solidly profitable ‚Äì and more than enough to cover the 19.5 cent per common share dividend payment

    Buy) rating, as well as a $29 price target that indicates potential for 79% upside in the next 12 months

    The stock‚Äôs average price target of $22.19 gives ~37% upside to the current price of $16.17

    ['high', 'cramer', 'dividend', 'stock', 'devon']

  • LIVERPOOL: JURGEN KLOPP UNDERSTANDS WHY 'WORLD CLASS' TRENT ALEXANDER-ARNOLD IS SNUBBED BY ENGLAND

    https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-11266959/Jurgen-Klopp-admits-understands-World-class-Trent-Alexander-Arnold-snubbed-England.html

    09/30/2022, 23:03

    56.0% Shortened!

    Klopp was respectful of Southgate and would not be drawn into discussions about the selections he made for his team, insisting that whatever he said would not help England's chances of being successful at the World Cup finals

    Jurgen Klopp has insisted Trent Alexander-Arnold is 'world class' despite recent form What Klopp could not hold back on, though, was the notion that Alexander-Arnold is somehow deficient in his defensive capabilities and he was incredulous that he would pick the 23-year-old if he was somehow lacking in key qualities to play the position

    While Liverpool's manager did concede that Alexander-Arnold has been below form at times this season - as has been the case for his team in general - the belief he has in a young man who has only been capped 17 times by England could not be higher

    'It helps Germany, maybe, it doesn't help England

    'A manager picks a player, or not, which I would obviously decide differently but I'm not in charge of this team and that's how it is

    Whichever team I would coach in the moment, I would sign him because he is exceptional

    We‚Äôll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook

    ['comment', 'klopp', 'england', 'would', 'team']

    Klopp was respectful of Southgate and would not be drawn into discussions about the selections he made for his team, insisting that whatever he said would not help England's chances of being successful at the World Cup finals

    Jurgen Klopp has insisted Trent Alexander-Arnold is 'world class' despite recent form What Klopp could not hold back on, though, was the notion that Alexander-Arnold is somehow deficient in his defensive capabilities and he was incredulous that he would pick the 23-year-old if he was somehow lacking in key qualities to play the position

    While Liverpool's manager did concede that Alexander-Arnold has been below form at times this season - as has been the case for his team in general - the belief he has in a young man who has only been capped 17 times by England could not be higher

    'It helps Germany, maybe, it doesn't help England

    'A manager picks a player, or not, which I would obviously decide differently but I'm not in charge of this team and that's how it is

    Whichever team I would coach in the moment, I would sign him because he is exceptional

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual We will automatically post your comment and a link to the news story to your Facebook timeline at the same time it is posted on MailOnline

    To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account

    We‚Äôll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    HARRY MAGUIRE has been ruled out of the Manchester derby with a hamstring injury, manager Erik ten Hag has confirmed

    The Man Utd skipper, 29, has been out of favour in recent weeks, with Ten Hag opting to select the pair of Lisandro Martinez and Raphael Varane instead

    And Ten Hag will once again be absolved of the dilemma whether to pick Maguire or not against rivals Man City as he is unavailable for selection

    "Even after he wasn't in the team he trained really well and the quality was there

    "You see his career, for Leicester and Manchester United almost 50 caps for England, performing really well, what you see is high potential

  • U.S. CONSUMER SPENDING REBOUNDS IN AUGUST; INFLATION PICKS UP

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/u-consumer-spending-rebounds-august-124615715.html

    56.0% Shortened!

    Still, inflation picked up last month

    The personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index rose 0.3% last month after dipping 0.1% in July

    In the 12 months through August, the PCE price index increased 6.2% after advancing 6.4% in July

    Excluding the volatile food and energy components, the PCE price index jumped 0.6% after being unchanged in July

    The so-called core PCE price index climbed 4.9% on a year-on-year basis in August after increasing 4.7% in July

    The Fed tracks the PCE price indexes for its 2% inflation target

    The consumer price index increased 8.3% year-on-year in August

    The Fed raised its median forecast for core PCE inflation to 4.5% this year from its previous estimate of 4.3% in June

    Inflation adjusted consumer spending barely rose in August

    That suggests consumer spending could be tepid this quarter after helping to blunt the drag on gross domestic product from a slow down in the pace of inventory accumulation in the second quarter

    The economy contracted at a 0.6% annualized rate last quarter after shrinking at a 1.6% pace in the January-March quarter

    ['consumer', 'august', 'inflation', 'quarter', 'increase']

    Still, inflation picked up last month

    The personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index rose 0.3% last month after dipping 0.1% in July

    In the 12 months through August, the PCE price index increased 6.2% after advancing 6.4% in July

    Excluding the volatile food and energy components, the PCE price index jumped 0.6% after being unchanged in July

    The so-called core PCE price index climbed 4.9% on a year-on-year basis in August after increasing 4.7% in July

    The Fed tracks the PCE price indexes for its 2% inflation target

    The consumer price index increased 8.3% year-on-year in August

    The Fed raised its median forecast for core PCE inflation to 4.5% this year from its previous estimate of 4.3% in June

    Inflation adjusted consumer spending barely rose in August

    That suggests consumer spending could be tepid this quarter after helping to blunt the drag on gross domestic product from a slow down in the pace of inventory accumulation in the second quarter

    The economy contracted at a 0.6% annualized rate last quarter after shrinking at a 1.6% pace in the January-March quarter

    ['consumer', 'august', 'inflation', 'quarter', 'increase']

  • 2 ‚ÄòSTRONG BUY‚Äô DIVIDEND STOCKS YIELDING AT LEAST 8%

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/2-strong-buy-dividend-stocks-004214179.html

    79.63% Shortened!

    The company had a net income of $1.33 billion, an increase of $700 million year-over-year, or 90%

    For the second quarter of 2022, ET had a DCF of $1.88 billion, up a solid $500 million from the year-ago quarter

    This is the source of the company‚Äôs dividend, so the increase is important

    ET set its most recent dividend, for the second quarter of the year, paid out in August at 23 cents per common share

    This yield matches the current rate of inflation; investors can use this dividend to provide a stronger level of protection against the effects of price inflation

    Based on the current dividend yield and the expected price appreciation, the stock has ~45% potential total return profile

    The stock has a trading price of $10.97 and an average price target of $15.20, implying a one-year upside of ~39%

    Proceeds from these properties generated Q2 revenues of $70.5 million, for a 44% year-over-year increase

    These results meant that IIPR‚Äôs dividend is affordable ‚Äì and in fact, management raised the dividend payment in the most recent declaration

    At that yield, it almost matches the rate of inflation

    Shares are trading for $88.09, and their $161.83 average target implies a one-year upside of ~84%

  • SENATORS ARE FIGHTING TO HELP YOU TO BUY MORE I BONDS SOON

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/senators-fighting-help-buy-more-185434555.html

    57.14% Shortened!

    For more help with planning your retirement, consider working with a financial advisor

    As of right now, you can purchase $10,000 in I bonds digitally each year, plus $5,000 in paper I bonds

    savings bonds - if you buy a $50 bond, you'll actually pay $50 for it

    There are a few loopholes to get around the $10,000 limit

    You can have your spouse purchase up to $10,000 as well, and if you have a business or trust you can also purchase up to $10,000 in the name of that entity

    New I Bond Legislation While I bonds will see the interest rate adjusted as usual in November, an even bigger change may be coming to the security - allowing people to buy more of them annually under certain conditions

    The new legislation - introduced by Sen

    They have a guaranteed interest rate and can last for various lengths of time

    Currently, you can only purchase up to $10,000 in I bonds each year

    Retirement Planning Tips For help with integrating I bonds into your retirement portfolio, consider working with a financial advisor

    Finding a qualified financial advisor doesn't have to be hard

    If you're ready to find an advisor who can help you achieve your financial goals, get started now

    ['bond', 'year', 'retirement', 'financial', 'advisor']

    You can have your spouse purchase up to $10,000 as well, and if you have a business or trust you can also purchase up to $10,000 in the name of that entity

  • IS MALAYSIA PREPARED FOR GLOBAL ECONOMIC SHOCK?

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/09/30/is-malaysia-prepared-for-global-economic-shock

    09/30/2022

    72.5% Shortened!

    THERE is a growing chorus sounding global recession alarm bells

    The World Bank has warned that simultaneous global rate hikes in response to inflation could trigger a recession in 2023

    With the risk of a global recession, especially in the United States and Europe being worried about, is Malaysia safer than we were during the Covid-19 pandemic crisis in 2020-2021 and the Global Financial Crisis in 2008-2009? The answer is Malaysia will be manageable but will not be fully insulated from an external economic shock if triggered by a global recession or a severe recession in the US economy and Europe

    Unemployment Domestic labour market has not fully recovered as July‚Äôs unemployment rate of 3.7% is still a distance from the pre-pandemic jobless rate of 3.3%

    In addition, skill-related (36.7% in second-quarter 2022 or 2Q22 versus 34.8% in 4Q19) and time-related (1.4% in 2Q22 versus 1.1% in 4Q19) underemployment is still a hindrance to a sustainable economic recovery

    Domestic demand Second is relying on domestic demand (private consumption and private investment), backed by public investment and government-linked investment companies‚Äô investment

    Can the households brace for an economic slowdown? The job market and wage growth will slow

    On businesses, policymakers need to put in place measures to ease the constraints that confront labour market, cost of doing business, regulatory as well as compliance cost, and trade networks

    Both domestic financial and foreign exchange markets would witness persistent volatility arising from the negative spillover effects of the global financial markets if a recession hit major advanced economies

    Bank Negara will have the policy tools to ensure an orderly foreign exchange market and ensure sufficient domestic liquidity (both the ringgit and US dollar) to support the economy

    The monetary policy must be employed consistently to support domestic demand, in a timely manner, and to ensure price stability

    ['global', 'recession', 'economic', 'high', 'rate']

    THERE is a growing chorus sounding global recession alarm bells

    The World Bank has warned that simultaneous global rate hikes in response to inflation could trigger a recession in 2023

    With the risk of a global recession, especially in the United States and Europe being worried about, is Malaysia safer than we were during the Covid-19 pandemic crisis in 2020-2021 and the Global Financial Crisis in 2008-2009? The answer is Malaysia will be manageable but will not be fully insulated from an external economic shock if triggered by a global recession or a severe recession in the US economy and Europe

    Unemployment Domestic labour market has not fully recovered as July‚Äôs unemployment rate of 3.7% is still a distance from the pre-pandemic jobless rate of 3.3%

    In addition, skill-related (36.7% in second-quarter 2022 or 2Q22 versus 34.8% in 4Q19) and time-related (1.4% in 2Q22 versus 1.1% in 4Q19) underemployment is still a hindrance to a sustainable economic recovery

    Domestic demand Second is relying on domestic demand (private consumption and private investment), backed by public investment and government-linked investment companies‚Äô investment

    Can the households brace for an economic slowdown? The job market and wage growth will slow

    On businesses, policymakers need to put in place measures to ease the constraints that confront labour market, cost of doing business, regulatory as well as compliance cost, and trade networks

    Both domestic financial and foreign exchange markets would witness persistent volatility arising from the negative spillover effects of the global financial markets if a recession hit major advanced economies

    Bank Negara will have the policy tools to ensure an orderly foreign exchange market and ensure sufficient domestic liquidity (both the ringgit and US dollar) to support the economy

    The monetary policy must be employed consistently to support domestic demand, in a timely manner, and to ensure price stability

    ['global', 'recession', 'economic', 'high', 'rate']

    https://paultan.org/2022/09/30/geely-acquires-7-6-stake-in-aston-martin-lagonda/

    09/30/2022

    45.0% Shortened!

    In a statement, Geely Holding Group CEO Daniel Donghui Li said that Geely‚Äôs well-established track record and technology offerings would be able to contribute to Aston Martin‚Äôs future success

    Geely‚Äôs inclusion as a shareholder in Aston Martin Lagonda comes three months after Saudi Arabia‚Äôs Public Investment Fund (PIF) took a 16.7% stake in the automaker, which has been beset with high debt in recent times

    Another significant shareholder is Mercedes-Benz, which presently has a 9.7% stake in Aston Martin after the capital increase made in July

    It was not disclosed how much representation Geely will have in terms of board seats

    Comments Proton Aston Habesla Britain dah jual to China! Oh wait, Jag & LR dah jual to India, Mini dah jual to Jerman, MG dah jual to China, Lotus & Caterham dah jual to Mesia.

    No doubt Geely is being strategic and good for them in expanding their wings in a free market with level playing field

    Now 120 years later, China came to Britain and conquered them through economics.

    U mean western companies can freely do anything they want in China such as buy Chinese companies? Imperialised, seriously In Todays world ? If it is one needs to look at how china operates

    No doubt Geely is being strategic and good for them in expanding their wings in a free market with level playing field

    120 years ago Britain came to China and conquered them through force.

    Now 120 years later, China came to Britain and conquered them through economics.

    ['aston', 'martin', 'geely', 'september', 'china']

    09/30/2022, 16:03

    47.83% Shortened!

    Liverpool are considering signing young Egyptian attacker Ibrahim Adel in January

    90min report that Liverpool scouts were already ‚Äòfamiliar‚Äô with Adel before Salah‚Äôs recommendation, though

    But should Liverpool make a move, Adel would have to be loaned out

    As he wouldn‚Äôt be able to come into the first team straight away on account of work permit issues, Adel would be a signing for the future

    At twenty-one, he‚Äôs already broken into the Egyptian national team

    As far as comparisons go, it would feel lazy to lump him into the Salah bracket

    In that respect, perhaps a move to Liverpool wouldn‚Äôt do Adel much good

    Because he wouldn‚Äôt be able to play straight away, this may make it difficult for him to live up to that tag

    The figures involved make it no gamble at all for Liverpool

    If he develops as Salah did, he‚Äôll make a fine player

    If not, Liverpool could still earn a good fee from him as they did with the likes of Taiwo Awoniyi, who never played for the club during a six-year spell

    Like Awoniyi, Adel looks set for a bright future in Europe whether that‚Äôs at Liverpool or elsewhere

  • JAPAN'S NIKKEI FALLS 2%; ASIA-PACIFIC MARKETS SLIDE AFTER S&P 500 CLOSES AT NEW YEAR-LOW

    https://www.cnbc.com/2022/09/30/asia-markets-wall-street-china-pmi-stocks-currencies.html

    09/30/2022, 15:05

    80.7% Shortened!

    China's official factory activity data unexpectedly expanded in August, beating estimates

    In Japan, the Nikkei 225 slipped 1.83% to 25,937.21, and the Topix index fell 1.76% to 1,835.94

    Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company fell 2.41% and Largan Precision slumped 4.39%

    The 50-point mark separates growth from contraction

    PMI prints compare activity from month to month

    The official non-manufacturing PMI came in at 50.6 in September, down from 52.6 in August

    ‚Äî Abigail Ng China's official¬†manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    ‚Äî Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

    The central bank also signaled it may raise interest rates up to as high as 4.6% in 2023 to control inflation

    Data also provided by

    ['index', 'fell', 'inflation', 'month', 'bank']

    Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company fell 2.41% and Largan Precision slumped 4.39%

    The 50-point mark separates growth from contraction

    PMI prints compare activity from month to month

    The official non-manufacturing PMI came in at 50.6 in September, down from 52.6 in August

  • PEP GUARDIOLA DEMANDS MAN CITY BE 'PERFECT' TO WIN MAN UNITED CLASH

    https://www.espn.com/soccer/manchester-city-engman_city/story/4757241/pep-guardiola-demands-man-city-be-perfect-to-win-man-united-clash

    09/30/2022

    47.62% Shortened!

    Shaka Hislop reveals how he expects Erik ten Hag to counter the threat of Man City's Erling Haaland

    Manchester United have only lost two of their last eight visits to the Etihad Stadium, winning three of the last four, and Guardiola said he is wary of the threat posed by Erik ten Hag's team

    When you are anxious it is difficult to take the right one

    The quality they have is undoubted for many years." United have recovered from two defeats to start the season to move up to fifth in the table with four league wins in a row leading to Ten Hag being named Premier League manager of the month for September

    City, meanwhile, have started the campaign with five wins and two draws from their first seven games, but Guardiola said the derby atmosphere should lift his players to an even higher level against United

    "They [United] come from a very good result against Southampton away which is not easy and Arsenal at home, good momentum for them," he added

    "It's a big rivalry in the city and I will try to figure out what they are going to do and what we can do to beat them

    I'm looking forward to the game

    "[Stones] will not be four, five or six weeks [out], it will be less," Guardiola said

    "I don't know when he will come back, but I think maybe 10 days to two weeks

    "Hopefully [surgery] will solve the problem [with Phillips] and hopefully he is ready and can come back in time for the World Cup and after the World Cup, come back with us."

    ['city', 'guardiola', 'say', 'win', 'united']

  • SALESMAN FINDS RED PAINT SPLASHED ON SISTER'S CAR IN IPOH

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/30/salesman-finds-red-paint-splashed-on-sister039s-car-in-ipoh

    09/30/2022, 13:04

    50.0% Shortened!

    Friday, 30 Sep 2022

    Red paint was splashed on a house and a neighbour car at Taman Cempaka Ipoh by the loan shark.The neighbour who park the car at the victim's house washing the vehichles splash with red paint

    ‚ÄúBecause there were many of us, and not enough space to park our cars, I parked my sister‚Äôs car in front of the unoccupied house last night (Sept 29)

    ‚ÄúWhen I checked the car around 7am today, I was shocked to see red paint all over,‚Äù he said when Perak MCA public services and complaints bureau chief Low Guo Nan visited the place Friday (Sept 30)

    A note was found pasted near the front gate of the house with a message addressed to ‚ÄúLew‚Äù with a WhatsApp number

    A man known as Lam, 67, who stays nearby, said his sister had passed away last month, and that Lew, who is in his 40s, had not even come back for her funeral

    ‚ÄúSix months ago, loan sharks had splashed paint inside the porch as well

    At that time, a tenant who parked his car on the porch, had red paint all over his car

    ‚ÄúLew is nowhere to be found, and with my sister gone now, the house cannot be put on rent or sold as we fear the loan sharks will continue to harass those staying in that house,‚Äù he said

    Low hoped the police would take stern action and investigate the matter

    ‚ÄúLam is afraid that the loan sharks may come back to burn the house or something worse could happen

    ['red', 'paint', 'house', 'car', 'loan']

  • IRAN PROTESTS AND THE PRESSURE ON PLAYERS AT WORLD CUP

    https://global.espn.com/football/ir-iran/story/4756413/iran-protests-and-the-pressure-on-players-at-world-cup

    09/30/2022

    69.44% Shortened!

    Mark Ogden reports from outside the Lusail Stadium, which will host the World Cup final

    Long live Iranian women!" The reference was clear

    "I have to apologize to the players of the national team because I caused my dear friends to be annoyed some supporters even insulted the national team," he wrote

    It's already here and has been for a very long time

    And nothing is bigger than the World Cup that Iran will be participating this November in Qatar, where they're in a group with the United States, England and Wales

    The elephant in the room is what happens when Iran kick off their World Cup campaign against England on Nov

    But there is no "morality police" in Qatar -- at least not of the kind they have in Iran -- and Muslim women aren't forced to wear headscarves (though many do so by choice or custom)

    Iran is not in a position to compel Qatar to do anything and even less so while the world is watching, and it has pledged to be welcoming and inclusive (at least for the duration of the tournament)

    On the one hand, the vast majority have family, friends and business interests in Iran and could face repercussions back home if they take a public stand in Qatar

    These are the pressures facing Team Melli, six weeks removed from the World Cup

    Just don't tell them politics and social messaging have no place in football

    ['world', 'iran', 'take', 'team', 'iranian']

    "I have to apologize to the players of the national team because I caused my dear friends to be annoyed some supporters even insulted the national team," he wrote

  • REPORT: GE15 DATE DECISION ON THE CARDS AS UMNO SUPREME COUNCIL MEETS TONIGHT

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/30/report-ge15-date-decision-on-the-cards-as-umno-supreme-council-meets-tonight/30895

    09/30/2022, 10:34

    60.71% Shortened!

    According to the report, Parliament may be dissolved as early as October 12

    The BN government under Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad made a similar move in 1999, tabling the Budget for the following year and then dissolving Parliament to pave the way for election before it was passed

    The 14th Parliament‚Äôs term will automatically end in July next year and a general election must be called within 60 days

    But it is understood that the general election this time could be held within four weeks of Parliament‚Äôs dissolution, depending on how many states with expiring mandates dissolve their respective legislatures

    Umno deputy president Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan said in August that Ismail had said election would be held this year

    Ismail Sabri is Umno vice-president who broke party and national history by becoming prime minister instead of those above him in the hierarchy

    In 2018, then prime minister Najib Razak went almost the full five-year term, only announcing Parliament‚Äôs dissolution on April 6, weeks before his mandate expired

    Pakatan Harapan (PH) ended up with 121 seats in the 222-seat Parliament with Dr Mahathir becoming prime minister for the second time

    ‚ÄúIt depends on the Election Commission but I think a general election this time will be held on a weekend, not a weekday like the last time or people will get angry again,‚Äù an Umno source told The Malaysian Insight

    Better to end this charade now and get a government with a clear mandate,‚Äù he added

    That coalition government fell apart when Bersatu president and prime minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin lost majority support in Parliament

    ['parliament', 'election', 'poll', 'government', 'year']

    According to the report, Parliament may be dissolved as early as October 12

    The BN government under Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad made a similar move in 1999, tabling the Budget for the following year and then dissolving Parliament to pave the way for election before it was passed

    The 14th Parliament‚Äôs term will automatically end in July next year and a general election must be called within 60 days

    But it is understood that the general election this time could be held within four weeks of Parliament‚Äôs dissolution, depending on how many states with expiring mandates dissolve their respective legislatures

    Umno deputy president Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan said in August that Ismail had said election would be held this year

    Ismail Sabri is Umno vice-president who broke party and national history by becoming prime minister instead of those above him in the hierarchy

    In 2018, then prime minister Najib Razak went almost the full five-year term, only announcing Parliament‚Äôs dissolution on April 6, weeks before his mandate expired

    Pakatan Harapan (PH) ended up with 121 seats in the 222-seat Parliament with Dr Mahathir becoming prime minister for the second time

    ‚ÄúIt depends on the Election Commission but I think a general election this time will be held on a weekend, not a weekday like the last time or people will get angry again,‚Äù an Umno source told The Malaysian Insight

    Better to end this charade now and get a government with a clear mandate,‚Äù he added

    That coalition government fell apart when Bersatu president and prime minister Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin lost majority support in Parliament

  • ASIA MARKETS MIXED AFTER S&P 500 CLOSES AT NEW LOW FOR THE YEAR; CHINA FACTORY ACTIVITY EXPANDS

    https://www.cnbc.com/2022/09/30/asia-markets-wall-street-china-pmi-stocks-currencies.html

    09/30/2022, 09:56

    66.67% Shortened!

    China's official factory activity data unexpectedly expanded in August, beating estimates

    The index dropped 2.1% to end the session at 3,640.47

    China's official¬†manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    Economists expect a figure of 49.6, slightly higher than August's 49.4, which would mark the third consecutive month of contraction

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    ‚Äî Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

    Retail sales also jumped 4.1% in August compared with a year ago, beating a Reuters forecast of a 2.8% rise

    The central bank also signaled it may raise interest rates up to as high as 4.6% in 2023 to control inflation

    "We're still not even in restrictive territory on the funds rate, so you're right, we've moved the funds rate up 300 basis points this year, but look how high inflation is," Mester said

    A Division of NBCUniversal Data is a real-time snapshot *Data is delayed at least 15 minutes

    Data also provided by

    ['data', 'index', 'high', 'also', 'inflation']

    Economists expect a figure of 49.6, slightly higher than August's 49.4, which would mark the third consecutive month of contraction

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    "We're still not even in restrictive territory on the funds rate, so you're right, we've moved the funds rate up 300 basis points this year, but look how high inflation is," Mester said

    Economists expect a figure of 49.6, slightly higher than August's 49.4, which would mark the third consecutive month of contraction

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    A private survey of Chinese factory activity is also due on Friday, and analysts polled by Reuters predict that the print will come in at 49.5

    China's factory activity data is due later today

    China's official¬†manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index for September is expected to come in below the 50-point mark separating growth from contraction, according to a Reuters poll of analysts

    Economists expect a figure of 49.6, slightly higher than August's 49.4, which would mark the third consecutive month of contraction

    PMI readings are sequential and represent month-on-month expansion or contraction

    A private survey of Chinese factory activity is also due on Friday, and analysts polled by Reuters predict that the print will come in at 49.5

    ‚Äî Abigail Ng Industrial production in Japan grew 2.7% in August from July, according to official data, marking the third consecutive month of growth

    ‚Äî Abigail Ng The U.S Federal Reserve announced yet another 75 basis point hike earlier this month, sending the federal funds rate up to a range of 3% to 3.25%

    The central bank also signaled it may raise interest rates up to as high as 4.6% in 2023 to control inflation

    "We're still not even in restrictive territory on the funds rate, so you're right, we've moved the funds rate up 300 basis points this year, but look how high inflation is," Mester said

    A Division of NBCUniversal Data is a real-time snapshot *Data is delayed at least 15 minutes

    Data also provided by

    ['data', 'also', 'inflation', 'high', 'month']



  • NAJIB'S ACCOUNT 'SENSITIVE'

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/30/najibs-account-sensitive

    09/30/2022, 09:04

    42.11% Shortened!

    ‚ÄúThe transaction amount was large

    If the market actually knew in terms of this amount, definitely the market would have taken a position

    And it would affect the ringgit value,‚Äù said AmBank Private Banking capital market desk head, Yap Wai Keat, 57

    He said the account was also considered a ‚Äúsensitive‚Äù one as the then prime minister was a politically exposed person (PEP)

    The prosecution witness said this during cross-examination by Najib‚Äôs lawyer Wan Aizuddin Wan Mohammed in the RM2.28bil 1Malaysia Development Bhd (1MDB) trial here yesterday

    Wan Aizuddin had asked Yap on how he knew the account ending 694, which had been given a code name ‚ÄúAmPrivate Banking ‚Äì MR‚Äù, belonged to Najib

    Yap said he was informed by Najib‚Äôs AmBank relationship manager Joanna Yu that the Pekan MP was the beneficiary

    The witness was asked again by the lawyer on what made the account ‚Äúsensitive‚Äù, and he replied that it was due to Najib being the prime minister at that time

    Yap said yesterday these were other reasons the account needed to be handled carefully

    ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why I think Joanna (Yu) created the code name for Datuk Seri‚Äôs account.‚Äù Najib, 69, is facing four charges of using his position to obtain bribes totalling RM2.28bil from 1MDB funds and 21 charges of money laundering involving the same amount.

    We would love to keep you posted on the latest promotion

  • THE DERBY HAS BEEN FAR TOO EASY FOR MANCHESTER CITY RECENTLY... BUT THIS ONE WON'T BE

    09/30/2022, 09:03

    80.0% Shortened!

    United had it when they began to dominate English football in the 1990s, the knowledge that they effectively just had to turn up and play properly to beat City

    City were brilliant, United‚Äôs prime task was keeping the score down

    With United having run eight miles fewer than Brentford, Ten Hag decided that the squad would make up the distance the following day

    Crucially, Ten Hag said he would do the run also

    Ten Hag is not the first manager to do this

    Such actions go a long way

  • SQUASHING LITTERBUGS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/metro/metro-news/2022/09/30/squashing-litterbugs

    09/30/2022, 08:34

    69.44% Shortened!

    COMMUTERS at the North Klang bus station in Selangor who are caught littering are immediately being made to do community service if they are unable to pay the RM10 fine

    Klang Municipal Council‚Äôs (MPK) Environmental Services Department director Zaireezal Ahmad Zainuddin said the council wants a litter-free town

    Statistics show that from January until Sept 18 this year, 93 litter louts were issued with fines while 53 others were made to pick up litter at the bus station area

    Zaireezal says the council wants to achieve a litter-free town

    He highlighted that rubbish bins were often only a few steps away but people chose to litter anyway

    Mohd Ali urges the council to intensify its anti-litter drive

    MPK enforcement officer in charge of the anti-litter squad, Aswarizal Mohd Wazib, said ‚ÄúOps Kutu Sampah‚Äù had resulted in a bus station and five-foot ways that were much cleaner

    ‚ÄúMost of the rubbish around the bus station accumulates after work hours as those who wait for buses at North Klang bus station will eat fast food and leave the wrappers on the benches or the grass

    A man disposing of rubbish properly in the garbage bin at the Klang North Bus station

    Mohd Ali Jinnah echoed this sentiment and urged the local council to intensify its anti-litter drive

    He suggested a dedicated team be set up to monitor the bus station area and that the initiative be expanded to other public areas

    ['litter', 'klang', 'bus', 'station', 'fine']

  • SWEDE DEAL FOR PENANG

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/09/30/swede-deal-for-penang

    09/30/2022, 08:05

    52.17% Shortened!

    The expansion will also add 15 acres of land size to the facility, which is located within the state‚Äôs Penang Science Park

    ‚ÄúThe expansion project is also expected to create an additional value of RM552mil in local sourcing of raw materials and components.‚Äù In the same statement, Penang Chief Minister Chow Kon Yeow said the project will bring in investment, strengthen the socio-economy, increase job creation and provide opportunities for local talents to upskill

    ‚ÄúThe investment will stimulate local businesses, thus contributing significantly towards the economy of Penang by maintaining and strengthening its local supply chains.‚Äù The investment is also set to create more engineering experts in the industrialised building system (IBS) for Penang

    Meanwhile, Malaysian Investment Development Authority (Mida) chief executive officer Datuk Arham Abdul Rahman said SIBS‚Äô continued expansion demonstrated Malaysia‚Äôs strong economic fundamentals

    He said this included the country‚Äôs vibrant innovation ecosystem, particularly within the IBS industry, as well as Malaysia‚Äôs reliable infrastructure and connectivity to the region and the world

    ‚ÄúThe company‚Äôs presence will also encourage the growth of local companies within the IBS industry,‚Äù he said

    Meanwhile, SIBS Group chief executive officer Erik Thomaeus said SIBS has put Malaysia on the map as the leading hub for the manufacturing-related construction industry

    ‚ÄúUsing technology, the company has revolutionised a very conservative industry

    ‚ÄúThe investment is important for Malaysia not only directly but also indirectly, in the thousands of jobs created in the supply chains around the country.‚Äù He noted that Malaysia is devoted to technology and companies built around ‚Äútechnical innovation.‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is another proof of the genuine attractiveness of Malaysia as a hub for business and innovation

    ‚ÄúOur expansion in Malaysia will be divided in phases and eventually will achieve approximately RM500mil of total investment,‚Äù he said

    Meanwhile, Sweden‚Äôs ambassador to Malaysia Dr Joachim Bergstrom said Sweden is a pioneer in innovation and industry

    ['sib', 'penang', 'company', 'say', 'local']

  • STRONG GREENBACK A WELCOME SIGN FOR SOME MALAYSIANS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/30/strong-greenback-a-welcome-sign-for-some-malaysians

    09/30/2022, 08:05

    54.17% Shortened!

    Educator Felicia Chen, 27, said that with the strong US currency, she would be able to increase the usual amount of money she sends back home by at least 10%

    ‚ÄúWith the same amount of US dollars, I am able to increase my savings and the money I send back home by at least 10% to 12%

    ‚ÄúHowever, I do send some money back on a quarterly basis to pay some bills,‚Äù she said, adding that she usually sent home an average of between US$200 (RM913.50) and US$400 (RM1,827) per month

    May Lee, 56, said the high exchange rate was timely as she had to pay for her mother‚Äôs healthcare expenses

    ‚ÄúMy mother, who is in her 80s, had a bad fall last month and we are planning to put her in a nursing home to get better care

    ‚ÄúMy children aged 21 and 23 are still studying here and I have to pay their fees (in the United States), so I might have to stretch my money

    ‚ÄúWith the high exchange rate, it will make it easier for me to pay for these expenses,‚Äù she added

    ‚ÄúA healthy body breeds a healthy mind, and students need a healthy body, healthy mind and well-being to thrive and study well,‚Äù she said

    On the brighter side, Dr Chooi said students could see the high conversion rate as an opportunity to learn how to be smart consumers

    ‚ÄúNow is the best time to learn how to cook and make simple, nourishing meals at home during the weekends,‚Äù she said.

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    ['high', 'money', 'home', 'say', 'well']

    In the men‚Äôs doubles, Mohd Haikal Nazri-Wan Arif Wan Junaidi also made it to the quarter-finals after overcoming compatriots Lee Yi Bo-Ling Wei Jie 21-12, 21-16

    Home players Vi Thi Anh and Thi Phuong Tran stand in the way of both Jin Wei and Kisona next and a win will set up an all-Malaysian affair

    Meanwhile, Cheam June Wei and Lee Shun Yang kept the flag flying in the men‚Äôs singles after both reached the quarter-finals

    June Wei defeated India‚Äôs Kiran Kumar 21-15, 21-10 in the third round while Shun Yang dashed the hopes of home player Le Manh Tran after claiming a 21-12, 21-15 victory

    June Wei will meet Taiwan‚Äôs Lee Chia-hao next while Shun Yang faces a tough challenge against China‚Äôs Sun Feixiang

  • PUTIN TO DECLARE ANNEXATION OF UKRAINIAN LANDS IN MAJOR ESCALATION OF WAR

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/world/2022/09/30/putin-to-declare-annexation-of-ukrainian-lands-in-major-escalation-of-war/30867

    09/30/2022, 08:03

    42.11% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise LONDON, Sept 30 ‚Äï At a ceremony denounced by Ukraine as a ‚ÄúKremlin freak show‚Äù, Russian President Vladimir Putin will proclaim the annexation of four Ukrainian regions today, escalating his seven-month war and taking it into an unpredictable new phase

    Putin will preside over a treaty-signing on ‚Äúthe entry of new territories into the Russian Federation‚Äù, three days after the completion of hastily staged referendums in which Moscow's proxies in the occupied regions claimed majorities of up to 99 per cent in favour of joining Russia

    But despite the triumphal setting, the annexation of the Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia and Kherson regions comes at a perilous moment for Putin

    After months of grinding, attritional warfare, Ukraine seized the initiative this month by routing Russian forces in the northeastern Kharkiv region

    Even staunch Kremlin allies have criticised the chaotic nature of the call-up, and Putin himself said on Thursday that ‚Äúall mistakes must be corrected‚Äù

    Nuclear threat While it holds the vast majority of Luhansk and Kherson regions, Russia controls only about 60 per cent of Donetsk and 70 per cent of Zaporizhzhia, where fighting has raged close to Europe's biggest nuclear plant

    The hurried annexations mean front lines will now run through territory that Russia is declaring as its own, and which Putin has said he is ready to defend with nuclear weapons if necessary

    Some Western politicians called that a bluff ‚Äï something Putin explicitly denied

    The United States says it has warned Russia of catastrophic consequences if it did use a nuclear weapon

    Ukrainian presidential adviser Mykhailo Podolyak said yesterday that the Kremlin event was a ‚Äúfreak show‚Äù, and legally meaningless

    We are Russia.‚Äù The Kremlin has not yet said whether Putin will attend a celebratory concert on the square on Friday evening

    ['ukraine', 'kremlin', 'russian', 'putin', 'region']

    Putin will preside over a treaty-signing on ‚Äúthe entry of new territories into the Russian Federation‚Äù, three days after the completion of hastily staged referendums in which Moscow's proxies in the occupied regions claimed majorities of up to 99 per cent in favour of joining Russia

  • ‚ÄòIT LOOKS LIKE DARWIN NUNEZ SHRINKED‚Äô: KLOPP WON‚ÄôT HIDE HIS DISAPPOINTMENT AT LIVERPOOL PLAYER‚ÄôS NEW HAIRCUT

    https://www.rousingthekop.com/2022/09/29/it-looks-like-darwin-nunez-shrinked-klopp-wont-hide-his-disappointment-at-liverpool-players-new-haircut/

    09/30/2022

    52.17% Shortened!

    Kostas Tsimikas has a new haircut and it was the talk of Liverpool‚Äôs training session on Thursday

    The five minutes of footage is mostly about one thing, though ‚Äì the new haircut of Kostas Tsimikas

    ‚ÄúA good day and now this,‚Äù says Klopp on seeing Tsimikas

    No one seems to dislike it more than Klopp does

    ‚ÄúHave a look at Kostas Tsimikas,‚Äù Klopp then warns the cameraman as he makes his way to the pitches

    ‚ÄúIt looks like Darwin Nunez shrinked.‚Äù Not long later, Virgil van Dijk is telling Tsimikas ‚ÄúKosti, he can‚Äôt say that to you, brother.‚Äù Presumably he means Klopp but by this point everyone is talking about it

    ‚ÄúDoes it look like Darwin?‚Äù asks Tsimikas

    ‚ÄúDoes he look like Darwin?‚Äù Salah asks the camera

  • POUND MAY NEED TO FALL TO PLUG THE HOLE OF UK'S INTERNATIONAL DEBT

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/09/30/pound-may-need-to-fall-to-plug-the-hole-of-uks-international-debt

    09/30/2022, 07:03

    52.17% Shortened!

    The currency will have to probe to find a level where foreign investors believe the long-term return on UK assets is attractive

    Five-year gilt yields are at around 4.6%, from only 3% earlier this month

    Around 25% of the gilt market is held by overseas investors, so government borrowing costs are very sensitive to capital that could easily find an alternative home (and some surely has already)

    When government borrowing costs rise, borrowing costs for the private sector rises ‚Äìfor companies through debt and loans, and for households principally through rising mortgage costs

    The government, or any company issuing debt now, will be locked in at a higher rate

    Ditto for any mortgage holder re-fixing

    As gilt yields rise, private-sector borrowing costs will also rise, damaging firms‚Äô balance sheets and deterring investment

    On the top of that, mortgage holders will see their costs rise too

    Sterling is the release valve

    The currency will have to probe to find a level where foreign investors believe the long-term return on UK assets is attractive enough

    Similarly, there will be a level of a sterling where UK holders of foreign assets find it attractive to repatriate the capital

    ['find', 'investor', 'borrowing', 'cost', 'sterling']

    The currency will have to probe to find a level where foreign investors believe the long-term return on UK assets is attractive

    Five-year gilt yields are at around 4.6%, from only 3% earlier this month

    Around 25% of the gilt market is held by overseas investors, so government borrowing costs are very sensitive to capital that could easily find an alternative home (and some surely has already)

    When government borrowing costs rise, borrowing costs for the private sector rises ‚Äìfor companies through debt and loans, and for households principally through rising mortgage costs

    The government, or any company issuing debt now, will be locked in at a higher rate

    Ditto for any mortgage holder re-fixing

    As gilt yields rise, private-sector borrowing costs will also rise, damaging firms‚Äô balance sheets and deterring investment

    On the top of that, mortgage holders will see their costs rise too

    Sterling is the release valve

    The currency will have to probe to find a level where foreign investors believe the long-term return on UK assets is attractive enough

    Similarly, there will be a level of a sterling where UK holders of foreign assets find it attractive to repatriate the capital

    ['find', 'investor', 'borrowing', 'cost', 'sterling']



  • IGP: WOMAN KIDNAPPED IN TUMPAT RESCUED, BROUGHT HOME FROM THAILAND

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/30/igp-woman-kidnapped-in-tumpat-rescued-brought-home-from-thailand/30863

    09/30/2022, 06:35

    42.86% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 30 ‚Äî A cosmetics product agent who was kidnapped at her home in Tumpat, Kelantan on Sept 13 has been safely rescued and brought home yesterday

    Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Acryl Sani Abdullah Sani said in a statement last night that the victim was rescued with the assistance and sharing of information between the Royal Malaysian Police (PDRM) and the Royal Thai Police who managed to detect the presence of the victim in the country

    He said PDRM thanked their Thai counterparts and the Malaysian embassy in the country for their assistance and aid in efforts to rescue the victim

    Acryl Sani said a vehicle believed to be used to kidnap the victim was also seized

    ['kuala', 'sept', 'kidnap', 'home', 'tumpat']

    At 6ft 4in, he also towers over Martinez by seven inches

    Martinez might be the smallest centre back in the Premier League at 5ft 9in, but he makes up for it with his tenacity and reading of the game

    Martinez prefers to be judged on his track record

    When Ajax met Borussia Dortmund in last season's Champions League group stage, Martinez had Haaland in his pocket as the Dutch side ran out 4-0 winners in Amsterdam

    On his international debut for Argentina, Martinez was subbed at half-time against Venezuela in Madrid

    Martinez's strong defending has helped Ten Hag's side climb to fifth in the Premier League Ten Hag kept faith, dropping Harry Maguire instead of Martinez and playing him alongside Raphael Varane

    It's a tall order, but Lisandro Martinez has always been up to the challenge.

    https://www.espn.co.uk/football/soccer-transfers/story/4751862/manchester-united-and-frenkie-de-jong-saga-to-continuebellingham-also-a-target

    09/30/2022

    84.51% Shortened!

    ESPN's Football Forecast team explain why Liverpool is a serious option for Jude Bellingham's next club

    in Real Madrid white? | Lukaku, Potter set for Chelsea talks | Ronaldo no longer a poster boy | English football's big decision amid fixture crisis | Man City's Etihad Stadium boost | LaLiga clubs' 'fear clause' quandary Barcelona's Frenkie de Jong remains on Manchester United's transfer wish list, sources told ESPN, while Borussia Dortmund midfielder Jude Bellingham will also be central to United's transfer plans next summer

    Lukaku is under contract at Chelsea until 2026 and so a second loan at Inter would theoretically also be possible but the player's transfer value would further depreciate given he turns 30 in May next year

    The Champions League (UCL), Europa League (UEL) and Europa Conference League (UECL) will all be increased from 32 teams to 36, with clubs in the UCL and the UEL playing two additional matches

    English football is therefore faced with no choice but to revamp its cup competitions, sources told ESPN, or face the last resort of having to cut the Premier League from 20 teams to 18 -- as seen in France

    Like the Premier League, both LaLiga and Serie A will continue with 20 teams for now (the Bundesliga has always operated with 18) but English football is the only top league in Europe with the added pressure of a secondary cup competition

    24 and the final round of the Europa Conference League group stage clashes with the Carabao Cup quarterfinals on Dec

    21) and a full round of Premier League midweek games (Jan

    The only viable solution to prevent further pressure elsewhere in the calendar would appear to be cancelling FA Cup replays from the third round onwards, which opens up two midweeks in January and February which the Carabao Cup semi and the round of Premier League games can be brought forward into

    Playing under-21 teams, as Liverpool did in 2019 when their Club World Cup commitments clashed with the Carabao Cup, would appear to be the most viable solution but that would only devalue the competition further

    Manchester City are hoping to increase the capacity of the Etihad Stadium to 60,000 to allow them to host Champions League finals, sources told ESPN

    ['espn', 'team', 'club', 'united', 'source']

    Almost 12 months on, Martinez and Haaland will face off against each other again on Sunday when Ten Hag's United travel to the Etihad in the first Manchester derby of the season

    Haaland head-to-head will arguably be the most decisive

    Yet Haaland is proving to be almost unstoppable in a City shirt

    On paper, Haaland vs

    Martinez should be a mismatch

    "Maybe he could go left-back, maybe he could play in a back three, but in a back four, he cannot play there in the Premier League

    He just needs to keep going." Against Dortmund, Martinez and Timber shared the defensive duties while marking Haaland

    But while Sunday will clearly be a test of the Martinez-Varane axis, it will also be a challenge for Haaland, who has yet to face one of the Premier League's so-called Big Six in a competitive fixture this season

    How Haaland fares against United will be an interesting pointer for the months ahead

    Haaland is unquestionably a goal-scoring phenomenon and stopping him will be United's primary objective this weekend

    In Martinez, though, they at least have a defender who knows how to do just that.

    86.9% Shortened!

    Both worry that the yen‚Äôs plunge toward 150 to the dollar will shake Japan‚Äôs yield curve in globe-rattling ways

    That would force China into the depreciatory fray

    Former Goldman Sachs uber-economist Jim O‚ÄôNeill worries about a 1997-98 redux thanks to the yen‚Äôs 26% decline this year

    In September 1997, I also was in Beijing when Rubin and Summers cajoled Chinese officials not to devalue the yuan

    It was China devaluing the yuan that scared them the most

    The worry was that a weaker yuan might trigger a fresh wave of competitive devaluations not just in developing Asia, but Japan, too

    That is once again a live concern as the yuan blows past 7 to the dollar at a moment when China‚Äôs economy is growing at the slowest pace in 30 years

    This week, the People‚Äôs Bank of China stepped up its defense of the yuan, cautioning against one-way bets on the currency

    Thanks to the yuan‚Äôs downward trajectory, PBOC policy options are increasingly a mystery

    ‚ÄúThe PBOC has to control the pace of M2 growth,‚Äù Sun says

  • LIVERPOOL'S FORGOTTEN SUMMER SIGNING MAKES LONG-AWAITED RETURN TO TRAINING

    https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/liverpool-jurgen-klopp-injury-brighton-28118267

    09/30/2022, 05:35

    56.0% Shortened!

    Jurgen Klopp has seen his side battered by injuries in the opening weeks of the Premier League season but he is finally receiving some good news ahead of a hectic six weeks One of Liverpool 's summer signings has finally began training with his new team-mates having suffered an injury before his arrival at Anfield

    Calvin Ramsay joined the Reds from Scottish Premiership side Aberdeen in the summer window

    It was expected that he would fill the role of being Trent Alexander-Arnold 's back-up and challenger for the right-back spot in Jurgen Klopp 's side

    But Klopp disclosed soon after his arrival on Merseyside that Liverpool's staff had discovered that Ramsay was carrying an injury during his medical

    Having missed all of pre-season, the young Scotsman is now finally training with his new club

    Ramsay confirmed the news on social media, releasing a photo of himself in training

    ‚ÄúCalvin is another exciting young player, so we‚Äôre very pleased

    But with Liverpool facing a hectic run of 13 games in six weeks, Klopp will hope it will be sooner rather than later, though the German has insisted Ramsay will not be rushed back

    ‚ÄúWhen you are that young then of course he has a long career ahead of him, so we are very responsible in these moments, so he didn‚Äôt train yet with the team but is doing a lot of fitness work," he said in the summer

    "It will not take too long I think

    So we really expect a lot from him in the long term." Read more What do Liverpool need to clinch the title? Keep up with all the Reds news with our FREE daily newsletter

    Brazil World Cup winner and former Arsenal midfielder Gilberto Silva was also at the premiere Silva played every minute at the World Cup in Japan and South Korea, and went on to star in Arsenal's 'Invincibles' team in the 2003-04 season

    Martinelli made his debut for Brazil earlier this year, and will be hoping to make Tite's squad for the World Cup in Qatar in November

    Brazil have not triumphed at the World Cup since Carlos and co

    By posting your comment you agree to our house rules

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual

    Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline? Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual We will automatically post your comment and a link to the news story to your Facebook timeline at the same time it is posted on MailOnline

    To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account

    We‚Äôll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook

    You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook

    ['mailonline', 'comment', 'jorginho', 'brazil', 'world']



  • GAMUDA BHD, AEON CREDIT, HENG HUAT, UEM EDGENTA, GADANG HOLDINGS, KNM GROUP, APEX EQUITY HOLDINGS BHD, POH HUAT, OPENSYS, HIAP TECK VENTURE, MISC, BARAKAH OFFSHORE, BERJAYA CORP AND SCIENTEX

    https://www.theedgemarkets.com/article/gamuda-bhd-aeon-credit-heng-huat-uem-edgenta-gadang-holdings-knm-group-apex-equity-holdings

    09/30/2022, 01:03

    72.5% Shortened!

    Gamuda Bhd‚Äôs net profit increased 19.89% to RM255.24 million for the fourth quarter ended July 31, 2022 (4QFY22), from RM212.88 million a year earlier, on the back of improved earnings in the construction and property divisions

    Earnings per share rose to 9.99 sen from 8.47 sen, according to the group‚Äôs filing with Bursa Malaysia

    The lender's net profit came in at RM75.65 million in 2QFY23 compared with RM75.48 million a year ago

    UEM Edgenta Bhd is investing RM13.5 million for a 60% equity interest in a facilities management services business in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

    KNM Group Bhd has bagged an engineering, procurement, construction and commissioning contract worth RM25.69 million from Petronas Gas Bhd (PetGas)

    In a bourse filing, KNM said the contract awarded to its wholly owned subsidiary KNM Process Systems Sdn Bhd is for two years

    Poh Huat Resources Holdings Bhd‚Äôs net profit for the third quarter ended July 31, 2022 (3QFY22) jumped 64.2% to RM22.04 million from RM13.43 million in the same period a year earlier, boosted by strong turnover growth in its domestic operations

    Hiap Teck Venture Bhd recorded a net profit of RM24.48 million for the fourth quarter ended July 31, 2022 (4QFY22), a 59.53% drop from RM60.48 million in the same quarter last year amid lower profit margins for its downstream operating subsidiaries as a result of the higher cost of goods sold and the write-down of inventories to net realisable value

    Barakah Offshore Petroleum Bhd and its subsidiary have withdrawn their appeal against the High Court decision dismissing their RM1.02 billion claim against Petronas Nasional Bhd (Petronas)

    Chailease Berjaya Credit Sdn Bhd (CBC), a joint venture between Taiwan-based Chailease Holding Co Ltd and Berjaya Corp Bhd, is planning a RM1 billion bond sale as it expands its financing operations for new motorcycles, said Malaysian Rating Corp Bhd (MARC)

    Scientex Bhd's net profit slipped 12.4% to RM124.98 million in the fourth quarter ended July 31, 2022, from RM142.65 million a year earlier, hit by higher tax and interest expenses amid margin compression in its property segment

    ['bhd', 'group', 'profit', 'million', 'quarter']

  • IF YOU HAVE THIS MUCH MONEY SAVED YOU DON'T NEED AN ANNUITY

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/much-money-saved-dont-annuity-213145358.html

    66.67% Shortened!

    One of the most common ways to create this income is to buy yourself an annuity

    Essentially, an annuity is an insurance contract

    There will generally be a minimum payment that guarantees you don't lose your principal, but it's possible that the money won't grow at all, which is not a concern with a fixed annuity

    All of this is determined when you buy your annuity contact

    That percentage only ticks up to 95.9% if you use an annuity, not enough of a difference to justify using an annuity

    Social Security Bridge ‚Äì Another Option Morningstar also details an alternative plan for making sure you have enough money in retirement without having to buy an annuity, a strategy known as the Social Security Bridge

    When you turn 70, you file for Social Security

    Once you start taking these payments, you can reduce the amount of money you take out of your retirement accounts each year

    Morningstar analysis, though, shows that if you have at least 36 times your needed annual income saved at the time of retirement, you likely don't need to get an annuity

    Retirement Planning Tips The best way to go about planning your retirement is often to get professional help

    Saving in a 401(k) is how most people accumulate money for retirement

    ['income', 'retirement', 'work', 'annuity', 'save']

    One of the most common ways to create this income is to buy yourself an annuity

    Essentially, an annuity is an insurance contract

    There will generally be a minimum payment that guarantees you don't lose your principal, but it's possible that the money won't grow at all, which is not a concern with a fixed annuity

    All of this is determined when you buy your annuity contact

    That percentage only ticks up to 95.9% if you use an annuity, not enough of a difference to justify using an annuity

    Social Security Bridge ‚Äì Another Option Morningstar also details an alternative plan for making sure you have enough money in retirement without having to buy an annuity, a strategy known as the Social Security Bridge

    When you turn 70, you file for Social Security

    Once you start taking these payments, you can reduce the amount of money you take out of your retirement accounts each year

    Morningstar analysis, though, shows that if you have at least 36 times your needed annual income saved at the time of retirement, you likely don't need to get an annuity

    Saving in a 401(k) is how most people accumulate money for retirement

    Here‚Äôs a look at what Kiyosaki prefers instead

    Precious metals ‚Äî particularly gold and silver ‚Äî have been a popular hedge against inflation and uncertainties

    The price of gold is actually down about 9% in 2022, while silver has fallen by nearly 20%

    I think $15,000 is not out of the question for gold,‚Äù Kiyosaki says

    While there are many ways to gain exposure to gold and silver, he prefers to just buy the metal directly

    Earlier this year, he tweeted that he only wants ‚Äúreal gold or silver coins‚Äù and not the ETFs

    ‚ÄúI buy gold and silver for one reason, because if push comes to shove, I can spend it anywhere in the world,‚Äù he tells Kitco

    Some say that bitcoin is the new gold

    While Kiyosaki is a self-proclaimed gold bug, he also likes the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency

    ‚ÄúYou can always eat the thing,‚Äù Kiyosaki says

  • 'PROBABLY THE LAST RALLY': JIM ROGERS JUST WARNED ABOUT GETTING TOO EXCITED OVER THE MARKET'S RECENT BUMP ‚Äî HERE ARE THE SHOCKPROOF ASSETS HE LIKES BEST RIGHT NOW

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/probably-last-rally-jim-rogers-140000690.html

    65.62% Shortened!

    According to legendary investor Jim Rogers, there is hope on the horizon ‚Äî but perhaps not for long

    ‚ÄúNow it looks like inflation and pessimism is breaking, but just remember, this is probably the last rally.‚Äù The 79-year-old investor knows a thing or two about making money in turbulent times

    It has all happened before.‚Äù The lesson here, as Rogers explains, is that ‚Äúusually towards the end, stocks go crazy.‚Äù One of the surest signs of inflation is the rally in commodity prices we saw earlier this year

    Rogers knows the importance of commodities

    He created the Rogers International Commodity Index in 1998

    The fund that tracks the index ‚Äî Elements Rogers International Commodity Index-Total Return ETN (RJI) ‚Äî is up 12% year to date

    Of course, gold has the same function, but Rogers actually favors the grey metal for now

    ‚ÄúSilver is down something like 70 or 80% from its all-time high and gold is 15% below its all-time high,‚Äù he says

    ‚ÄúI will buy both at the right price but at the moment, I would prefer silver to gold

    The host also asked Rogers what he would short for the next three years

    ‚ÄúThe one thing I would sell would be the American stock market, the FAANGs, the technology stocks in America,‚Äù he says

    ['stock', 'market', 'thing', 'rogers', 'year']

    It‚Äôs already confirmed that the Atto 3 and e6 EV models have been confirmed for Malaysia

    The Atto 3 is already on sale in Singapore and Australia, and is due to make its market debut in Thailand next month

    In Australia, the car is available in two Blade LFP battery configurations, the first being a 49.92 kWh unit offering 345 km of range (WLTP, 410 km in NEDC), while the other is a 60.48 kWh unit rated for 420 km (WLTP, 480 km in NEDC)

    Meanwhile, the e6 is a five-seater electric MPV that is already on sale in Singapore and Thailand

    In Singapore, the second-gen offering features a 71.7 kWh Blade LFP battery that powers a front-mounted electric motor, which offers 95 PS (94 hp or 70 kW) and 180 Nm in the way of output

    That‚Äôs for the Thailand spec version

    With a 40 kW AC onboard charger, as found on the Singapore car, a full AC charge takes 1.8 hours

    So,they hook up the BYD distributorship.Being a GLC,they need to show profits.

  • UITM TERMINATES SERVICES OF LECTURER ACCUSED OF SEXUAL HARRASMENT

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/29/uitm-terminates-services-of-lecturer-accused-of-sexual-harrasment/30834

    09/29/2022, 23:35

    42.86% Shortened!

    In a statement today, UiTM said it took seriously the allegations of sexual harassment against the lecturer and had conducted an investigation following the guidelines and legal process contained in the Statutory Bodies (Discipline and Surcharge) Act 2000 [Act 605]

    It said under the act, disciplinary action can be taken against staff members who violate rules, codes of conduct and prohibitions contained in Act 605 and UiTM regulations

    ‚ÄúAfter the interrogation and internal investigation procedures were completed and discussed by the Disciplinary Committee, UiTM has taken action to immediately terminate the service of the lecturer who was accused of sexually harassing the former student,‚Äù read the statement

    Meanwhile, in the same statement UiTM vice-chancellor, Prof Datuk Roziah Mohd Janor said the university‚Äôs staff members are regularly reminded about Act 605

    ['uitm', 'lecturer', 'statement', 'say', 'take']

  • LATE SULU SULTAN‚ÄôS HEIRS PRESS US$15B CLAIM, TARGET MALAYSIAN ASSETS IN NETHERLANDS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/29/late-sulu-sultans-heirs-press-us15b-claim-target-malaysian-assets-in-netherlands/30826

    09/29/2022, 23:05

    42.11% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 29 ‚Äî Heirs of a late South-east Asian sultan today asked a Dutch court for permission to seize Malaysian assets in the Netherlands, their lawyer said, seeking enforcement of a US$15 billion (RM70 billion) arbitration award granted to them against Malaysia‚Äôs government

    Malaysia‚Äôs government, which has said it does not recognise the heirs‚Äô claim, did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the Dutch petition

    A French arbitration court in February ordered Malaysia to pay the US$15 billion sum ‚Äî the second largest arbitration award on record ‚Äî to the descendents of the last Sultan of Sulu

    Malaysia obtained a stay on the ruling pending an appeal, but the award remains enforceable outside France under a United Nations treaty on international arbitration

    The heirs of the sultan, who once controlled a territory spanning rainforest-covered islands in the southern Philippines and parts of Borneo island, asked the Dutch court to recognise and enforce the arbitration award

    The heirs wish to take ‚Äúrecourse against assets of Malaysia, which are located in the Netherlands‚Äù, according to a copy of the court petition shared by their lawyer

    Reuters was unable to immediately verify the filing with Dutch court authorities

    The petition did not specify which assets

    The companies had no immediate comment on the Dutch petition when contacted by Reuters

    The heirs went to an arbitration court over the suspension of payments

    Malaysia did not participate in nor recognise the arbitration

    ['heir', 'sultan', 'dutch', 'court', 'asset']

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 29 ‚Äî Heirs of a late South-east Asian sultan today asked a Dutch court for permission to seize Malaysian assets in the Netherlands, their lawyer said, seeking enforcement of a US$15 billion (RM70 billion) arbitration award granted to them against Malaysia‚Äôs government

    Malaysia‚Äôs government, which has said it does not recognise the heirs‚Äô claim, did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the Dutch petition

    Malaysia obtained a stay on the ruling pending an appeal, but the award remains enforceable outside France under a United Nations treaty on international arbitration

  • EBIT LEW TRIAL: POLICE OFFICER SEIZED HANDPHONE WITHOUT CHECKING CONTENTS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/29/ebit-lew-trial-police-officer-seized-handphone-without-checking-contents

    09/29/2022, 21:34

    45.0% Shortened!

    Thursday, 29 Sep 2022

    ASP Salwani Mohd Hadzir, 40 told the Magistrate's Court here that even though she was informed the case involved Lew, she had no idea it was pertaining to sexual harassment

    "I was only informed by the investigating officer DSP Noor Ashikin Shamsuri that the case involved Ebit Lew," she told counsel Ram Singh during cross-examination at the preacher‚Äôs sexual harassment trial on Thursday (Sept 29)

    However, Salwani said she had typed in Section 509 of the Penal Code on a set of three photographs of the handphone and SIM card that she seized from Mohd Fairuz Abu on Oct 5, 2021 at his house in Alor Setar

    Salwani, the Staff Officer of the Kedah Police Contingent Headquarters Criminal Investigation Department‚Äôs Women and Children Section, agreed with the defence counsel that when she seized the handphone from Mohd Fairuz, she knew it contained relevant matters with regards to a Tenom case

    Salwani testified further that said she had read news articles on the accused via social media before she went to Mohd Fairuz's house to seize his handphone

    During re-examination, the police officer said she did not inspect the contents of the seized phone as each case material is required to be sent to the Royal Malaysian Police Forensics Department for analysis

    On labeling the set of photographs of the seized handphone and SIM card with Section 509 of the Penal Code, Salwani said she typed it out when delivering the seized items to the investigating officer at Bukit Aman

    When asked by Deputy Public Prosecutor Nor Azizah Mohamad why Section 509 was typed out, the witness said it was because the investigation being carried out involved that section

    He told the court that the complainant in the case was among several sexual harassment victims to whom his NGO had extended assistance

    The charge under Section 509 of the Penal Code provides for a prison sentence of up to five years or a fine, or both, upon conviction

    ['ebit', 'lew', 'officer', 'seize', 'handphone']
