  • ASIA TECH 'GODFATHERS' TO DECIDE US CHIPS FATE

    https://asiatimes.com/2022/09/asia-tech-godfathers-to-decide-us-chips-fate/

    09/29/2022

    73.81% Shortened!

    Washington‚Äôs efforts also include the¬†Chip 4 alliance¬†‚Äî an arrangement through which the US government aims to diversify supply chains among Japan, South Korea and Taiwan

    The Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) is preparing to mass produce¬†3-nm chips, while South Korea‚Äôs Samsung has just begun¬†3-nm production

    But friendshoring and the US Chip 4 policy are ultimately about the people, or ‚Äúfriends‚Äù, behind these technological innovations

    Japan, South Korea, and Taiwan have chipmaking ‚Äúgodfathers‚Äù ‚Äî people acclaimed for their crucial roles in developing semiconductor capacity

    Yukio Sakamoto, dubbed the ‚Äúgodfather of Japan‚Äôs DRAM‚Äù, was the president of the former semiconductor company and foundry, Elpida Memory

    Kim Choong-Ki is often called the ‚Äúgodfather of South Korea‚Äôs Chip Industry.‚Äù Kim trained upcoming semiconductor engineers ‚Äî called ‚ÄúKim‚Äôs mafia‚Äù‚Äî who went on to lead semiconductor production at Samsung, LG and Hyundai

    Kim earned his PhD at Columbia University, after which he joined the then semiconductor industry giant, Fairchild, where he worked on R&D in Palo Alto

    Morris Chang founded Taiwan‚Äôs semiconductor powerhouse, TSMC, in 1987 and led the firm‚Äôs growth for decades

    Liang Meng-song, another semiconductor doyen, was in the spotlight of a court case between TSMC and Samsung

    While Washington‚Äôs friendshoring policy aims to deepen supply chains with key producers in Japan, South Korea and Taiwan, policymakers must remember that the people who comprise the leadership of those firms can move

    In¬†Granovetter‚Äôs terms, Washington‚Äôs ‚Äúweak ties‚Äù might prove more beneficial than its strong ties to South Korea, Japan and Taiwan in advancing its semiconductor capabilities

    ['asia', 'semiconductor', 'friendshoring', 'chip', 'firm']

    The 37-year-old man is suspected to have consumed controlled drugs when he allegedly made the threat on board a flight from San Francisco

    He cited the case of a 25-year-old man who caused the deaths of his mother and grandmother while under the influence of hallucinogenic drug lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) in 2019

    Their lives matter, too," Shanmugam said

    While other countries have decriminalised drug use in recent years, this has come with consequences

    A three-year-old girl who ate a cookie containing the drug had to be rushed to the hospital, Shanmugam said

    A Bill to coordinate the regulation of cannabis use was withdrawn from Thailand's House of Representatives, the minister noted, because of criticism that it did not criminalise recreational use

    Singapore's drug policies are based on "science, evidence and common sense", Shanmugam said

    Drugs such as cannabis can be approved for medical use here under certain conditions if prescribed by a doctor, Shanmugam said, though this cannot become an excuse to allow for more widespread use

    The authorities regularly review programmes to determine what works best for drug abusers

    Drug abusers deserve sympathy and compassion, added Shanmugam

    "They are in that situation

  • MAN FINED S$17500 FOR FLYING INTO SINGAPORE WITH 200KG OF MEAT IN LUGGAGE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/aseanplus/aseanplus-news/2022/09/29/man-fined-s17500-for-flying-into-singapore-with-200kg-of-meat-in-luggage

    09/29/2022

    45.0% Shortened!

    Thursday, 29 Sep 2022

    SFA officers were on June 8 alerted by ICA to luggage that was found to contain assorted meat products at Changi Airport

    Chinese national Wang Liansheng, 68, was fined $17,500 on Thursday for illegally importing assorted meat products into Singapore, said the Singapore Food Agency (SFA) and Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA)

    On June 8, SFA officers were alerted by ICA to luggage that was found to contain assorted meat products at Changi Airport

    The eight pieces of luggage, which belonged to Wang, contained 226kg of frozen meat products such as chicken, beef, pork, mutton and rabbit meat from China

    In another case, Singaporean Tan Kay Huat, 74, was fined $2,000 on Thursday for illegally importing fresh vegetables for sale

    SFA said its officers had on March 22 inspected a Malaysian lorry carrying food produce consigned to Tan and Chng Vegetable Seeds and Enterprise at Pasir Panjang Wholesale Centre

    SFA said food imports must meet its requirements, fruits and vegetables can be imported only by licensed importers, and every consignment must be declared and accompanied by a valid import permit

    "The long-term ingestion of excessive pesticide residues through the consumption of vegetables that have been subjected to pesticide abuse could lead to adverse health effects." SFA added that meat products can be imported only from accredited sources in approved countries that comply with Singapore's food safety standards and requirements

    Offenders who import meat products illegally from unapproved sources can be fined $50,000, jailed for up to two years, or both

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    ['sfa', 'meat', 'product', 'singapore', 'food']

    Chinese national Wang Liansheng, 68, was fined $17,500 on Thursday for illegally importing assorted meat products into Singapore, said the Singapore Food Agency (SFA) and Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA)

    On June 8, SFA officers were alerted by ICA to luggage that was found to contain assorted meat products at Changi Airport

    The eight pieces of luggage, which belonged to Wang, contained 226kg of frozen meat products such as chicken, beef, pork, mutton and rabbit meat from China

    SFA said its officers had on March 22 inspected a Malaysian lorry carrying food produce consigned to Tan and Chng Vegetable Seeds and Enterprise at Pasir Panjang Wholesale Centre

    SFA said food imports must meet its requirements, fruits and vegetables can be imported only by licensed importers, and every consignment must be declared and accompanied by a valid import permit

    "The long-term ingestion of excessive pesticide residues through the consumption of vegetables that have been subjected to pesticide abuse could lead to adverse health effects." SFA added that meat products can be imported only from accredited sources in approved countries that comply with Singapore's food safety standards and requirements

    Offenders who import meat products illegally from unapproved sources can be fined $50,000, jailed for up to two years, or both

    Given a number of production ramps this quarter and heavy reliance on September volume, there could be greater variance than usual in the Q3 delivery numbers

  • BIOGEN, EISAI STOCKS SOAR ON LANDMARK ALZHEIMER'S DATA, LIFTING RIVALS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/biogen-eisai-stocks-soar-alzheimers-091354499.html

    44.44% Shortened!

    LONDON (Reuters) - Shares in Biogen and Eisai soared on Wednesday reflecting the surprise trial success of their experimental Alzheimer's drug, which also lifted the stocks of rival drugmakers Roche and Eli Lilly

    Against the odds, Biogen and Eisai on Tuesday said their experimental drug, lecanemab, slowed progress of the brain-wasting disease by 27% compared with a placebo, in a large trial of patients in the early stages of Alzheimer's

    Biogen's stock surged 50% in early premarket trading

    Shares of Roche, which is expected to report results on a rival Alzheimer's drug gantenerumab later this year, jumped as much as 6% to a two-month high in early trading

    drugmaker's stock was up 7.8% before the bell on Wednesday

    ['share', 'biogen', 'eisai', 'trial', 'alzheimer']

    LONDON (Reuters) - Shares in Biogen and Eisai soared on Wednesday reflecting the surprise trial success of their experimental Alzheimer's drug, which also lifted the stocks of rival drugmakers Roche and Eli Lilly

    Against the odds, Biogen and Eisai on Tuesday said their experimental drug, lecanemab, slowed progress of the brain-wasting disease by 27% compared with a placebo, in a large trial of patients in the early stages of Alzheimer's

    Biogen's stock surged 50% in early premarket trading

    Shares of Roche, which is expected to report results on a rival Alzheimer's drug gantenerumab later this year, jumped as much as 6% to a two-month high in early trading

    drugmaker's stock was up 7.8% before the bell on Wednesday

    ['share', 'biogen', 'eisai', 'trial', 'alzheimer']



  • APPLE DITCHES IPHONE PRODUCTION INCREASE AFTER DEMAND FALTERS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/apple-ditches-iphone-production-increase-011918295.html

    45.0% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc

    is backing off plans to increase production of its new iPhones this year after an anticipated surge in demand failed to materialize, according to people familiar with the matter

    Instead, the company will aim to produce 90 million handsets for the period, roughly the same level as the prior year and in line with Apple‚Äôs original forecast this summer, the people said

    Demand for higher-priced iPhone 14 Pro models is stronger than for the entry-level versions, according to some of the people

    Apple shares fell as much as 3.3% in pre-market trading on Wednesday

    fell 2.2% and Apple‚Äôs biggest iPhone assembler Hon Hai Precision Industry Co

    Apple Suppliers Drop as Firm Said to Ditch IPhone Output Boost Apple had upgraded its sales projections in the weeks leading up to the iPhone 14 release and some of its suppliers had started making preparations for a 7% boost in orders

    An Apple spokesperson declined to comment

    China, the world‚Äôs biggest smartphone market, is in an economic slump that‚Äôs hit its domestic mobile device makers and also affected the iPhone‚Äôs sales

    The smartphone market is expected to shrink by 6.5% this year to 1.27 billion units, according to data from market tracker IDC

    ‚ÄúThe supply constraints pulling down on the market since last year have eased and the industry has shifted to a demand-constrained market,‚Äù said Nabila Popal, research director at IDC

    ['apple', 'year', 'demand', 'iphone', 'supplier']

    (Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc

    is backing off plans to increase production of its new iPhones this year after an anticipated surge in demand failed to materialize, according to people familiar with the matter

    Instead, the company will aim to produce 90 million handsets for the period, roughly the same level as the prior year and in line with Apple‚Äôs original forecast this summer, the people said

    Demand for higher-priced iPhone 14 Pro models is stronger than for the entry-level versions, according to some of the people

    Apple shares fell as much as 3.3% in pre-market trading on Wednesday

    fell 2.2% and Apple‚Äôs biggest iPhone assembler Hon Hai Precision Industry Co

    Apple Suppliers Drop as Firm Said to Ditch IPhone Output Boost Apple had upgraded its sales projections in the weeks leading up to the iPhone 14 release and some of its suppliers had started making preparations for a 7% boost in orders

    An Apple spokesperson declined to comment

    China, the world‚Äôs biggest smartphone market, is in an economic slump that‚Äôs hit its domestic mobile device makers and also affected the iPhone‚Äôs sales

    The smartphone market is expected to shrink by 6.5% this year to 1.27 billion units, according to data from market tracker IDC

    ‚ÄúThe supply constraints pulling down on the market since last year have eased and the industry has shifted to a demand-constrained market,‚Äù said Nabila Popal, research director at IDC

    Starting on the left of Portugal‚Äôs forward line, Jota is said to have been his team‚Äôs ‚Äòmost potent attacking threat.‚Äô One ball in particular for Ronaldo is described as being ‚Äòscintillating‚Äô but the United man couldn‚Äôt capitalise

  • HOW MAN UTD COULD LOOK NOW IF OLE GUNNAR SOLSKJAER HADN'T BLOCKED FIVE TRANSFERS

    https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/man-utd-solskjaer-blocked-transfers-28101787

    09/28/2022

    50.0% Shortened!

    Former Manchester United chief Ole Gunnar Solskjaer made some bold decisions in the transfer market before he was sacked last year, and Erik ten Hag is now reaping the rewards Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag oversaw a record transfer spree at Old Trafford this summer, but the Dutchman could have had plenty more work on his hands were it not for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer

    Ten Hag splashed out more than ¬£231million to bring in six new faces following his arrival from Ajax earlier this year - the most Manchester United have ever spent in a single transfer window

    Solskjaer decided against offloading five United stars who were tipped for the exit last summer; Donny van de Beek, Diogo Dalot, Anthony Elanga, Anthony Martial and Edinson Cavani

    And although that quintet failed to make much of an impression last term, the majority are now firmly in Ten Hag's plans

    There are even suggestions that Dalot is in line for a new contract after impressing Ten Hag - who would have been forced to rely on Wan-Bissaka had Solskjaer not blocked the Portuguese defender's exit last year

    Elanga has continued to progress under Ten Hag after his breakthrough year under Rangnick last term and has now established himself as a legitimate member of the first-team squad

    But Solskjaer's decision to hang onto Van De Beek could still benefit Ten Hag, who quickly identified midfield as an area of the squad in need of improvement

    Had Van De Beek been allowed to depart, then the new United chief would have been even lighter on midfield options

    Van De Beek flourished under Ten Hag's guidance during his time at Ajax, where he initially caught the Man United hierarchy's eye

    And there is every chance that the 25-year-old could still force his way back into the first-team frame at Old Trafford in the coming weeks with his old boss at the helm - even if Ten Hag's arrival has failed to spark an instant improvement in the playmaker's fortunes

    Read more Can United mount a title challenge? Get our FREE daily Manchester United email newsletter

    ['united', 'solskjaer', 'last', 'ten', 'hag']

  • MORE THAN 660,000 MALAYSIANS SIGN PETITION AGAINST GENERATIONAL END GAME

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/28/more-than-600000-malaysians-sign-petition-against-generational-end-game/30289

    09/28/2022, 15:34

    50.0% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 28 ‚Äî In a growing wave of protest, more and more people have joined in the call to stop the Control of Tobacco Product and Smoking Bill 2022‚Äôs Generational End Game (GEG)

    The GEG mandates against the sale of cigarettes and tobacco products to those born from the year 2007 onwards

    But the biggest issue ‚Äî even among anti-smokers ‚Äî is GEG‚Äôs impact on the consumer‚Äôs legal right to choose

    Although the State does limit these abilities through an age prerequisite, it acts as a temporary gatekeeper as opposed to the Bill‚Äôs permanent prohibition with the GEG.‚Äù Datuk Seri Panglima Wilfred Madius Tangau, the Tuaran MP and a member of the Parliamentary Special Select Committee (PSSC) responsible for reviewing the GEG, highlighted his concerns in a series of tweets

    He said, ‚ÄúAs a member of the Parliamentary Select Committee on the Control of Tobacco Product and Smoking Bill 2022, I have raised the constitutionality of the Bill

    Will the Bill survive a constitutional legal challenge from those born in 2007? ‚ÄúThe question is should a constitutional legal challenge be initiated especially by those born in 2007 and after, and if they (are successful) to get the court to declare that the Bill is unconstitutional then the drafting and tabling of the Bill will be a waste of time.‚Äù The tweet seems to point to the fact that the PSSC is divided over the controversial GEG proposal

    There is only one more week left before Parliament recommences and the Bill tabled again to the lawmakers

    In a poll conducted by a local think-tank, 86 per cent of the over 150 retailers surveyed said that the GEG ‚Äúwould add complexity to their business.‚Äù What is more, they believe the GEG will not stop smoking as these young people will either resort to illegal cigarettes (89 per cent), get someone ‚Äúlegitimate‚Äù to purchase cigarettes for them (70 per cent), or perhaps turn to other dangerous substances such as drugs (34 per cent)

    They urged the government to address concerns related to the GEG, which they said can impact their livelihood

    A comprehensive consultation, briefing and impact study should be carried out with retailers to improve the GEG Bill.‚Äù J

    ‚ÄúTherefore, we (retailers) automatically become the frontliners in the implementation of the GEG Bill.‚Äù ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs not forget the issue of asking for identity cards (MyKad)

    ['tobacco', 'product', 'bill', 'geg', 'malaysian']

  • STOCK BEAR MARKET WILL GET WHOLE LOT WORSE WHEN CREDIT CRACKS

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/stock-bear-market-whole-lot-203606645.html

    57.69% Shortened!

    (Bloomberg) -- As crazy as it sounds, all the turmoil that‚Äôs ripped through Wall Street over the past week has still left debt markets in Corporate America relatively unscathed

    While greater than before the Federal Reserve‚Äôs latest jumbo rate hike, risk premiums for investment-grade debt remain modest compared to recent market stresses -- and the intensifying mayhem across bond and currency markets

    Now Goldman Sachs Group Inc

    warns of a potential repricing of corporate bonds that risks adding fresh fuel to the stock rout, as current earnings estimates attach an ‚Äúunjustifiably high probability‚Äù that the US economy will avoid a severe recession

    Meanwhile junk-risk premiums are hovering around 520 basis points, below July‚Äôs high-water mark

    In the UK, 30-year gilts surged above 5% on Tuesday for the first time since 2002, raising fears of an incipient crisis of confidence in a developed-debt market

    To be sure, corporate default rates are still very relatively low

    All that suggests the market is still attributing ‚Äúan unjustifiably high probability to a soft landing, leaving room for downward revisions in upcoming months,‚Äù wrote Goldman strategist Sienna Mori in a note

    Slower earnings growth coupled with a higher cost of capital will hurt the weakest companies, especially in the high-yield market, per Goldman, while Barclays Plc strategists anticipate that a wave of downgrades is barreling toward the US blue-chip bond market

    For now, the market isn‚Äôt yet seeing a wave of bankruptcies

    But should the profit picture darken, buckle up for fresh market fireworks potentially, according to Shawn Cruz, head trading strategist at TD Ameritrade

    ['bloomberg', 'still', 'market', 'corporate', 'stock']

    (Bloomberg) -- As crazy as it sounds, all the turmoil that‚Äôs ripped through Wall Street over the past week has still left debt markets in Corporate America relatively unscathed

    While greater than before the Federal Reserve‚Äôs latest jumbo rate hike, risk premiums for investment-grade debt remain modest compared to recent market stresses -- and the intensifying mayhem across bond and currency markets

    Now Goldman Sachs Group Inc

    warns of a potential repricing of corporate bonds that risks adding fresh fuel to the stock rout, as current earnings estimates attach an ‚Äúunjustifiably high probability‚Äù that the US economy will avoid a severe recession

    Meanwhile junk-risk premiums are hovering around 520 basis points, below July‚Äôs high-water mark

    In the UK, 30-year gilts surged above 5% on Tuesday for the first time since 2002, raising fears of an incipient crisis of confidence in a developed-debt market

    To be sure, corporate default rates are still very relatively low

    All that suggests the market is still attributing ‚Äúan unjustifiably high probability to a soft landing, leaving room for downward revisions in upcoming months,‚Äù wrote Goldman strategist Sienna Mori in a note

    Slower earnings growth coupled with a higher cost of capital will hurt the weakest companies, especially in the high-yield market, per Goldman, while Barclays Plc strategists anticipate that a wave of downgrades is barreling toward the US blue-chip bond market

    For now, the market isn‚Äôt yet seeing a wave of bankruptcies

    But should the profit picture darken, buckle up for fresh market fireworks potentially, according to Shawn Cruz, head trading strategist at TD Ameritrade

    ['bloomberg', 'still', 'market', 'corporate', 'stock']



  • FED TO TAKE RATES HIGHER THAN PREVIOUSLY EXPECTED; MORE PAIN AHEAD - REUTERS POLL

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/fed-rates-higher-previously-expected-001033267.html

    52.17% Shortened!

    By Indradip Ghosh BENGALURU (Reuters) - The Federal Reserve will hike its key interest rate to a much higher peak than predicted two weeks ago and the risks are skewed towards an even higher terminal rate, according to economists polled by Reuters

    But that is unlikely to push the Fed to switch its policy path anytime soon as Fed Chair Jerome Powell and other policymakers have remained blunt about the "pain" to come

    Indeed, over 70% of economists, 59 of 83, predicted the central bank would hike its fed funds rate by three-quarters of a percentage point for the fourth straight meeting in November, a Reuters poll taken after the Fed meeting last week showed

    The forecasts are in line with the Fed's dot-plot projection and current market pricing

    "With inflation this high, history says you need to get at it sooner and you need to follow through

    economist at BofA Securities

    economist at Deutsche Bank, who expects the rate to peak at 4.75%-5.00%

    "The short-run pain of recession would be better than the long-run pain of inflation expectations becoming unanchored." Also, unlike most major central banks, the Fed has backing from a strong currency and a relatively strong economy compared with its peers

    Among economists who had a view through end-2023, only 46% forecast at least one rate cut

    With inflation not seen below the central bank's target anytime soon and the unemployment rate, currently 3.7%, expected to increase at a much slower pace than in previous recessions, a premature cut might hurt the Fed's credibility

    More than 80% of respondents said once the fed funds rate reaches a peak, the central bank was more likely to leave it unchanged for an extended period rather than cut it quickly

    ['rate', 'high', 'predict', 'economist', 'fed']

    By Indradip Ghosh BENGALURU (Reuters) - The Federal Reserve will hike its key interest rate to a much higher peak than predicted two weeks ago and the risks are skewed towards an even higher terminal rate, according to economists polled by Reuters

    But that is unlikely to push the Fed to switch its policy path anytime soon as Fed Chair Jerome Powell and other policymakers have remained blunt about the "pain" to come

    Indeed, over 70% of economists, 59 of 83, predicted the central bank would hike its fed funds rate by three-quarters of a percentage point for the fourth straight meeting in November, a Reuters poll taken after the Fed meeting last week showed

    The forecasts are in line with the Fed's dot-plot projection and current market pricing

    "With inflation this high, history says you need to get at it sooner and you need to follow through

    economist at BofA Securities

    economist at Deutsche Bank, who expects the rate to peak at 4.75%-5.00%

    "The short-run pain of recession would be better than the long-run pain of inflation expectations becoming unanchored." Also, unlike most major central banks, the Fed has backing from a strong currency and a relatively strong economy compared with its peers

    Among economists who had a view through end-2023, only 46% forecast at least one rate cut

    With inflation not seen below the central bank's target anytime soon and the unemployment rate, currently 3.7%, expected to increase at a much slower pace than in previous recessions, a premature cut might hurt the Fed's credibility

    More than 80% of respondents said once the fed funds rate reaches a peak, the central bank was more likely to leave it unchanged for an extended period rather than cut it quickly

    ['rate', 'high', 'predict', 'economist', 'fed']

    Najib's lawyer Tan Sri Muhammad Shafee Abdullah confirmed the upcoming case management date for the review application

    He said the defence has no objection for the court to push the hearing for the RM27mil SRC case in the meantime

    "I have no objection because it has nexus to the first case (involving the RM42mil)

    After hearing parties, Justice Mohamed Zaini fixed Nov 29 for mention in the RM27mil SRC case

    On Aug 23, the Federal Court upheld the Kuala Lumpur High Court's decision to convict Najib to 12 years‚Äô jail and for him to pay a RM210mil fine in the RM42mil SRC case

    On Sept 6, he filed an application for a review on the Federal Court's decision

    However, both channels have reportedly experienced supply issues since the card was introduced

    In May, it was reported that scalpers were selling NFC cards at prices of up to RM100 per card

    He added that the ministry is expected to hold a meeting with TnG this week to find out more about the methods employed in the sale of TnG NFC cards, as well as why there has been a lack of supply of these

    Currently, those wanting a NFC TnG card can do so by purchasing a limited edition United Voice card

    The series consists of 10 card designs, each featuring an artwork from a United Voice artist, with 4,000 pieces of each being available

    The specially-designed card is only being sold at the TnG art exhibition ‚Äì which runs until October 5 ‚Äì at NU Sentral

  • BEATEN AND SOLD THRICE: SABAHAN SURVIVOR RECOUNTS ESCAPE FROM BRUTAL JOB SCAMMERS IN CAMBODIA

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/28/beaten-and-sold-thrice-sabahan-survivor-recounts-escape-from-brutal-job-scammers-in-cambodia/30481

    09/28/2022, 09:36

    73.81% Shortened!

    Eric added that he did not think twice about the offer because he trusted his friend

    When he asked his friend (from Sarawak) about it, the latter told him that he would be traveling to Thailand by car from Cambodia

    Eric said that he was given a handphone in his last place of work in Cambodia

    The first contact between Eric and Phoong was on August 9 where Eric also shared his exact location

    Eric said that he escaped from the place during a police and immigration raid, which was held a few days ago

    Eric explained that he managed to contact his friend to ask him to book a flight for him from Cambodia to Kuala Lumpur

    Phoong said that Eric was using a Cambodian number starting with 855

    Phoong also said that he again received a text message from Eric on September 19 who informed him that there was a police raid and a lot of people were running

    Eric managed to escape on the 24th,‚Äù he said

    He added that Eric‚Äôs aunt made the police report with the help of DAP liaison officer

    When Eric returned to Malaysia, Phoong urged him to share his story with other Sabahans because it was unheard of in Sabah

    ['cambodia', 'eric', 'friend', 'also', 'say']

    Eric added that he did not think twice about the offer because he trusted his friend

    When he asked his friend (from Sarawak) about it, the latter told him that he would be traveling to Thailand by car from Cambodia

  • AFTER UPM SURVEY FINDS STUDENTS ADMITTING TO BRIBERY, DONS MOOT HARSHER PENALTIES AND NEW ANTI-GRAFT SCHOOL LESSONS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/28/after-upm-survey-finds-students-admitting-to-bribery-dons-moot-harsher-penalties-and-new-anti-graft-school-lessons/30485

    09/28/2022, 09:36

    71.79% Shortened!

    According to Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) statistics, civil servants in their 40s and below constituted 57.8 per cent of the 5,652 people arrested for graft between 2007 and August 2022

    ‚ÄúUnder Act 575, convicted offenders face a jail term of not less than 14 days and not more than 20 years

    For the record, the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission Act 2009 (MACC Act or Act 694) provides for a maximum jail term of 20 years

    Since the minimum term is not specified in the Act, it is left to the judge‚Äôs discretion

    She also pointed out that the same modality cannot be used for the execution of punishment for people convicted of corruption and those charged with stealing something from a supermarket

    This, she said, is because people involved in corruption come from various backgrounds and include people of high standing in society and institutions

    ‚Äú(Hence) severe punishment should be meted out to those convicted of corruption to make them repent

    ‚ÄúIt will also reflect the seriousness of the government in fighting corruption as well as serve as a lesson to the people not to get caught up in the immoral activity,‚Äù she said

    Commenting on this, Amini Amir said it is this materialistic attitude that‚Äôs compelling young people to be corrupt

    They should, by right, know that they can be charged under Section 25 of the MACC Act 2009 for failing to report corrupt activities (in their organisation)

    Improve anti-corruption education Amini Amir, meanwhile, said there is a need to improve the anti-corruption syllabus in the education system to enable the nation to produce a new generation of young people who possess a high level of integrity and self-identity

    ['corruption', 'corrupt', 'anti', 'macc', 'people']

    ‚ÄúUnder Act 575, convicted offenders face a jail term of not less than 14 days and not more than 20 years

    For the record, the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission Act 2009 (MACC Act or Act 694) provides for a maximum jail term of 20 years

    Since the minimum term is not specified in the Act, it is left to the judge‚Äôs discretion

    She also pointed out that the same modality cannot be used for the execution of punishment for people convicted of corruption and those charged with stealing something from a supermarket

    This, she said, is because people involved in corruption come from various backgrounds and include people of high standing in society and institutions

  • ASTRO FACES CHALLENGES IN YEAR AHEAD

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/09/28/astro-faces-challenges-in-year-ahead

    09/28/2022, 08:36

    62.07% Shortened!

    But on a slightly brighter note, Kenanga Research said the group has seen an increase in the pick-up rate for their broadband service, about 40% year-on-year (y-o-y)

    The group‚Äôs licensed content from foreign producers could result in an increase in content costs as royalties are denominated in foreign currencies

    After Astro‚Äôs 1H23 results, TA Research lowered its FY23 to FY25 earnings estimates by 8.1% to 20.3%

    Astro‚Äôs 1H23 core net profit tumbled 10.4% y-o-y

    CGS-CIMB Research said costs incurred to obtain the rights to air and stream the FIFA World Cup will choke Astro‚Äôs margins

    It added that Astro is also a victim of the lack of enforcement against piracy in Malaysia

    RHB Investment Bank Research cut its FY23 to 25F core earnings by 10% to 11%

    Despite the results shortfall, HLIB Research said it continues to like Astro as a long-term play

    It believes that an eventual recovery in its subscription and advertising revenue will signal an inflection point which could provide a re-rating opportunity for the stock

    MIDF Research said it was still sanguine on the prospects of Astro as it believes the advertising expenditure environment will improve as the economy further reopens

    It said the upcoming FIFA World Cup campaign in November could bode well for its top line.

    ['fy23', 'astro', 'high', 'content', 'say']

  • YOURSAY | AG'S REPUTATION HINGES ON OUTCOME OF ZAHID'S VLN APPEAL

    https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/637304

    09/28/2022, 08:36

    83.08% Shortened!

    As I said, it was just the word of the accuser without any corroborative evidence

    If the judge had accepted the evidence as such, what is there to stop the AG and the MACC to charge anybody just by the word of a person who claimed to have bribed without any corroborative evidence? The AG cannot introduce new evidence in his appeal to make up for their mistake or oversight in the trial court, unless in exceptional cases where such evidence is new and not obtainable under normal due diligence

    The judge has to give the benefit of the doubt to the accused because as the judge said, the evidence has to be read in favour of the accused in a case of proof beyond a reasonable doubt

    An appellate court has the discretion to permit such further evidence

    In order to adduce fresh evidence at the appeal hearing, the appellant (in this case AG) must bring a motion to do so

    The judge mentioned some of the remark column were left blank

    The crime, if committed, must be back up with proper evidence before the judge can accept it

    Even then, the law requires credible evidence and this rule bites both ways

    So likewise, we cannot claim political persecution if there is credible evidence to substantiate the charge

    It is up to the investigators and prosecutors to gather the evidence for the case

    In this case, it is on the AGC to resift through the evidence in the appeal

    ['case', 'even', 'judge', 'accuse', 'appeal']

    As I said, it was just the word of the accuser without any corroborative evidence

    If the judge had accepted the evidence as such, what is there to stop the AG and the MACC to charge anybody just by the word of a person who claimed to have bribed without any corroborative evidence? The AG cannot introduce new evidence in his appeal to make up for their mistake or oversight in the trial court, unless in exceptional cases where such evidence is new and not obtainable under normal due diligence

    The judge has to give the benefit of the doubt to the accused because as the judge said, the evidence has to be read in favour of the accused in a case of proof beyond a reasonable doubt

    An appellate court has the discretion to permit such further evidence

    In order to adduce fresh evidence at the appeal hearing, the appellant (in this case AG) must bring a motion to do so

    The judge mentioned some of the remark column were left blank

    The crime, if committed, must be back up with proper evidence before the judge can accept it

    Even then, the law requires credible evidence and this rule bites both ways

    So likewise, we cannot claim political persecution if there is credible evidence to substantiate the charge

    It is up to the investigators and prosecutors to gather the evidence for the case

    In this case, it is on the AGC to resift through the evidence in the appeal

    ['case', 'even', 'judge', 'accuse', 'appeal']

    ‚ÄúWhen I mentioned that it was related to Ebit Lew, the woman shared with me screenshots of her conversation with him, as well as pornographic images (of genitals) sent by him to her via WhatsApp,‚Äù he told magistrate Nur Asyraf Zolhani in response to questions from deputy public prosecutor Zahida Zakaria

    The motivational expert, who assisted the victim of sexual harassment involving Ebit Lew, took the witness stand yesterday

    Mohd Fairuz, 37, said he also sent the screenshots shared by the woman to a man named Firdaus Wong, who he said was handling a similar case involving the accused and another woman

    When DPP Zahida asked Mohd Fairuz what action he took after sending the screenshots to Wong, the witness said that on July 27 last year, he telephoned the woman to listen to the full chronology of events with regard to the harassment

    Ebit Lew is a big personality

    So, I don‚Äôt want to lodge a report‚Äô.‚Äù After he made the suggestion, Mohd Fairuz said the woman asked for some time to discuss it with her husband and that she finally lodged a police report on Aug 7 last year

    Mohd Fairuz said he had personally met the woman and was able to identify her in court

    The witness also recognised Ebit Lew, who was sitting at the witness stand

  • BRAZIL VS. TUNISIA - FOOTBALL MATCH REPORT - SEPTEMBER 27, 2022

    https://www.espn.com/soccer/report/_/gameId/652193

    09/28/2022

    52.17% Shortened!

    Rampant Brazil rolled past 10-man Tunisia 5-1 in a friendly on Tuesday with Raphinha scoring twice and setting up another goal in their last game before the World Cup

    - World Cup finals bracket and fixtures schedule Raphinha opened the scoring in the 11th minute with a brilliant header from the edge of the area over goalkeeper Aymen Dahmen

    Brazil were back in front a minute later though when Raphinha found Richarlison ghosting behind the defence and the striker fired a low shot between the keeper's legs

    Brazil extended their lead through a Neymar penalty in the 29th minute after Aissa Laidouni held Casemiro back

    Raphinha scored his second with a precise low shot from the edge of the area in the 40th after a lightning counter-attack

    With victory assured, Brazil eased off in the second half as manager Tite sent on several substitutes

    Brazil will open their World Cup campaign against Serbia on Nov

    More Details Brazil's Richarlison and Thiago Silva react to the incident where a banana was thrown onto the pitch after Richarlison scores the second goal for Brazil

    Mexico played their best half in years against Colombia, but things fell apart quickly for a side that still have questions before the World Cup

    Alejandro Moreno explains why Brazil are the clear-cut favorites to win the World Cup in Qatar

    Alejandro Moreno is skeptical of the United States finding confidence to win games before the World Cup starts in November.

    ['brazil', 'score', 'world', 'cup', 'minute']

  • S'POREANS CROSS THE CAUSEWAY TO BUY USD AND BRITISH POUND

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/28/sporeans-cross-the-causeway-to-buy-usd-and-british-pound

    09/28/2022

    52.17% Shortened!

    Some local money changers said that many were expecting the pound to continue to slide to RM4.80, from the currently traded levels of around RM4.95

    A money changer known as Mohamed said that while there were enquiries, people were still taking a ‚Äúwait and see‚Äù approach before purchasing the pound

    ‚ÄúIn recent weeks, many people, including Singaporeans, have been purchasing the greenback after it hit RM4.42 for each dollar

    Meanwhile, another money changer, known only as Tan, said that many Singaporeans are coming to Johor Baru to purchase certain currencies such as the greenback due to a possible shortage in the island republic

    ‚ÄúEven then, we just sell small amounts for people going on vacation or for our regular customers,‚Äù he said, agreeing that more people would want to purchase the pound if it continues to drop

    Meanwhile, an official of the Malaysian Association of Money Services Business (MAMSB) for the southern region agreed that there has been an interest among people since the weakening of the pound

    ‚ÄúI also see that many are also taking advantage of the drop to purchase the notes as collectible items, especially with the recent passing of Queen Elizabeth II,‚Äù she said, adding that most money changers did not keep much stock of the pound and greenback as part of risk mitigation

    She said at the moment, they would continue to service regular clients, but those who wanted to purchase large sums would need to wait for them to get the supply

    She also expects more people to purchase the pound if the currency continues to slide

    ‚ÄúMore than 15 years ago, the pound was hovering above RM6

    ‚ÄúTo me, those who want to purchase currencies can look at the Singapore dollar or the Chinese yuan as they are stable currencies,‚Äù she added

    ['currency', 'purchase', 'pound', 'money', 'say']

    Some local money changers said that many were expecting the pound to continue to slide to RM4.80, from the currently traded levels of around RM4.95

    A money changer known as Mohamed said that while there were enquiries, people were still taking a ‚Äúwait and see‚Äù approach before purchasing the pound

    ‚ÄúIn recent weeks, many people, including Singaporeans, have been purchasing the greenback after it hit RM4.42 for each dollar

    Meanwhile, another money changer, known only as Tan, said that many Singaporeans are coming to Johor Baru to purchase certain currencies such as the greenback due to a possible shortage in the island republic

    ‚ÄúEven then, we just sell small amounts for people going on vacation or for our regular customers,‚Äù he said, agreeing that more people would want to purchase the pound if it continues to drop

    Meanwhile, an official of the Malaysian Association of Money Services Business (MAMSB) for the southern region agreed that there has been an interest among people since the weakening of the pound

    ‚ÄúI also see that many are also taking advantage of the drop to purchase the notes as collectible items, especially with the recent passing of Queen Elizabeth II,‚Äù she said, adding that most money changers did not keep much stock of the pound and greenback as part of risk mitigation

    She said at the moment, they would continue to service regular clients, but those who wanted to purchase large sums would need to wait for them to get the supply

    She also expects more people to purchase the pound if the currency continues to slide

    ‚ÄúMore than 15 years ago, the pound was hovering above RM6

    ‚ÄúTo me, those who want to purchase currencies can look at the Singapore dollar or the Chinese yuan as they are stable currencies,‚Äù she added

    ['currency', 'purchase', 'pound', 'money', 'say']

    https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/19938633/cristiano-ronaldo-al-hilal-transfer-man-utd/

    09/28/2022, 06:17

    50.0% Shortened!

    CRISTIANO RONALDO "didn't reject" a summer transfer to Al-Hilal, according to the club's president

    But Fahad ben Nafel insisted it was not Ronaldo who pulled the plug

    Instead, he claimed a transfer ban placed on the Saudi Arabian side proved the critical blow

    "The problem was not in the money or the principle, Al-Hilal is able to bring in the stars of the world

    "We did not stop negotiating with the players despite the decision to ban, but we were delaying entering the final stage of the negotiations until the ban was lifted.‚Äù Ronaldo, 37, looked on course to quit United in the summer after the club failed to qualify for the Champions League with just 12 months left on his Old Trafford contract

    Ronaldo has started just once in the Premier League this season - the 4-0 drubbing at Brentford - with Marcus Rashford claiming the No9 spot

    The Portugal superstar did get his first goal of the season from the penalty spot as United beat Sheriff 2-0 in the Europa League

  • HOW DONALD TRUMP PAID LESS IN TAXES THAN A HOUSEHOLD EARNING ONLY $20,000 PER YEAR

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/donald-trump-paid-less-taxes-134111237.html

    59.26% Shortened!

    According to data from the IRS, Americans in the most common income bracket earned an adjusted gross income between $50,000 and $75,000 in 2017 and paid an average income tax of $5,077

    Benzinga hasn‚Äôt seen Trump‚Äôs tax returns and cannot verify the facts reported by the Times

    Real estate offers some unique tax advantages, mainly the ability to write off depreciation against income

    It‚Äôs common for a real estate investor to show a loss on their income tax return while receiving positive cash flow for the year

    Fractional real estate investors also receive similar benefits

    Another likely reason for Trump‚Äôs low tax bills is the use of a tax loss carryforward

    He was able to carry those losses over each year until 2005

    Individual real estate investors use Trump‚Äôs tax strategy every year, which is one reason real estate is such a popular asset class

    Individuals who take part in a crowdfunded offering will receive a K-1 tax document each year, which shows the investor‚Äôs share of net income or loss after deducting expenses like depreciation

    Fractional investment platforms like Arrived Homes simplify the tax preparation process by sending out a single 1099-DIV tax form each January

    Benzinga does not provide investment advice

    ['trump', 'year', 'income', 'tax', 'real']

    Real estate offers some unique tax advantages, mainly the ability to write off depreciation against income

    It‚Äôs common for a real estate investor to show a loss on their income tax return while receiving positive cash flow for the year

    Spain snatched a place in the Nations League final four after striker Alvaro Morata's late goal secured a 1-0 win over hosts Portugal on Tuesday to ensure top spot in their group

    - World Cup finals bracket and fixtures schedule Spain finished top of League A-Group 2 on 11 points from six games, one point above second-placed Portugal who only needed a draw to secure a place in the semi-finals

    "Every time that Spain have to show up in big games we do it

    It was not until he made four substitutions in the second-half that Spain woke up and got their first shot on target of the game after 70 minutes through Morata

    "Portugal have top, top individual quality

    In the first half we had a lot of the ball, I think 400 plus passes, but we'd prefer to have more in the opposition half

    "We corrected that in the second half

    Everyone will think the second half was incredible, but the first half was necessary for that

    In the second half I thought the goal would come

    "We were really well organised in the first half

    Spain snatched a place in the Nations League final four after striker Alvaro Morata's late goal secured a 1-0 win over hosts Portugal on Tuesday

    By Yasin Ebrahim Investing.com -- The Dow slipped further into bear-market territory Tuesday, as investors continue to digest a wave of remarks from Federal Reserve members pointing to further¬†rate hikes that many fear could tip the economy into recession.¬†¬† The Dow Jones Industrial Average slipped 0.4%, or 125 points, and the Nasdaq fell 0.2% and the¬†S&P 500 fell 0.1% and had slipped to nearly two-year low intraday

    All three-major averages fell deeper in bear-market territory

    ‚ÄúTwitter's stock will continue to trade on deal odds as the long and ugly courtroom battle now begins to play out in Delaware courts,‚Äù it added

    Data showing stronger consumer confidence reinforced expectations that the Federal Reserve is likely to stay the course and lift its benchmark rate above 4% by the end of the year

    Consumer sentiment is a leading indicator of consumer spending, which plays a major role in overall economic activity

    The pick-up in consumer confidence, which was driven by falling gas prices, Pantheon Macroeconomics said, ‚Äúmight not last as people absorb the hit from the recent drop in stock prices and the Fed‚Äôs latest rate hikes, with the promise of more to come.‚Äù Federal Reserve Bank of St

    Louis President James Bullard indicated on Tuesday that the Fed had more work to do, calling for further rate hikes that would need to stay at higher rate for ‚Äúsome time to make sure we‚Äôve got the inflation problem under control.‚Äù Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said the current pace of rate hikes was "appropriate," and reiterated the Fed's¬†commitment to bringing down inflation.¬† Energy stocks recovered from a rout a day earlier, supported by a 2% rise in oil prices rose on bets of supply disruptions in the U.S

  • MALAYSIANS CASH IN AS POUND AND YEN TUMBLE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/28/malaysians-cash-in-as-pound-and-yen-tumble

    09/28/2022

    60.71% Shortened!

    With the British pound and yen also taking a beating, Malaysians are quickly capitalising on the drop, mainly for their children‚Äôs education fees, while those looking to travel to Japan have also seized the opportunity to purchase the yen well in advance of their trips

    ‚ÄúPrior to travelling there earlier this month, my family and I exchanged the pound at about RM5.30

    However, during his rounds, Wong found many money changers in Petaling Jaya were out of yen, while one was selling it at 1,000 yen at RM40, above the market rate of RM31

    ‚ÄúOutlets which had the yen were selling at the market rate,‚Äù he said, adding that there were also long lines during his visit to several money changers

    Checks on money changer outlets in the Klang Valley also saw outlets running low on both the pound and yen

    ‚ÄúWe sold out almost every note of the pound sterling, where we only have a five-pound note currently left,‚Äù she said, showing it to reporters

    She added that the yen was also sold out at their premises

    Another money changer, Affin Aizan, said he only had four yen notes left

    ‚ÄúThe pound (notes) finished on Monday night itself, with the yen also currently in high demand,‚Äù he said, adding that they were unsure when more notes would be coming in

    Another money changer, Mohd Padin, was totally out of the pound and yen when met

    ‚ÄúThe calls kept coming in, with some also instantly making the decision to exchange for the pound at our outlet upon seeing the rates,‚Äù he said, adding that his outlet also stocked up on the pound last week

    ['money', 'changer', 'also', 'yen', 'pound']

    In a Facebook post, the Umno president said the government‚Äôs implementation of 16 from among the NRC‚Äôs recommendations already demonstrated that its views were taken seriously

    ‚ÄúTherefore, Tan Sri Mahiaddin does not need to complain as if the government has cancelled the role of the NRC or the NRC has failed,‚Äù he said, using Muhyiddin‚Äôs official name

    ‚ÄúMeanwhile, the NRC chairman is using the council as a platform to promote his political propaganda,‚Äù he added

  • SOCIAL SECURITY IS SLOWLY RUNNING OUT OF MONEY ‚Äî HERE'S WHAT YOU NEED TO DO TO PROTECT YOUR RETIREMENT

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/social-security-may-only-pay-100000245.html

    68.57% Shortened!

    Every year the Social Security Board of Trustees releases an update on the financial status of the Social Security trust funds

    ‚ÄúIt is important to strengthen Social Security for future generations,‚Äù Kilolo Kijakazi, acting commissioner of Social Security, said in a statement when the report was released

    ‚ÄúMillennials already have low expectations for the role Social Security will play in their retirement plans," CEO Ron Mastrogiovanni said

    If policymakers take no action, Social Security could still pay 80% of benefits using its tax income

    Increasing Social Security‚Äôs tax revenues, she says, should address the shortfall and restore solvency as the population ages

    Social Security helps replace earnings during retirement, but it‚Äôs not meant to cover all your expenses

    For the average worker, Social Security replaces about 40% of annual savings before retirement, according to the SSA ‚Äî though that figure varies depending on income

    The average Social Security retirement benefit in August 2022 was $1,627 per month

    That‚Äôs less than $20,000 per year

    If you start collecting your Social Security benefits early, you‚Äôll have less to work with

    Still, the loss of future Social Security benefits can be offset with a ‚Äúconsistent and modest annual increase‚Äù in savings, according to the HealthView Services report

    ['retirement', 'social', 'security', 'year', 'benefit']

    ‚ÄúMillennials already have low expectations for the role Social Security will play in their retirement plans," CEO Ron Mastrogiovanni said

    If policymakers take no action, Social Security could still pay 80% of benefits using its tax income

    Increasing Social Security‚Äôs tax revenues, she says, should address the shortfall and restore solvency as the population ages

    The average Social Security retirement benefit in August 2022 was $1,627 per month

    That‚Äôs less than $20,000 per year

    If you start collecting your Social Security benefits early, you‚Äôll have less to work with

    Still, the loss of future Social Security benefits can be offset with a ‚Äúconsistent and modest annual increase‚Äù in savings, according to the HealthView Services report

  • THESE 2 STOCKS ARE ‚ÄòOVERSOLD GEMS‚Äô WITH OVER 100% UPSIDE POTENTIAL, SAYS ROTH CAPITAL

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/2-stocks-oversold-gems-over-143555265.html

    75.0% Shortened!

    Last month, Lantronix reported its fourth and final quarterly results for its fiscal year 2022

    The headline number was a quarterly top line of $35.9 million, a gain of 74% year-over-year

    While this EPS came in just under the 9-cent forecast, it was up 33% from the 6-cent result reported in the year-ago quarter

    For the full fiscal year 2022, Lantronix reported $129.5 million in total revenues, up 81% from the $71.3 million reported in fiscal 2021

    Looking forward, the company is guiding toward $149 million to $162 million in revenues for fiscal 2023; at the midpoint, this would represent a 20% increase from the ‚Äô22 total

    The shares are trading for $4.74 and their $12.20 average target suggests ~163% upside in the next 12 months (See Lantronix stock forecast on TipRanks) Universal Display Corporation (OLED) The second stock we‚Äôll look at is Universal Display, a leader in the market for organic light emitting diodes, or OLEDs

    They can also be found in lighting systems ‚Äì and give Universal Display a neat stock ticker into the bargain

    Business has been slowing globally, which suppressed demand for Universal Display‚Äôs OLED products, and have put near-term weakness on the company‚Äôs prospects

    While the company reported a 5.4% year-over-year gain in revenues, from $129.7 million in the year-ago quarter to $136.6 million in 2Q22, the figure missed expectations by $14.61 million

    In-line with this upbeat outlook, Searle gives OLED shares a Buy rating and a price target of $208 for the year ahead, implying an upside of 114% for the coming year

    (To watch Searle‚Äôs track record, click here) Most of Searle's colleagues agree

    ['stock', 'searle', 'year', 'company', 'million']

    While this EPS came in just under the 9-cent forecast, it was up 33% from the 6-cent result reported in the year-ago quarter

    Looking forward, the company is guiding toward $149 million to $162 million in revenues for fiscal 2023; at the midpoint, this would represent a 20% increase from the ‚Äô22 total

    Icahn provided two names

    Icahn‚Äôs pick in the energy space is CVR Energy (CVI), which is mainly in the refinery business

    He says that the stock ‚Äúis quite cheap, even though it‚Äôs come up a lot.‚Äù CVR Energy shares have surged 50% year to date and 74% over the last 12 months

    In Q2 of 2022, CVR Energy brought in $3.1 billion of net sales, up from $1.8 billion in the year-ago period

    While the two entities are related ‚Äî CVR Energy subsidiaries own 37% of the common units of CVR Partners ‚Äî CVR Partners is also publicly traded

    ‚Äú[The] fertilizer business, to me, is a great business today,‚Äù Icahn says

    In Q2, the partnership‚Äôs average realized gate price for UAN shot up 134% year over year to $555 per ton

    For ammonia, the average realized gate price rose 193% year over year to $1,182 per ton

    Unsurprisingly, CVR Partners has been another stellar performer in this ugly market as the stock is up 29% year to date

    There is already a chasm between the strong dollar and weak US equities

    While the US Dollar Index has risen nearly 20% this year, the S&P 500 Index has fallen 23%, down to the 3,655 level

    In Wilson‚Äôs view, the S&P 500 will reach an ‚Äúeventual low‚Äù of 3,000-3,400 by year-end 2022 or early next year

    Indeed, the dollar‚Äôs bull run is leaving currency rubble in its path

    ‚ÄúA stronger US dollar is not what the world needs right now,‚Äù says Gave

    ‚ÄúAs [with] Greece in 2015, a game of chicken with the EU will escalate.‚Äù And now, the dollar is coming home to roost

    Morgan Stanley reckons that every 1% change in the Dollar Index negatively impacts profits by 0.5%

  • 1MDB TRIAL: NAJIB‚ÄôS PERSONAL AMISLAMIC ACCOUNTS HAD MANDATE HOLDER, BUT NORMAL FOR ELDERLY CUSTOMERS, BANK OFFICER SAYS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/27/1mdb-trial-najibs-personal-amislamic-accounts-had-mandate-holder-but-normal-for-elderly-customers-bank-officer-says/30413

    09/27/2022, 22:04

    70.27% Shortened!

    Asked by Najib‚Äôs lawyer Wan Aizuddin Wan Mohammed if it was normal for a person or a company which has a bank account to appoint a mandate holder, Uma Devi said this would be only in limited situations

    ‚ÄúFor individual account, no

    Uma Devi agreed that a bank branch officer would usually be in charge of contacting the account holder to ask for the confirmation of cheques

    But in situations where there is a relationship manager at the bank directly in charge of handling the accounts ‚Äî such as for Najib‚Äôs bank accounts, Uma Devi said the bank branch would then contact the relationship manager to ask the latter to confirm the cheques with the account holder

    Asked by Wan Aizuddin if there would be any breach of banking rules if the relationship manager fails to contact the account holder for cheque confirmation and simply says the bank customer had confirmed the cheques, Uma Devi said there would be a breach but with the bank only knowing if the customer complains

    ‚ÄúYes, if there‚Äôs a dispute by the customer, there would be

    Uma Devi then said bank customers should have checked the transactions in the statement of their bank accounts, describing it as a ‚Äúduty‚Äù

    In the bank, we don‚Äôt take that for granted

    So customers will check their account,‚Äù she said

    Uma Devi confirmed she had never seen a remittance amount from a personal bank account larger than this US$620 million sum

    Wedani had previously also confirmed an August 21, 2013 letter from Najib to AmIslamic Bank‚Äôs Jalan Raja Chulan branch manager, instructing for money to be transferred out from his 9694 account to Tanore‚Äôs bank account, and that a sum of over US$620 million was sent from the 9694 account on August 26, 2013 to the Tanore account

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 27 ‚Äî PKR deputy president Rafizi Ramli sought to rally Malaysians today to lodge their opposition to an early 15th general election being called in November when severe seasonal floods have been forecast

    The former Pandan MP said the timing meant vital funds and government resources would have to be diverted towards the election instead of flood mitigation, while politicians would also be busy with campaigning instead of assisting victims

    ‚ÄúGE15 during the flood means more than RM1 billion will be used to manage the election

    ‚ÄúIt also means that hundreds of thousands of civil servants have to be on duty to conduct elections when they should together with volunteers to help flood victims,‚Äù he said when announcing the petition on Facebook

    The floods were particularly severe in Selangor, the country‚Äôs most industrialised state, where nearly half of the 54 flood-related deaths occurred.

  • WOMAN SHARED SCREENSHOTS OF HER CONVERSATION WITH EBIT LEW CONTAINING LEWD PICTURES, COURT TOLD

    Mohd Fairuz Abu, 37, told the court he was contacted by a woman using a pseudonym via the WhatsApp application after he uploaded a post about a preacher involved in a case of sexual harassment with a woman on Facebook on July 26 last year

    "When I mentioned that it was related to Ebit Lew, the woman shared with me screenshots of Ebit Lew's conversation with her, as well as pornographic images (of genitals) sent by Ebit via WhatsApp," he said in front of Magistrate Nur Asyraf Zolhani in response to questions from Deputy Public Prosecutor Zahida Zakaria

    Mohd Fairuz said he also sent the screenshots shared by the woman to a man named Firdaus Wong, who he said was handling a similar case involving the accused with another woman

    When Zahida asked Mohd Fairuz what action he took after sending the screenshots to Wong, the witness said that on July 27, 2021, he contacted the woman via a phone call to listen to the full chronology of events with regard to the harassment

    Ebit Lew is a big personality

    So, I don't want to lodge a report‚Äù," he said

    After he made the suggestion, Mohd Fairuz said the woman asked for some time to discuss it with her husband, and that she finally lodged a police report on Aug 7, 2021

    Mohd Fairuz said he had personally met with the woman and was able to identify her in court

    The witness also recognised Lew, who was sitting on the witness stand

  • PRESSURE ON RINGGIT CONTINUES

    https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2022/09/27/pressure-on-ringgit-continues

    09/27/2022, 19:03

    67.65% Shortened!

    He noted that Bank Negara‚Äôs press release, which was issued last week on the ringgit, is a testament that the central bank will ensure the domestic foreign exchange market will continue to function orderly, and domestic liquidity remains ample to support the economy

    It is important now for the country to continue enhancing its economic and financial resilience, including implementing key reforms to strengthen the fundamental support for and longer term confidence on the ringgit, Lee pointed out

    Meanwhile, estimates among analysts vary but on a more optimistic note, stated that global inflation could start ebbing from as early as the end of this year

    The potential easing in inflation will strengthen the case for global central banks such as the Fed and the European Central Bank to slow down their rate hikes, although the risk is that rate hikes will still continue in the near term

    This will also then reduce the pressure on Bank Negara to raise interest rates

    ‚ÄúNevertheless, the current combination of high inflation and slow economic growth raises the risk of a stagflationary episode,‚Äù Kenanga Research said

    ‚ÄúHowever, underlying price pressures as measured by core inflation continued to trend higher, highlighting that inflation may continue to remain high and would not return to the 2% inflation target anytime soon, despite global central banks‚Äô aggressive rate hikes,‚Äù the research house added

    Meanwhile, Lee said inflation back home may moderate from 2023 due to the projected slower economic growth and domestic demand as well as the high base effect

    Both direct and indirect impact of the weakening ringgit are also at play,‚Äù he noted

    ‚ÄúWe estimate the consumer price index to increase by 3.5% in 2022 and an estimated 2.5% to 3% in 2023,‚Äù Lee said

    ‚ÄúThis brings inflation year-to-date to 3%

    ['ringgit', 'currency', 'lee', 'rate', 'continue']

    He noted that Bank Negara‚Äôs press release, which was issued last week on the ringgit, is a testament that the central bank will ensure the domestic foreign exchange market will continue to function orderly, and domestic liquidity remains ample to support the economy

    It is important now for the country to continue enhancing its economic and financial resilience, including implementing key reforms to strengthen the fundamental support for and longer term confidence on the ringgit, Lee pointed out

    Meanwhile, estimates among analysts vary but on a more optimistic note, stated that global inflation could start ebbing from as early as the end of this year

    The potential easing in inflation will strengthen the case for global central banks such as the Fed and the European Central Bank to slow down their rate hikes, although the risk is that rate hikes will still continue in the near term

    This will also then reduce the pressure on Bank Negara to raise interest rates

    ‚ÄúHowever, underlying price pressures as measured by core inflation continued to trend higher, highlighting that inflation may continue to remain high and would not return to the 2% inflation target anytime soon, despite global central banks‚Äô aggressive rate hikes,‚Äù the research house added

    Meanwhile, Lee said inflation back home may moderate from 2023 due to the projected slower economic growth and domestic demand as well as the high base effect

    Both direct and indirect impact of the weakening ringgit are also at play,‚Äù he noted

    ‚ÄúWe estimate the consumer price index to increase by 3.5% in 2022 and an estimated 2.5% to 3% in 2023,‚Äù Lee said

    ‚ÄúThis brings inflation year-to-date to 3%

    ['ringgit', 'currency', 'lee', 'rate', 'continue']

    For help understanding what a recession is and how to strategize your investments to navigate a down market, consider working with a trusted financial advisor.¬† Is a Recession Coming?¬† Other factors also are part of whether an economy is in a recession

    Even if inflation disappeared tomorrow ‚Äì dropping to 0% for the rest of the year ‚Äì the inflation rate for December would be 6.5%

  • LARRY SUMMERS CALLED IT AGAIN ON THE COLLAPSE OF THE BRITISH POUND. HERE‚ÄôS HOW MUCH WORSE IT COULD GET, ANALYSTS SAY

    https://finance.yahoo.com//news/larry-summers-called-again-collapse-123610197.html

    73.17% Shortened!

    Britain‚Äôs currency is in trouble‚Äîand things could still get a lot worse for sterling, experts warn

    The British pound crashed to an all-time low below $1.05 during early trade on Monday, before recouping some of its losses to trade around $1.07

    Britain‚Äôs ailing currency, which had already fallen to a 37-year low earlier this month, continued its downward slide on Friday after newly appointed Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng unveiled the country‚Äôs biggest package of tax cuts in half a century

    The pound's plunge deepened further after Kwarteng doubled down on the tax cuts, telling the BBC Sunday that there was ‚Äúmore to come‚Äù

    government‚Äôs tax policies, economics and policy experts have been warning that the historically strong pound could have much further to fall

    ‚ÄúIt makes me very sorry to say, but I think the U.K

    is behaving a bit like an emerging market, turning itself into a submerging market,‚Äù he said

    ‚ÄúIt would not surprise me if the pound eventually gets below a dollar if the current policy path is maintained,‚Äù he warned

    Finance Minister under former Prime Minister John Major, said in an interview with the BBC on Sunday that the ‚Äúoverall premise‚Äù of the tax cuts was ‚Äúwrong-headed‚Äù and could lead to economic disaster

    As bad as the fall has been, a number of currency analysts say that the pound has even further to drop

    stays on its current policy trajectory, some have warned

    ['currency', 'pound', 'tax', 'cut', 'market']

  • WITNESS: ISSUANCE OF LOS FOR US$3BIL LOAN FOR 1MDB DONE IN HASTE

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2022/09/27/witness-issuance-of-los-for-us3bil-loan-for-1mdb-done-in-haste

    09/27/2022, 18:01

    50.0% Shortened!

    Tuesday, 27 Sep 2022

    Describing the issuance of the LOS as 'a first of its kind‚Äô and ‚Äòwas done in great speed‚Äô, Datuk Siti Zauyah Mohd Desa, 63, said in her 25 years‚Äô experience in the ministry, that was the first time an LOS was issued by the ministry without conducting a due diligence for the project cash flow

    "There was no current assessment on the joint-venture investment

    In fact, there was none, nothing for us to do due diligence,‚Äù she said during re-examination by senior deputy public prosecutor Datuk Seri Gopal Sri Ram in former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak‚Äôs trial for misappropriation of RM2.3bil in funds from1MDB

    The US$3bil loan was approved by the government via a support letter signed by Najib, who was Finance Minister back in 2013

    The 26th prosecution witness said the projection of cash flow was one of the most important parts in the issuance of LOS for the ministry to assess whether any investment was able to churn out the right kind of income to service the loan

    When asked by Sri Ram why she did not approach Najib herself to air her concerns over the issues surrounding the sovereign wealth fund, Siti Zauyah said she did not have direct access to the then prime minister

    "However, I did approach (then) Finance Minister II (Datuk Seri Ahmad Husni Mohamad Hanadzlah) but he did not want to get involved

    The senior DPP also questioned her about her previous testimony, where the witness said she was instructed by former Treasury secretary-general Tan Sri Dr Mohd Irwan Serigar Abdullah to continue processing the LOS despite lacking the usual process of conducting due diligence

    The trial before judge Datuk Collin Lawrence Sequerah continues this afternoon

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

    ['ministry', 'issuance', 'los', '3bil', 'loan']

  • FUGITIVE BUSINESSMAN 'FAT LEONARD' TO SEEK ASYLUM IN VENEZUELA -REPORTS

    https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2022/09/27/fugitive-businessman-039fat-leonard039-to-seek-asylum-in-venezuela--reports

    09/27/2022

    45.0% Shortened!

    CARACAS - A fugitive Malaysian businessman nicknamed 'Fat Leonard' who is at the center of a major U.S

    Navy bribery scandal wants to seek political asylum in Venezuela after being detained in the country last week, local media said Monday

    Leonard Glenn Francis (pic) was arrested on Sept

    21 at the international airport outside Caracas as he prepared to leave for Russia

    Venezuela's government-allied newspaper Ultimas Noticias, citing judicial sources, reported on Monday that the businessman appeared the next day in a court in Caracas

    He reportedly told the hearing that he wanted to stay in Venezuela to appeal for political asylum and that he was suffering from metastatic kidney cancer, the newspaper said

    Neither Venezuela's Information Ministry nor its Attorney General's Office immediately responded to a request for comment

    Francis arrived in Venezuela via Mexico and Cuba, and planned to continue to Russia, last week's Interpol statement said

    According to that plea agreement, Francis paid about $500,000 in bribes to Navy officials

    Report it to us

    Thank you for your report! Copyright ¬© 1995-

  • PERODUA ATIVA HYBRID SUBSCRIPTION SERVICE IS NOW OFFICIAL

    https://www.lowyat.net/2022/285509/perodua-ativa-hybrid-official/

    09/27/2022, 17:03

    54.17% Shortened!

    Its existence has been made known last month but it is only today that Perodua has officially launched a new version of its highly popular Ativa SUV

    Simply called the Ativa Hybrid, it is essentially a Daihatsu Rocky e-Smart Hybrid that was launched in Japan last November

    In fact, the model is imported directly from Japan albeit with Perodua and Ativa logos on it

    Furthermore, the Ativa Hybrid is being brought here not to boost Ativa‚Äôs sales but more as a test subject for Perodua‚Äôs long-term study on mobility as a service

    Hence, that is why the Ativa Hybrid is being offered only through a subscription service

    The standard Ativa is already part of the EZ MOBi subscription service

    On top of that, Perodua is also studying the driving behaviours of hybrid vehicles in Klang Valley, Penang, and Johor Bharu

    As for the Ativa Hybrid itself, it runs on what Perodua described as a series hybrid system

    Without opening the hood, you can also spot the Ativa Hybrid by its grille and bumper designs which are slightly different from the standard Ativa

    Furthermore, there is no variant label on its bonnet door alongside the Ativa badge

    Unlike the standard Ativa which can be obtained in up to five different colourways depending on specific variants, the Ativa Hybrid is only available in Pearl White

    ['perodua', 'ativa', 'hybrid', 'service', 'subscription']

    Simply called the Ativa Hybrid, it is essentially a Daihatsu Rocky e-Smart Hybrid that was launched in Japan last November

    In fact, the model is imported directly from Japan albeit with Perodua and Ativa logos on it

    Furthermore, the Ativa Hybrid is being brought here not to boost Ativa‚Äôs sales but more as a test subject for Perodua‚Äôs long-term study on mobility as a service

    Hence, that is why the Ativa Hybrid is being offered only through a subscription service

    The standard Ativa is already part of the EZ MOBi subscription service

    On top of that, Perodua is also studying the driving behaviours of hybrid vehicles in Klang Valley, Penang, and Johor Bharu

    As for the Ativa Hybrid itself, it runs on what Perodua described as a series hybrid system

    Without opening the hood, you can also spot the Ativa Hybrid by its grille and bumper designs which are slightly different from the standard Ativa

    Furthermore, there is no variant label on its bonnet door alongside the Ativa badge

    Unlike the standard Ativa which can be obtained in up to five different colourways depending on specific variants, the Ativa Hybrid is only available in Pearl White

  • PROSECUTION RESTS CASE IN SYED SADDIQ‚ÄôS TRIAL, COURT FIXES OCT 6 FOR ORAL SUBMISSIONS

    https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2022/09/27/prosecution-rests-case-in-syed-saddiqs-trial-court-fixes-oct-6-for-oral-submissions/30340

    09/27/2022, 16:01

    47.62% Shortened!

    About Us Advertise KUALA LUMPUR, Sept 27 ‚Äî The prosecution today rested its case after calling a total of 29 out of 37 witnesses to testify in court against former youth and sports minister Syed Saddiq Syed Abdul Rahman who is accused of misappropriating more than RM1 million as well as criminal breach of trust (CBT)

    The witnesses, ranging from Syed Saddiq‚Äôs parents and star prosecution witness Rafiq Hakim Razali ‚Äî who is the former Angkatan Bersatu Anak Muda (Armada) assistant treasurer ‚Äî to MACC officers and members of Syed Saddiq‚Äôs Armada team, took the stand in the trial that spanned 21 days

    During today‚Äôs proceedings, Syed Saddiq‚Äôs defence counsel Gobind Singh Deo raised an issue in which he pointed out that one of the MACC investigating officers Nurul Hidayah Kamaruddin had not been served or shown the defence‚Äôs statements before the trial began

    Gobind said Section 62 of the MACC Act 2009 states that the law requires the defence to hand over to the prosecution a statement of defence before the trial

    He said this had been done to show that the money raised and used by Syed Saddiq during his campaigning in Muar were for political purposes and not for his personal use, as what the prosecution had alleged

    Gobind asked why the investigating officers were not given the defence statement so they could look into the source of Syed Saddiq‚Äôs income

    Gobind said that Syed Saddiq had all the receipts to show his expenditure at the material time in 2018, while also pointing out to the three investigating officers today that he had a steady flow of income from 2011

    When Gobind asked if any of the officers had investigated Syed Saddiq‚Äôs sources of income, all of them answered in the negative

    They said they had only investigated what they were told to, nor did they investigate other members of Bersatu to see if they too had also declared their expenditure to Bersatu‚Äôs supreme council as they should have

    Judicial Commissioner Datuk Azhar Abdul Hamid ruled that Section 62 cannot be tendered by Nurul Hidayah and must be tendered by the defence

    Syed Saddiq, 30, is charged as the then Bersatu youth wing or Armada chief, who was entrusted with control of its funds, with abetting Rafiq Hakim with CBT of RM1mil in funds belonging to the wing at CIMB Bank Bhd, Menara CIMB KL Sentral, Jalan Stesen Sentral 2, here on March 6, 2020

    ['syed', 'saddiq', 'say', 'investigate', 'officer']
